Report #1 from Investigator Okada:
We fell right for their trap.
Maeda, that patsy they're putting on display for everyone, is a decoy.
Killing him would just mean dealing with a replacement.

Report #2 from Investigator Okada:
Learned something interesting today.
Looks like there's another Maeda above him.
I've started calling this guy "Maeda 2."

Report #3 from Investigator Okada:
Maeda 2's cover is that he's an executive at a big company.
He easily makes over 20 million a year in executive pay.
Honestly, I'm kinda jealous.

Report #4 from Investigator Okada:
It was a suicide mission to kill him, but somehow I survived.
But now another Maeda has appeared!
He calls himself Maeda, but who is this man?
Could Maeda just be a codename...?
Damn it! I hope this bastard suffers some terrible fate, like...like always feeling like he has to go to the bathroom!
Research Log 1005, Kuramochi:\nThe worlds that have begun to fuse are reaching maximum levels of chaos.\nThe distortions created by the transference equipment are now altering humanity's creations.
Research Log 1006, Kuramochi:\nI burned the research results.\nI was ready to spend the rest of my life running away from Maeda, but the photo of my beaming daughter guilted me into it...

Research Log 1206, Kuramochi:
Ever since that day, I've been trying to grapple with the results of my research.
I can feel all my years of experience telling me the truth.
There's still information hidden in these materials.

Research Log 0206, Kuramochi:
The mystery only grows...
Where is this world that the parent directory is pointing to?
Could it be that this place is impossible for me to understand?
Is it because I live in the three-dimensional world?
And this "Unlock Key"...
What are these Authors that you seek?
"I know you did it, man."
"I know you did it, maaan."
"I know you did it, maaen. Maena. Maeda."
"I know you did it, Maeda."
Awww... I'm so bored!\nBored, bored, bored!
Won't someone play with me?\nPlay with me, play with me, play with me!
C'mon out already!\nParrah? Noya? I don't care who! I just want someone to play with!
Guh... Great, now I'm hungry.\nGet outta here! You're in the way.

The boy was kind and docile, a child who shied away from conflict.\nIronically, it was his nonconfrontational nature that allowed him to be tyrannized by the other children. Bullies showered him with beatings, and seldom a day went by without him getting kicked or punched.
One day, the battered boy was walking home, one leg dragging behind the other, when an old man appeared.\n"Use this if you wish to get revenge, boy." The man handed the child a handgun.

Day after day, the boy was brought to an empty lot for a beating at the hands of his bullies.\nAt last, the hammer within his heart fell. He brought the gun out from his pocket, pointed it at the boys surrounding him, and pulled the trigger.

But instead of a bullet, confetti flew from the barrel. The old man jumped out of hiding and laughed.
"I can't believe it! You actually took that joke seriously?!" The bullies laughed right along with him.
The boy flew into a rage unlike anything he'd ever felt before and beat both the old man and the bullies to death with the butt of the gun.
The reporter that later came to the scene of the carnage signed off with this telling quote: "Within every heart hides a gun, loaded and ready."

Long ago, there was an emperor who unified the human world by force. It was said that this ruler was able to glimpse the throne of the gods, and in his jealousy attempted to wage war with the heavens.\nAfter many bloody battles, the gods came to him with a peace treaty.\nThe gods officially recognized the emperor and each of his ancestors as the sovereign of all he saw. They bestowed upon him an axe as the symbol of his hegemony.

The current emperor was a small man whose hobby was building vaults. Though an adequate ruler, the man had an inferiority complex owing to the long line of great emperors that preceded him.\nOne day, he noticed that the axe symbolizing his hegemony had disappeared from the court. The emperor was furious.\nHis men looked everywhere for the axe but could not find it. Each new messenger who returned with another unfavorable report was slain on the spot.

The search for the axe was fruitless, each failed attempt another mockery of the frantic emperor.\nIt wasn't long before the messengers no longer reported to him, so afraid were they for their lives. The emperor then turned his ire to the searchers themselves, beheading them to the man.\n"Only someone close to me could have accomplished such a heist..." His suspicions continued to grow, spurring him to oust one chief vassal after the next.

Then, it dawned upon him—The night he'd drank himself into a stupor, taken the axe from the wall, and...placed it in one of his vaults. Fearing the pandemonium that would occur should this truth come to light, the emperor elected to keep quiet.\nBut he betrayed himself a second time, letting word of his blunder slip to a favored concubine. Word spread like a raging fire, and it wasn't long before his vassals joined together to slay him in a fit of righteous anger.
There once was a street performer with a beloved flute.\nHis bold performances filled the people who heard him with courage.

A young man came to the performer and asked, "I want to bravely fight and die for our nation. Play me a song before I leave for the battlefront."\nHe was extolled as a hero after his incredible service in the war.
Rumors of the performer began to spread.\nOne day while playing on the street, a man came to ask if he would play for his son who would not leave his room.
The performer met the man's son and played for him.\nThe boy exclaimed, "My body's bursting with courage!" He the ran up to the roof before giving a bannister a mighty kick and leaping to his death.

There was once a quick-witted dealer of second-hand goods.\nHe worked his way into the good graces of his nation's prime minister, who held more influence than the king. Various doors would open for him...for a price.

The prime minister fell victim to an epidemic and died. His family and retainers were executed by the new king.\nThe merchant went to greet the new king, bringing with him a gift of some value.\nHis generosity pleased the crown, and the man was made purveyor to the new king.

The new king's lifestyle soon turned lavish, drawing his attention away from the political sphere.\nWhen it became clear neighboring countries were plotting an invasion, the merchant colluded with them, selling classified information to the enemy.\nThe royal capital fell to the invasion, and the new king was executed.

The merchant went to visit the neighboring country's king.\nHis court magus told the king, "Your Majesty, please allow me to deal with him."\nWhen the king agreed, the magus cast a spell. This transformed the merchant into a form that better suited him—a weathervane, which tumbled to the ground and smashed into pieces on the spot.
[Regarding an ancient ruin]\nJust a bit of searching has revealed more treasure here than we could possibly have imagined.
[Regarding an ancient ruin (contd.)]\nWhat's more, it looks as though we've beaten any robbers here. This truly is a new discovery.
[Regarding an ancient ruin (addendum)]\nDespite all of this treasure, there are barely any wandering nightmares.\nI'm pleased to say we'll be able to search these remains to our heart's content.

Welcome, you covetous fools!\nMy sincere thanks to you for not doubting the absurdity of an untouched ancient ruin filled with treasure.\nAllow me to show you my gratitude with a gift—the honor of becoming sacrifices for our dark lord!
There was once a magician called Guru who was respected by all.\nWith his dying words, he passed both his title and his beloved staff on to his disciple.
The second-generation Guru took a disciple of his own.\nHowever, he chose poorly, and the disciple eventually killed him. The new disciple then stole the staff and named himself the third Guru.

The third-generation Guru took a disciple as well, intending to pass on the staff and title like before.\nWhat he didn't know was that the second Guru had a son, who avenged his father by striking down the third Guru. The prodigal child then took the staff, thus taking his place as the fourth Guru.

Hah! Oh, how foolish you humans are.
You believe you struggle, fight, and die for the title of Guru, but the truth is always just beyond your reach...
It is I who pushes you to murder!
Now, go! Don't stop! Keep killing!
How do people survive when they're so off their guard?\nYou can get right behind 'em\nand they don't even notice.
Even dogs and cats'll run as soon as they sense danger.\nHumans are just so easy to kill.
Gosh! This is such an easy job!\nWhy don't people do this more often?\nIt pays so much better than some exhausting daily grind.

Humans are weird.
So very strange.
I'm not the weird one.
Yet humans call me weird.
Why can't they see it for themselves?

"Take that cane and strike down our heretical foes," said the holy father as he handed the cane to his priest, now a pagan inquisitor.\nHe thanked the holy father for giving him this great duty, determined to judge all who stood opposed to his god.

An old woman was brought before the pagan inquisitor.
She'd kidnapped and imprisoned a neighboring child to carry out fiendish experiments.
The inquisitor gathered every shred of evidence
and proclaimed her a witch.
She was sent to be burned at the stake.

The pagan inquisitor later judged a woman.
Finding herself in dire straits, she had been unable to raise her own children without resorting to the basest profession of all. Thankfully, the church had exposed her parlor.
Though her relatives and neighbors begged him for clemency, the inquisitor turned a deaf ear.
She was proclaimed a witch and sent to be burned at the stake.

An epidemic swept across the land. The head of an afflicted village was brought in front the inquisition, charged with selling holy relics to raise money for treatment.
The pagan inquisitor deemed this an act of sacrilege and sent him to be burned at the stake.
On his way back from the execution grounds, the inquisitor was dragged into a back alley and beheaded.
The following words were carved into his cane: "The greatest heretic of all shall find judgment in the streets."

[The Convict's Confession]\nThe man claims that when he passed the victim, their arms collided and they began to quarrel.\nAfter the argument, he drew his sword and sliced through the victim's neck, beheading him.

[The Convict's Plea]
Honestly, I don't know why I let my resentment turn the trivial into the troublesome.
It may sound irresponsible of me, but it's the honest truth.
I would just like to ask that you show forgiveness.

[The Head Vigilante's Diary]
I discovered something when I showed the sword to a priest.
It seems that within it lies the soul of a murderer whose resentment caused him to cut down everyone around him.
But we've confiscated it now. That should be the end of it.

[The Executioner's Final Moments]
Where's that convict's sword? Ugh, and I was thinking of pawning it off to help pay for my bar tab.
Hmm? Wait... Where did you get that...?
H-Hold on a second... Why are you looking at me like that?!
S-Stop it! I only ever hit you out of love! As your father, I...
D-Don't––!

There was once a black knight who was feared by all for his military prowess both on and off the battlefield.\nWhat's more, he boasted a comprehensive understanding of magic. He called upon his abilities to slay the king and support the young prince, whom he served as a guardian.\nNot a soul dared oppose their rule.

Patriotic soldiers gathered in secret to discuss how to defeat the black knight.\nYet, overthrowing the man seemed impossible. His strength was terrifying... Demonic, even.\nAs they struggled, a merchant appeared and told them, "Just let me deal with the black knight."

The merchant received an audience with the black knight and offered him a gem.
"I gift unto thee a gem that grants three wishes," he said.
A genie appeared when the knight took the gem. "Your three wishes, my master."
For his first wish, the delighted black knight asked for eternal youth.

Ever concerned about his frightening appearance,
the black knight then wished for a pleasant countenance along with limitless magical energy.
The genie bowed and said, "As you command!"
A moment later, the black knight had been turned into a doll.
From that day onward, he was passed from person to person as a charm, beloved by all.

The only notable thing about the young man was his size. His parents ever claimed that he ate more food than he deserved, and rained insults and blows upon him.\nOne day, the owner of the local inn appeared on their doorstep. "I'd like to hire your son," he said.\nThe next day, the giant went to work at the inn.

The innkeeper gave the giant a hand axe and told him to chop firewood.
He chopped a large pile in no time at all.
The innkeeper praised him, treating him to a feast as a reward.
Never in his life had the giant been commended, and he was moved to tears.

Wicked-looking men appeared one day and attacked the innkeeper.\nMoneylenders to whom the man was indebted, they came to hurt him nearly every day.\nThe giant was enraged when he saw them beating his benefactor. Taking the axe in his hands, he demolished the assailants' skulls.

The giant was arrested. His dull mind prevented him from explaining the motive of his crime, and he was therefore given a life sentence.\nThe innkeeper came to visit the giant in prison and spoke to him warmly. It took all his effort not to break into song.\nAfter all, the giant had been the perfect pawn to wipe out all his debts.

One day, a man watched as his homeland was consumed by flame. His loving parents, the girl next door he'd fancied, his peaceful life... All taken from him.\nThat day, the black knight of vengeance was born.

His journey took him across the land, where he was quick to make—and slay—countless foes. So many, in fact, that the armor protecting his body began to reek of the blood that stained it.\nStill, a girl he met on his travels begged him, "Live with me." But he did not take her hand.

The black knight eventually tracked down the mastermind of the fire.
The arsonist wept and clung to the knight, begging for his life...but that would not stay the knight's avenging blade.
As he looked upon the mangled corpse, the black knight could hear the sound of crying.
It seemed that even this wretch of a man had someone who loved him.

But even vengeance could no longer sate his blade.
Some he killed for a price; others, for fun. Murder was the only thing that filled the void in his heart, but never for long.
One day, a man appeared before the knight.
"With your death, I will finally have revenge!"
Strange... The man bore an uncanny resemblance to a sworn enemy he'd slain long ago...
My father raised me all on his own.\nIt was only natural that I began to help him out. It was a way for me to repay the man who had always been there for me.

My father was a blacksmith, but he was held back by his awkwardness. He had trouble selling his products, despite their quality. Unable to take it any longer, I began to sell his work for him, and soon his weapons flew off the shelves.

However, my father had stopped working recently.
It started out as a break for his health,
but it wasn't long before I began to worry about our future.
Fearing for our fate,
I decided to be strict with my father.

The next day, I found my father's cold body on the floor of his workshop.
All he had left was a brand new spear and a letter written in a dirty scrawl.

My tears flowed freely well into the night.

When I woke in the morning, a child I'd never seen before stood in front of me holding a sword too big for his body.
"Mornin', Dad!"
He shot a carefree smile before running in my direction.
The fact I had no recollection of this child shook me to my core.
Not only that, he carried such a large sword.
It sent chills down my spine.

The child regarded my terror with a confused look.
Concern was written across his small face.
"What's wrong, Dad? You're acting strange."
I burst into an angry rant. By the time my head had cooled, the child was gone.
I opened the door with trepidation, only to find the child sitting by the garden, sword in his arms.

I finally decided to hear the child's story.
I had taken him into my care when I'd stumbled on him wandering with nowhere to call home. He had been living with me for over a month. I even confirmed this story with several of my friends.
It was all true.
It seemed I had forgotten everything about our time together.

But how could I possibly raise a child?
There was simply no way.
One night as the boy slept, I picked him up, his small arms still clutching the giant sword.
I carried him all the way to the mountains, where I left him before returning home.
Yet, cruelest of fates, that's when I began to remember my time with the child.
I recalled the bonds that had formed between us, and tears stung my eyes as they fell. "Ah... So that's what happened..."
Overcome by regret, I ran back to where I'd abandoned the child.
I ran and ran, even after I'd realized the boy was nowhere to be found...

"This is a boat for three. There's no room for you."
Jerks. There was clearly space left for me to sit.
The other boys returned my wounded stare with satisfied grins.
That sight is now carved deep into my heart, returning unbidden no matter how hard I try to forget.

That anger changed something in me.\n"I'll get back at them...some day." That thought motivated me more than any other.\nI began to work hard in my studies, and by the time I was a young man, I'd grown to be the envy of all who saw me.

Days and months passed, and soon I found a job where I could earn money through the labor of others.
I knew just what to do with those funds. Building a sturdy ship became my life's mission.
"The water level on this island is climbing every year.
I'm sure the day will come when I'll need this boat."
Zealous determination was the engine that drove me forward.

At long last, the day had come.
The birds had left the island en masse, and intense rain, the likes of which we had never seen before, poured from the heavens day after day. Certain that the island would sink, I boarded my ship.
Other men, of course, came from their homes as if to board themselves.
"This is a boat for one. There's no room for any of you." I said with a wealth of emotions, pulling the oars in my hands to brush away my bitter past.

The village had a custom where each child received a small bird from the elder on their tenth birthday.\nOne boy had received a beautiful, blue-winged bird.\nHe gave it a name and promised to care for it.

Many days passed before the boy woke to the bird's chirping. It was morning, and they rushed to the woods to eat together.\nThe boy and his bird spent all their time together, growing stronger each day.
When the boy turned fifteen, he was summoned by the elder.\nThe gorgeous bird stood on his shoulder, well-behaved.\nThe elder then told him of the ritual needed to make him a man.
The boy wailed as he strangled the bird.\nBy the time he tore its brilliant wings and consumed its blood, the boy had already accepted the life he would lead as a hunter.

There was once a noble archer who served a temple. He had a beautiful wife, and the two of them made a stunning couple.\nOne day, the lover of the archbishop was killed. Furious, the holy man delivered a notice.\n"I will give whomever captures the culprit anything they want."

Enraged by this unjust murder, the archer began to investigate. However, he could find no notable evidence.\nOne night, the archer visited a pub. The younger brother of his wife was there, and the two shared drinks and spoke for the first time in ages.

The next day, the archer found himself imprisoned.
A government official appeared and explained to him that a split personality of his had been committing murder after murder.
His wife, who had the misfortune of seeing this, asked her brother to get him blackout drunk and arrest him.
The archer's pleas were futile, and he was soon executed.

"That went well."\n"Indeed."\nThe archer's wife and the archbishop smirked. The two had been committing adultery, and when the archbishop's lover pressed him for marriage, he plotted to kill her before eliminating the archer as well. His wife brought the archbishop into the bedchamber, where her husband's bow adorned the wall. Their immoral relationship was finally free to continue.
Meeting the talking fish somehow altered my awareness, giving me the ability to hear the voices of fish ever since. How the howls of that sashimi platter pierced my soul...
"Why do tuna gotta keep swimming in order to stay alive? I'll tell ya why! Here's a biiig hint—we breathe through our gills!"

"When we breathe, we inhale oxygen that's been dissolved in water, but there's something special going on there!\nBecause there's not much oxygen in water, y'see.\nIn order to breathe effectively, the flow of blood inside the vessels that need the oxygen goes in the opposite direction from the water we take in..."
On and on he went...\nGranted, I had been wondering why tuna had to keep swimming to stay alive, but that curiosity didn't stop me from biting down on that delicious, raw fish flesh.
Meeting that talking fish gave me the ability to hear the voices of all fish.\nI used to munch on them without a second thought, but the sashimi I ate today asked me something...

"I was born and raised on a farm contracted by a major food supplier.\nMy parents, my closest friends, and my lovers were all born and killed based on the whims of humans. All so that we could become sashimi."

"My end was predetermined from the time of my birth.
Was there any meaning to my story?
Humans have toyed with us for our entire lives.
Who determines our fate?"
I couldn't answer the fish's questions.\nEven if I could, I felt like the answers would be...inconvenient.\nSo I stopped thinking and shoved the sashimi into my mouth.

[History of Social Gaming]
2009
Domestic social networking sites
were available and third party
games had become a possibility.
GREE announced that they would be expanding into this market.

2009
Social gaming titles that had been developed in the US were gaining popularity
in Japan and some of these tiles were earning billions
of dollars a month at peak times in a market
that was rapidly expanding.

2012
The smartphone gaming market was gaining a lot of attention. With titles earning
monthly revenue of tens of billions of yen a month, social games companies
that would exceed the market capitalization of major consumer companies
were quickly established.

In 2017, the social games industry had grown more feature-rich as mobile devices continued to advance.
Development costs skyrocketed, and the industry began to lose momentum.
What will become of social games as amidst a changing market?
Only time will tell.

A rod from a time when illustrations of fishing rods...looked like fishing rods.
Okay, so the previous sentence may not make any sense, but that doesn't mean it isn't true!
Fishing Star illustrations would go on to change the perception of fishing rods in innovative new ways.
It was a profound and mysterious thing, like a caterpillar's metamorphosis into a butterfly.

The first change involved enhanced decorations.\nThere was now a firm line between the rods in the illustrations and those seen in the real world.\nThese designs emphasized features that had nothing to do with catching fish.

Focus began to center on themed designs, changing the direction of rods forever.
Now, on the eve of its tenth anniversary, the designs of fishing rods are approaching godhood status.
*Note that this is not figurative.
They are actually mythological.

In other words, fishing rods are now designed to look like humans and beasts.
"If you're the fan of a popular social, possibly mobile, game, your designs have to be godlike."
Could that have been the mercenary approach at play here?

Whatever the reason, an incredible number of god-motif fishing rods were created.\nIf you find yourself wondering, "What the hell does that even mean?!" then please, try playing Fishing Star.\nThere you will find the final step of the gaming industry's evolution (probably).
I may be unlucky, but that's okay. However, I do not have the courage to bring bad luck into my environment.\nAll I can do is act in misfortune when immorality is close by.
If it is true, you can place yourself in unlucky environments. I drifted through schooling and got a mediocre job. I ate and was vain like everyone else.
You see a contradiction.\nIndeed. I agree with you.\nBut humans are creatures of contradictions. Big contradictions and small contradictions.

I am much more sensitive to my own misfortunes.
I don't care about the misfortune of others.
Do you think I'm broken?
Well, I'm not. This is just how the world is.
But it's a very boring human who doesn't have some emotions that deviate from society's standards.
The emperor who follows the path of might sits in the north.\nThe emperor who follows the path of justice sits in the south.\nWith opposing views, they clash violently.

In both lands there were many who excelled at battle and the morale of the troops were high.\nThe war continued for many years with neither giving an inch.\nThe people grew tired and started to rebel against their lords.

God saw what was happening and sent an angel.\nThe angel pierced the two warring lords with a single strike.\nHowever, the crown prince of the east, who had been attempting to broker a ceasefire, was also struck.

News of the death of the crown prince reached the king of the East. He flew into a rage.\nHe rallied his many troops and ordered those in the north and the south to kill everyone.\nThe final clash of sword and flesh…
This is an item made by an artisan infusing a soul into it.\nThis is a bow with the blessings of the wise.\nThis can exorcise all evil.
The bow had the power of ten men.\nIt was so powerful, it was impossible to draw.
The warrior received the bow from the king to great acclaim of the people as he set out on his campaign.\nAll were joyous at the thought of him ridding them of the evil beings.

Now a demon uses that bow to threaten humanity.\nBrave men were killed as they sought to fight back. The strongest bow in the world had fallen into the hands of the wicked.\nThe evil threat was constant.

I am an unlicensed backstreet doctor. Please don't call me doctor out loud.
I am skilled, but that doesn't make me less of a villain.
I'll treat you if you pay, no matter what horrific crimes you've committed.
I don't shy away from the illegal procedures.
Just contact me, no questions asked.

I went with a prostitute. She was a poor girl who had not been loved by her family and had been abused by her father.\nI took her in. I told her I wanted her to have my children, but she was unsure.\nOne day, she was caught in the wheels of a carriage and died of her injuries.

I brought her to my home and checked her over.
Her external injuries were only the start. Several of her organs were seriously damaged.
There was such a slim chance she could be helped but I would do what I could. I lay down next to her and administered a local anesthetic to myself.
I removed one of my own organs and transplanted it into her body.

Once the surgery was over, her breathing returned to normal.
It was only then that I noticed… The man next to me was me!
Somehow I was inside her breathing body.
I had laughed at stories of souls residing in organs, but it was true!
I could stay here.
And when my child was born, I would be born. It was perfect!

The first prince knew that the king wanted the second son to inherit the family legacy. So the first prince sneaked into his bedchamber and killed his father with the royal sword.\nAn evil eye appeared on the blade and stared at the first prince.\n"I see you." The voice resonated in his head, shaking him to his soul.

The first prince took the throne and ruled justly.\nBut each time he looked at the royal sword, an evil eye stared accusingly back at him.\nHe urged his ministers to look at the sword but they said that they could see nothing unusual.

The king called an exorcist to have the blade exorcised of its evil spirit.\nBut as soon as the ritual was over, the magical eye remained, staring the king down.\nAfter that, the king lost his mind and turned into a tyrant.

The second prince couldn't take it anymore and sneaked into the sleeping chamber to kill his older brother with the royal sword.\nImmediately an evil eye appeared on the blade and stared at the second prince…

The knight was born as the heir to a great school of martial arts. But the rumor was that he was timid and incapable.\nIt was said that his general father had trained him to use a hammer, and so he was efficient with that.

The kingdom was annexed by a neighboring kingdom. A minister was sent to control the day to day running and the king was nothing but a decoration.\nAt around that time, the king's guard commander fell ill and died.\nThe minister replaced him with the son of a general who was rumored to be incapable.

The minister enjoyed falconry.
Just before setting out, there was a lightning strike and the boy who would become a king's guard cried out.
The minister scolded the boy.
During the hunt, the minister released a lion at the king in an attempt to murder him.

The commander wielded the hammer cleanly to kill the lion.
He apprehended the cardinal and collected evidence of the assassination plan. He denounced the neighboring kingdom.
The neighboring kingdom lost their credibility internationally, and withdrew.
The commander made the cardinal complacent and then pulled the rug out from under his feet.
Our meeting tonight is fated. So let me tell you the story of an unimportant violinist.\nI was once a member of a group of famous knights.\nBut seek high and low, and you won't find trace of us now.

Before battle, after a victory, after a loss.
Happy times and sad times.
When there was something to celebrate and when there was nothing to celebrate.
I would play my violin whenever and for whatever, and everyone danced.

That night everyone begged for an encore. I played my violin.\nHowever, the sound startled some birds who then panicked some enemy troops. It was like dominoes…\nThe place was quickly turned into a bloodbath by our knights.
Look. No legs. It's not a great look.\nI cannot leave this plane and I am stuck here as a spirit.\nEvery night I play the violin for everyone even now and even though it killed me.

The locals gathered salt and seafood from the sea for a living.
But there were many tsunamis and the economy suffered for it.
The king asked the lord of the sea to stop the tsunamis from coming.
The whale ignored the king's request and chased him away.

The king spoke to the whale many times.
The whale asserted that it was only the law of nature and the negotiations did not proceed past that.
There was a minister of the opinion that they should use military might but the king refused to take this stance.
As dialog continued, the whale caused many tsunamis.
The minister tried to blow up the whale, but the king stopped him.

The king kept working for a resolution and finally the whale was moved by his efforts, and promised to inform him when a tsunami was approaching.
Soon after that, the tribes that inherited the wilds attacked his land.
The king visited their encampment unarmed to sue for peace.
But the barbarians laughed at him and slaughtered him right there and then.

The whale causes unequalled tsunamis, destroying barbarians.
A few centuries later…
A pioneer discovered a shrine on a lone island deep in the sea. On its altar, he spied a magnificent staff.
There was no one alive by then to tell them that this was the grave of a king who loved peace and the staff had been a gift from the Water Emperor.

The management of social games aims to improve certain parameters generally called KPIs. Basically, KPIs, which are set targets, are parameters selected in relation to sales. I would like to give a brief explanation of two representative KPIs.

KPI Lesson ①　DAU (Daily Active Users)\nDAU is the total number of users who have logged in on that day. This number can be well over a million for top ranking apps. It well exceeds the number of visitors a theme park can expect to welcome in a day. The impact these types of game apps can have cannot be underestimated.

KPI Lesson ②　PUR (Paid User Rate)\nThe number represents the number of paying players. Simply, this is the number of users who will pay for grimoires that day. If you can increase this number, sales will improve.

No one will be able to guess what sort of an impact an event with Fishing Star will have on KPI. Perhaps it was like that since birth?\nOr perhaps the environment of the Lord made it so?\n The Lord had become obsessed with war.
At first, I thought it was a sense of mission\nand it was the same with those who manipulated me.\nHowever, that seemed to be my misunderstanding.

"You will feel death close by. But on the battlefield,
you will forget the sorrow."
 The Lord murmured to me in the hazy light of the moon.
I realized finally that the hand
he grasped me with was trembling.

"If we meet again,
that will be the end."
With those words, the master fulfilled
my wish and dedicated Hakone to me.
From then on, I have slept,
believing in the day that he will visit.

At first I resented my Lady, who took
precious time away from me and my beloved.
However, when I met my brother, and saw how
she supported him in his injuries, I changed my mind.

"I will need you at the end."
My Lady suddenly started to say
very nihilistic things and often.
Now I look back, I suppose she knew
that her time was drawing near.

The moment when I would fulfill my promise had come.
The words came to my lips without conscious thought.
My will to prioritize my own feelings
over my duty as its blade must
have been the influence of my Lady.

I didn't want to feel this pain.
This feeling did not fit with myself drenched in blood.
But I only knew that now.
The feelings they had when they entrusted the end to me...
I screamed out my gratitude up
until the moment my beloved went cold.

By order of the Emperor Go-Shirakawa, 
100 dancing girls would perform a rain dance.
However, no one could make the rain come.
Just as they started to give up, my Lady's beautiful dance managed to reach
the heart of the divine and the rain started to pour down.

My Lady received requests to dance from all over, as the best in Japan.\nFinally, my Lady dancing through the blessed rain in the rain dance at Sumiyoshi caught the eye of Yoshitsune. After a secret rendezvous, my Lady became Yoshitsune's lover.

However, life with Yoshitsune did not last long.\nAfter parting with Yoshitsune at Mount Yoshino, my Lady was captured. She was compelled to dance honoring Kamakura by Yoritomo, who had created a reason for Yoshitsune to commit suicide. However, my Lady danced to a song matching Yoshitsune in her mind.

Further, Yoshitsune's child was murdered by Yoritomo. My Lady was broken since that day. Or maybe it just broke her even further if that were possible. Because the child could not have been hers and Yoshitsune's...

A relationship of a day. A dance of a moment.
The reason why my Lady did not open her heart to others was simple.
She was scared. She was scared of getting too close
to someone and then being abandoned.

That is why she did
not give me a name.
But Yoshitsune had saved
my Lady.

However, it did not last long.
The moment of separation that my Lady feared so came.
But my Lady did not break down. She hid her tears.
She found comfort in the strength of Yoshitsune's dance.

The seasons changed and summer came.
After a dance at the Minamimido,
my Lady said to me.
"Thank you so much..."
And for the first time she called me by a name.
It was as beautiful as a dance.

As I was tidying up, my eyes were fixed on something. It was a diary where the happiest days of my family had been recorded. My father had been a bad man who had used his own family to make weapons, but I could not die without reading it.
Before I realized, the sun was setting. My eyes were heavy. I needed to be fully awake to record the secrets of the world so I decided to get a good night's rest.

An old king held a great birthday party for his eldest son.\nThere, a witch who predicted many prophecies came forward. She said, "The wicked god has spoke to me! Your Grace! Your son will die before he reaches his tenth year!"
The king executed the witch and burned all of her prophecies.\nHe hired many skilled guards and only those who had been loyal to the royal family for three generations could enter the palace.

The king was afraid that the crown prince would be poisoned, so he employed three food-tasters.\nThe rooms of the crown prince were cleaned and searched everyday.\nThis relieved the king as he watched his son grow up big and strong.

When the crown prince turned ten, he greeted the people on the balcony with his father.\nBut he had been protected too much. His body had become weak against viruses and he caught a cold. That night he was taken by a high fever.

This was a battlefield in which the conscripted men fought. Everywhere you went, you could hear the sounds of weapons clashing and screams filled the air.
The terrible noise was heard day after day.
And so the man swung his great sword.
And gradually, the noise faded and order was restored.
That was a battlefield in which physical bodies made noises in front of the man.\nHe swung his great sword and the bodies fell silent one by one.\nOrder was restored once more.

This was a town. It was the first thing the man came to after the battle. Noisy bodies once again came before him. But this sound was different... Sadder.\nHe swung his great sword again. These noisy bodies also fell silent.\nOrder had been restored once more.

It was a town somewhere. The boy could make our voices.
"Are you alive…?"
He could understand that it was an elderly man's voice as his memories started coming back to him.
But swinging his sword, the voice fell silent like the other creatures' voices had.
The unpleasant noise was gone again
and order in his world had been restored.

The king was a schemer, and he rose up to be the leader of the allied kingdoms.
With such impressive power, feudal lords sent young princesses to him curry his favor. He gave them all rooms in his palace.
There were 1000 of them in total.
The gatekeeper of their rooms was a knight who could not hear or speak.
He dutifully guarded the gate, poleaxe in hand.

One night, several of the concubines tried to make their escape. The gatekeeper did not wait for the king's orders after apprehending them and cut off all their heads.\nThe vassals feared that it would result in a worsening of the relationships between the king and the feudal lords, so they urged the king to punish the gatekeeper.\nHowever, the king prized loyalty above all else, so he did not punish him.

The kings of the smaller kingdoms had rebelled.
The palace guard had not killed the concubines but instead had repatriated them.
He was revealed to be a spy who had infiltrated the king's closest confidence. His deafness and dumbness was all an act.
The king was furious and attempted to capture the guard, but he swung his poleaxe and fled in a trail of blood.

A few days later, the gatekeeper came to the castle with a white flag tied to his poleaxe as a messenger from the feudal lords.
After one-on-one negotiations, the king agreed to allow the feudal lords their independence.
The former gatekeeper had learned from his stint in the palace that the king was impotent.
He had used that information to secure the release of the concubines.

There was a girl who was terrible at social relationships.
One day at a stall, she purchased something that she hoped would make her popular.
As soon she blew on the flute, a crowd gathered an applauded the girl.
The girl was enthralled that finally she had found her spotlight.

Word of the girl's amazing performances reached the ears of the feudal lord who asked that she perform at his wife's birthday party.\nThe girl, who had simply enjoyed the act of playing, now practiced in earnest.\nAnd so she took on a low profile.

The day came to perform in front of the empress.\nThe empress was a cold woman who had earned the nickname "Iron Heart." She loved music and ruthlessly beat those who missed a note.\nThe girl was overcome with stress and had practiced until she passed out. But she managed to get through it.

A ship fell from the sky, crashing to the ground.
The girl played a flute to convey feelings of friendship from all of humanity to this life from outer space.
If just one note was out, the aliens would feel uncomfortable and then who knew what would happen then.
The girl muttered to herself, "How long must I be strong for?"
A noble house had a magnificent elder son and a slovenly second son.\nThe parents wanted to maintain their legacy, so they gave the family heirloom to their elder son.
The eldest son who received the staff was very devout.\nHe gained popularity and respect.
The second son, feeling left out at home, had decided to leave.\nThe eldest son regretted that he had not been more caring and prayed every day for his younger brother.

Several years later, the second son who had found his path now boasted a successful career.\nThe oldest son had been ridiculed for his devoutness and so the family inheritance fell to the second son.\nThe oldest son was joyous that his prayers had been heard.
There was a lone girl there.\nIn the living room was a puppet in the shape of a beast.
One day the girl could not finish all her meat and left it in front of the puppet.\nShe looked away for a second and when she turned back, the food had gone.
The girl was a picky eater, and she couldn't eat all of the meat.\nBut then one day she began eating as much meat as she could get hold of.
The changes came one after another. The girl was covered in hair and became the beast puppet.\nThe girl puppet gobbled up her own parents.

There was once a mayor who believed in the spirit of volunteering.\nHe realized that the well water of the town was insufficient for the people and this pained him. He did everything he could to find a new source of water.\nHowever, the town had little funds and it was impossible to draw water from the outside.

The mayor traveled everywhere until the soles of his shoes were bare but there was no one who would lend the money.\nThat night, a fairy stood on the mayor's pillow. She offered the mayor a sword with the words: "I see your true soul. Take this sword."

The mayor took the sword back to the town and thrust it in the ground. The ground cracked and water burst from the crevice.
Hearing the news, villagers from the neighboring kingdom came to ask for help.
The mayor happily went with them to create a similar source of water.
But for each channel of water he created, changes were happening within him.

The mayor forgot his spirit of service. He came to demand a price for creating the water channels.
He became rich. He drew up plans for a water palace and employed laborers.
On the day construction was to begin, he thrust his sword deep into the ground.
In an instant, a huge deluge flowed from the earth and submerged the entire area, drowning the mayor with it.

It was a magnificent birthday. The boy had received so many gifts, and among them a beautiful box had caught his attention.
"Wow! A Jack-in-the-Box. It's amazing! Who gave me this, Mama?"
"That's strange. It doesn't say…"
His mother looked at the box with an expression of confusion but the boy did not care. He wound it up and a clown jumped out.

That night the silence was shattered by the boy's scream.
"What is it?!"
"There was a clown at the window with a knife! It was so scary!"
He cried into his mother's chest as she comforted him.
"You should have tidied your Jack-in-the-Box away if you don't want to see such dreams."
The clown jerked unnaturally floating above the open lid of the box.

The boy sinks into his bed again once his mother has left.
The clown gently rocks in the darkness.
"If I close the lid, I don't need to be scared."
The boy slowly approaches the Jack-in-the-Box.
Behind him, with a knife in its hand, stands a clown.

The boy was discovered brutally murdered the day after his birthday.
In his hand was a bloodstained Jack-in-the-Box. It was deemed to be cursed and burned in a church.
The unsolved incident was forgotten by the collective consciousness. A few years later, a similar box was in a store.
A girl tugged on her father's sleeve and begged him to buy it for her.

Day after day a bloody feast was laid out in the arena famous for its pleasure and vice in the city.
Slaves from all across the world came to compete for defeat or victory.

Among these slaves, there was a poet who loved to play the harp.

There was a prince who suffered from a terrible shyness. His father, the king, had made his name as a great villain. He knew that his days were numbered and so started to prepare for when he was gone.\nHe sent a letter to a merchant and a few days later he received a mask.\nIt was apparently a magical item that could transform the character of its wearer.

The prince put the mask on and his fear slipped away.\n"This mask is only temporary. I will make myself stronger so I do not rely on it. I will overcome my difficulties," he said to his father. And with that his father could rest in peace.

The prince followed in his father's footsteps to become king, but he was aware that his capabilities fell far short of his father's.\nHe did what he could to not be afraid of governance, but most times he could not do it without the aid of his mask.

He wore the mask so often, that at some point it became a part of him. He lost his gentle nature and he became an arrogant person.\nHe angered kingdoms who had been close allies since the days of his father. When people plotted against him, he burned the castle and ordered cruel executions.

Now I'm an orphan and all alone.
But it's okay. There are lots of things to eat here, too.
But will want that special soup again.
I can make it alone, I think.
Come closer and take a look!\nThis is the flute-off will decide the best of the best!\nWho do you think will win? Place your bets!
This "flute-off" caused a hullabaloo, but honestly, I didn't have the ability to win...\nBut it wasn't a problem. I had a trick up my sleeve.
After the man's performance, I stepped up with confidence.\nOn the stage, I put my lips to the flute.\nAnd then, a cold metallic tone. There was no hope for me.

I did not let myself be overcome by this flute, its metallic noise projecting towards the crowd. I continued my work as a legendary artisan of the world.\nOn the other hand, the flute had taken the spotlight by unfair means. It destroyed my body, caused me pain and brought about my end.
When I was a child, I looked to God.\nMy grandfather had been hit by lightning and burnt to a crisp in a strange smelling puff of smoke.\nSince then, lightning was my God.
I never spent any time with the other kids my age and just kept to my books.\nI wanted to know if I could create lightning myself.

I understood that lightning and electricity operated on the same principles so I devised a way to store electricity in a bottle.\nI used trial and error to work out if it could be used as a source of energy.

My mind was blank and I couldn't think of any good ideas.\nI told myself that I had to do my best and upended the bottle.\nIn that moment, I was surrounded in a light blue electrical discharge. I journeyed to the clouds where the gods were waiting.

The general had a dark heart and was fond of torture. On the back of his blade was a saw to cut off the flesh of his prisoners.\n"My favorite thing is to slowly cut away at the neck of a victim to make them talk." His proclamation sent shivers down the spines of many.

One man in particular had resisted the general for many years, but was one day finally taken prisoner.\n"I will tell you everything, just don't torture me," he pleaded. The general sneered that torture depended entirely on the value of the information he had to give.\nThe man grinned. "You wife and I have been having an affair. She's been telling me your movements and that's how I escaped you for so long."

The general screamed like a mad man and beheaded his prisoner.
He ran back home and yanked his wife up by the scruff of her neck.
"How long have you been cheating on me?!"
The wife pleaded and defended herself, but the general was unforgiving. He then slowly but surely cut into her neck with his saw.
She died of shock instantly.

The general attended the new year's celebrations.
The wife's elder brother ordered the troops to surround him and the general was apprehended.
"You listened to slander and murdered my little sister! You will pay for it!"
The executioner decapitated the general with a saw inch by inch. A miserable and painful death.
I'll stab that man to turn him around.
With a firm purpose, I stabbed him.
I stab him with a clear mind.
I don't care how he feels, I just do it.\nA clean thrust means I've succeeded in my task.
The girl who became my bride lived in misery, constantly crying.\nShouldn't a husband and wife have affection for each other?\nShould love not build between them?
Why couldn't I have been born a human?\nWhat meaning is a body that cannot give another satisfaction?\nI want to be an existence worthy of you.
I could fly, shake my tail, and rub my moustache, yet you only tremble with fear.\nI cannot give make you smile or provide comfort.

If your own happiness can only be gained by letting go, I will accept my sadness and release you.
Shake this staff if ever you are in trouble.
The dragon never forsakes those once joined.
Although you are a sacrifice, you are my dear wife.

There was once a troubled young man. Since he was a boy, he had been a talented violin player and had won many awards.\nHis master was a kind man, and looked after him well.\nOne day, the young man was careless and broke the violin his master had given him.

Regretful, the young man apologized to his master. The master forgave him with a smile and presented him with a new violin.\nAlthough this one was of more valuable, the young man remained unhappy and fell into depression.

It was as if his talent was blocked. No matter what he did, he couldn't play a pleasing tune.\nAnyone who heard it, including his master, could tell that something was wrong.\nWorried about his student, the master invited him on a retreat to try and lift his spirits.

Upon arriving at the hut, the youth beat and killed the master.
It was a few months later the youth went down the mountain with a violin in hand.
The tune it made pleased him.
This violin had been renovated by peeling skin from his master's bones and using them as strings for his instrument.
There was once a well-educated and very talented magician.\nThe man had an artistic nature, spending each of his days thinking of ways to entertain people with his magic.

The magician visited a salon of artists where he found the kindred spirit of an intelligent prince.\nThe magician gained the patronage of this prince and used ice magic to create a magnificent sculpture.

The prince was enthralled by the magician. "Don't hold your talents back. I will do anything for you."\nThe magician had him raise enough money to purchase an entire city and had a grand sculpture built.

As soon as the prince was crowned, his land fell into the grips of war. No kingdom was free from the devastation.\nThe magician used his ice magic to freeze the stars of the sky. "I will give you the world in repayment for your benevolence," he said. And in so doing he completed a spell, the like never seen before.

Ever since I can remember, I have seen things that others can't.
I can see the darkness.
A quiet, suffocating darkness.
That is why I walk with an umbrella.
Each time someone asks why I carry an umbrella on rainless days, I tell them that darkness is falling and if too much falls, it'll bring chaos on the world.\nNot one person had understood me.
As I continued on my way, I met others with umbrellas.\nI listened to their stories and found I wasn't the only one who could see this darkness.\nWe stuck together and began to congregate.

Then one day, the looming darkness had started to grow. The end of the world was nigh.\nWe who held our umbrellas open were the leaders in this world. And it would be us to create a new legacy in the lightless world.
I wonder why ♪　I wonder why ♪\nWhy is it that the source of life is considered to be on earth?
I wonder why ♪　I wonder why ♪\nMo is an essential trace element of all creatures on this world. Why is it only present in the composition of the planet?
I wonder why ♪　I wonder why ♪\nWhy is it that the genetic code of the creatures of this planet all so similar?
I wonder why ♪　I wonder why ♪\nCould it be that highly-evolved aliens threw a single seed on to this planet and from that all diversity was created?
This sword brought great calamity when in the possession of a great exorcist.\nThe exorcist tried to break the sword's curse, but his water supply broke and flooded his home.
The broken water supply could not be restored. Upon waking the next day, the exorcist went to draw water from the well.\nThe exorcist then slipped and fell into the well.

The sword of calamity was presented to an altar. When the exorcist offered a prayer, images rushed into his mind.\nHe saw a warrior killing the water god with the sword, only to be cursed to bring floods wherever he may be.

The exorcist went to the barren desert and prayed to the Whirlpool Sword for floods.\nThe sword caused rains to fall for many years, transforming the desert into a lush and fertile land.\nThe curse disappeared naturally. And the exorcist won acclaim for his work.

The king of a frontier country that had been suffering chronic food shortages underwent dramatic reform with a wise prime minister.\nThe idea was to fell a large forest that occupied about 20% of the kingdom and convert the whole area into agricultural land.

The king went to those who lived in the forest and explained his deforestation plan to them.
Each person reacted differently. But the king sincerely listened to all of their feedback and demonstrated that he understood how the common folk felt.
Among them, one lumberjack stubbornly
refused to leave.

The woodsman was a respected holy man, said to communicate with all manner of beasts.\nThe king's minister warned that if the woodsman continued to decry the move, he might undo all of the efforts they'd spent convincing the people otherwise.\nThe king heeded his minister's counsel and ordered his men to kill the woodsman and stage an accidental fire, burning the houses and the forest to the ground.

When the deforestation had finished,
the king and his minister went to the fields with tools in hand.
Dusk fell, and an envoy came from the castle to escort them home. What awaited them instead was the gruesome sight of the king and his minister's bodies, gruesomely cloven in two as though by some heavy object.
To this day, parents from this country threaten their children to behave, lest the holy man with an axe comes to punish them.

I swept my gaze over the attack units that stood across the bank from the troops I'd assigned to defend them, then raised my face heaven-ward. "It's hopeless!" I cried.
To think the enemy would be commanded by the greatest general of our time!
I had optimistically staged a modest defense hearing that he had taken to his sick bed, but I appeared to have been misinformed.
At this rate, my forces were doomed to defeat, with my head on the line!

I responded to his majesty's summons and appeared before his elder counsel, seated all in a row.
"What are our chances at victory, tactician?" my lord asked.
I swallowed hard, desperate to restore some moisture to my dry throat, and spoke after a time.
"If the wind cooperates and delivers the fire true, the enemy forces will surely go ablaze, from which they shall not recover."
The king slapped his knee merrily.
"Very good! I'll leave it to you, skilled tactician," he said with a wide smile. "Now convey us unto victory!"

The king had no idea of the glaring flaw in the plan I spoke of.
At this time of year, the wind only blew in the direction our ranks were formed. Even if we were to blast fire at the enemy, the wind would surely carry it back to us instead.
I exhausted all of my efforts to turn the tide—I prayed for rain, and even paid good money for an expensive priest.
Yet despite my best efforts, no divine wind blew.

I boarded a ship and began to flee downriver.
As I sailed, a shabby-looking man brandishing a staff appeared on the ship quite without warning.
"So you're the one who harries the god of wind, eh?" he snorted.
The old man vanished without another word.
The wind switched directions, and my ship began to sail toward the enemy forces.
"Would that you had changed the wind sooner, god of winds!" I wailed. At the last of my curses, my head split from my neck and tumbled before the elderly general at the enemy's forefront.
I saw the myriad ways in which justice was dispensed.\nI saw the same of evil, as well.
Yet for all the evil I strike down, another appears just as quickly to take its place. Does the world I seek lay at the end of a never-ending cycle of such battles?
Day by day, I began to lose sight of what these battles mean. Do I fight only to fight again and again?\nBy now, these doubts of mine have all but become certainties.
The only choice I am now left with is to cling to his words:\n"There is meaning in everything."

None in all the world could match the hero's blade and he feared nothing,\nhis heart ablaze with the righteous fury of justice.\nHis steadfast nature bordered on inflexible at times, but the people loved him all the same.

When the hero laid eyes on the princess, he was immediately taken with her. Whether awake or in his dreams, she commanded his every thought.\nThe hero penned her a letter declaring his love and went to deliver it to the castle, but he was rudely turned away at the gates.

But he was a hero of dauntless resolve, and would not let a trifling matter such as this dissuade him.\nHe donned a maid's uniform and disguised himself as a woman, sneaking into the palace to see his beloved princess.

As the warrior approached the courtyard, the princess was attacked by a would-be assassin.
He screamed "attack!" He then grabbed a poleaxe from the rack and killed the assassin.
The princess, who later became queen, called him the "Piercer" from that moment on.
The warrior was said to be in love with the queen and spent his life alone because of his affections.

There was once a girl who had lost her mother. Her father did not treat her well and she was abused daily by her stepmother.
Not able to take any more of her mistreatment, she left home.
The girl roamed aimlessly until she arrived at an abandoned shrine. She decided to spend the night there.
An old man with disheveled hair appeared
and asked her what the matter was.
The feeling of being alone and in despair overcame her hesitancy to trust a stranger.\nThrough sobs, she told her whole tale.\nThe old man sighed and told her she could rest one night here.

She closed her eyes.
There was a strange light in the darkness and the smell of flesh being roasted.
She didn't like the atmosphere, but she had no energy to be curious and her eyes stayed closed until the morning.
The next morning, the old man was gone.

While the girl was wandering around her home, her father hugged her relieved that she had been found.\nHe said that her stepmother had been burned up by mysterious flames in the middle of the night.\nShe thought back over the events and wondered whether the old man had helped her.

According to the stories, the cult's operations are supported by the cash donations of its believers.\nThey didn't request large donations, just a tenth of everything you earned. God would give his blessing for just this small amount.
It was a good thing that I had chosen this cult. The cult used my donations as God wished. I never heard any stories of them using the money to enrich themselves as one heard with other faiths.
We could ask when we wanted to know what our money was being used for. When I checked the records, I could see that every penny was being used properly. This was a truly good organization.

A month has passed since the founder ran away with the donations. Everything I experienced in the group had been a lie. Through all of that, I have been deceived. But I have become accustomed to this way of life and I couldn't change now.

When I sleep,
things come to my mind.
Who does that voice belong to?
It is so very calm.
So many things become one.\nMy mind is so confused.\nBut the same words keep going round and round.
A terrible sadness.\nWater itself stings.\nAnd a door is closed.
You shall play the organ.\nAnd the door of deciet shall open.\nSince songs are unaffected by historicity.

I took up dangerous jobs day after day and spent my nights in the bar.
That was the life of a mercenary.
One night I was having a great conversation with an old friend.
We discussed women and great nights.
In my drunken state, I let slip something I didn't even know I knew. "You are not going to believe this, but I have the Mysterious Blade!"

I was very trashed so I don't remember the reaction of the people at the bar.
It wasn't until the next day when I was in the town trying to shake off the hangover...
Suddenly my arm was pulled behind me and I was plunged into darkness.
A man dressed in a robe said he had heard my story in the bar and demanded that I hand over the Mysterious Blade.

"What are you saying?"
A crowd had built so they left me. But after a few days, they pressed me again.
I knew I was in danger, so I moved my lodgings and started to research this Mysterious Blade.
But I couldn't get any good leads.
I had no idea what this thing was apart from for some reason I had said its name.

I passed out drunk one evening and woke up in a dimly lit room.
I realized that I was restrained and there was blood dripping from my face.
A man stood in front of me with a knife.
"Hand over the Mysterious Blade."
"What the hell is going on here?!"
I screamed and he cut the tongue from my mouth and it flopped to the floor as a slab of pink flesh.
After a tortuous interrogation, I died a lurid death.

There was a rumor that treasure lay in the old king's tomb that the explorers had discovered.\nThe explorers overcame the traps that had been laid to protect the tomb and finally passed through a hidden passage to find a door. They had reached the chamber!\nThis chamber was huge. In the back lay the king's coffin. Beside that was a great staff.

The explorers approached the coffin. Surrounding the coffin were human statues, placed there to protect the king's body.
As they approached, there was a strange noise. It came from the staff. Its words echoed inside the heads of the explorers.
"Silence, you are in the presence of the great king."
The explorers were unable to speak under the power of the staff, and their eyes closed.

The explorers couldn't move in the silence and the darkness. They could hear something approaching, but they could not open their eyes to see what it was. The sound approached them and then they heard something right next to them.
The noise sounded like teeth tearing into fresh flesh. But no one could speak or open their eyes to see. I could feel something on my ear and then there was a sharp burning pain.\n"Silence…"

The people of the kingdom were exhausted and demoralized after long years of political and economic turmoil.\nOne of the ministers brought an old harp from the royal treasury.\nIt was said in the kingdom's legends that the harp had once saved the kingdom from the brink of destruction.

It was warned that the harp should not be used lightly, but the king wanted to do something to raise the kingdom up. He played it.\nAs soon as it was plucked, the people of the kingdom found new life.\nFarmers and traders were productive, and civil servants created plans to rebuild the land.

But the violin's effects did not last long and the people once again lost their vitality.
The king ordered the harp to be played again.
The people were once more reborn.
Each time morale dropped, the harp would be played and the kingdom would prosper.
However, mysterious reports from medical professionals started to come in speaking of a sickness affecting the children.

The harp was played periodically.
But it didn't seem to have the effect it used to anymore.
The courtiers had started to gossip that there was a correlation between the sickness in the children and the harp being played. But no one took these theories with any seriousness.
They were right, though.
An increasing number of babies were even being miscarried.
These are the commands of the king.\nFirst.\nThe king is the servant of the people and it is his duty to ensure their wellbeing.
Second.\nThe king is the representative of the kingdom and as such he is the guardian. He must always be careful of his words and actions even in private.
Third: \nA ruler is duty-bound to pass ruthless judgement at times, assuming responsibility for everything that comes with it.
Soon our kingdom will fall to the enemy.\nI do not want to see this beautiful land and wonderful people lose their dignity.\nI will awaken the gods of evil and destroy this whole world!

Once upon a time, there was a great wealthy kingdom.
The young king had no companion in life so he wedded a young woman.
The queen was beautiful to look at and had a pure heart, but
she carried a burden in that wherever she went,
she brought bad luck with her.

The country deteriorated on the arrival
of the queen and it fell into poverty.
The people demanded that the queen be executed.
The king arrested her and locked her up.

The queen apologized for the decline of the kingdom
and said how much she wanted the kingdom to prosper even if it cost her life.
The queen's pleas changed how she was viewed and she became a patriot of the kingdom.
The king and the people were all moved.

The king then visited the queen for guidance
in his governance.
The queen's guidance was pure and
she pointed the way to go, but she still bore
her curse and the kingdom fell.
Gepetto and the Author.\nWhich is most important to me?
It depends on the time and place.\nThat which is closest to me is most important.
Perhaps either is fine...\nIf they will command me...
It's okay if there were no more people.\nOr bugs, or plants, or machines.
I'm sorry, Snake.\nI have realized.\nHow you truly feel toward me.
While I cannot return those feelings, I do want to be together forever.\nThat is what I really want.
I know the truth.\nIt was you who was starting the rumors about Orc.

I know.
I am the weakest and the greatest burden.
So I cannot face you anymore.
Sorry, Snake.
If only she were gone...\nWe'd be together forever.
She destroyed our friendship.\nShe got in the way. I hate her.

I want to be her number one again. 
I want her by me always. 
I really love her. 
So... I...
I'm sorry, Bird.\nI do really hate Orc.
She could not notice the misfortune of others, but she was sensitive to her own misfortune.\nI immediately noticed that she had taken a disliking to me.
Think about the meaning of those words.\nAnd then realize the great gap between me and them.
Snake is fine.\nShe only has reasons to hate me.
But, you know.\nThe one who pretended to help me, and only looked down on me was you, Bird.

[The Hero Family -The Son's Chapter-]
I'm good with a sword, and my magic is strong. If I'm not the hero of this story, then who is?
One night, Mother came to me and said, "Tomorrow's your 16th birthday. It's high time you left home to defeat the evil overlord."
"Finally!" I whooped, then rushed to grab our family sword from the cellar.

[The Hero's Family -Mother's Chapter-]
I whipped up breakfast then went over to my son's room to open his door, same as always. What I saw inside make me yelp in fright.
I rubbed my eyes again and again, squinting to make sure. Oh, it was him, all right. Laying there on my son's bed just as easy as could be was the evil overlord, the dastardly creature of legends.
The demon groggily raised himself from the bed, then opened his mouth wide to reveal a row of jagged, gnarly teeth, and...he unleashed a massive yawn.

[The Hero's Family -Father's Chapter-]
I did what I could to work my family down from their frenzy, then opened my son's door a crack, peering inside.
A few moments later, I returned to the table to see my wife and daughter's anxious faces looking back at me.
"That boy's not your brother anymore. His soul's been taken by Satan, the evil overlord," I declared.
"It's our duty to take him down as a family!"

[The Hero Family -The Little Sister's chapter-]
I did it! I killed my big broth—er, no wait. I killed Satan, the evil overlord!☆
I didn't even have to leave home to do it. Not bad, huh? ♪
 Once he was dead, I took big brother's—ugh, I've gotta stop that. I took the EVIL OVERLORD'S sword all for myself.
——When I woke up the next day, something felt wrong. I got out of bed, looked in the mirror, and staring back at me was the face of the evil overlord I'd killed yesterday...

A more proficient navy couldn't be found in any other harbor town in the world. They charged dauntless into battle, rifles held high without a care, heedless of the suffering or hardship that awaited them. People from far and wide knew the strength of their fellowship, and their bonds were more steadfast than any family's.

Early one morning, one of the navy men was found dead in an alleyway.\nHis body lay riddled with gunshot wounds, spent cartridges from one of their own rifles littering the ground nearby. Paranoia took hold of the soldiers, suspecting that someone among them had murdered him.

Where men once laughed together, an air of distrust spread within the ranks. \nIn the midst of this discord, a party of pirates attacked their city.\nThe soldiers split into two groups, hoping to capture the pirates between them under the cover of night.

The navy was decimated by the time the sun rose. \nEach group had tried to attack the other from behind, ultimately showering their own comrades in a hail of bullets. \nThe pirate captain's lips twisted in a sneer. His plan to set them at one another's throats had paid off in spades. All it had taken was a stolen rifle.

...An endemic of poverty and disease.
Trading one's own daughter for a handful of coins.
One country was the same as the other in that regard.
Life was misery for all but the aristocratic few.
That was the way of life in the past.

Time went on, and we enter the current age.\nWith the advent of laws and plumbing, the population has flourished, having access to a better life than could have ever dreamed of 100 years ago.\nAnd yet misery flourishes right along with it.

Misery constantly changes its form, where people thrive, it is never far behind.
Dizziness, nausea, ringing in the ears, stomachaches, headaches...
It rears its head wherever one searches for respite.
The misery of this age quietly gnaws at the mind.

I've heard before that the majority of mental fatigue can be traced back to interpersonal relationships.\nIt's too bad you can't choose your superiors or your classmates, though.\nThat would make everyone so much happier.

An old story was passed down there in that village.\nAll you had to do was throw three rocks into the crescent moon's reflection on the water in the dead of night, and legend had it that the reaper would appear.

A woman familiar with this legend went down to the water and threw three rocks into the moon's reflection, one after the other.\nThat's when the vision of a young woman brandishing a scythe faded into focus from the darkness... The reaper had made her entrance.

The woman tearfully told the reaper of her betrayal. She spoke of her former best friend, who had not only stolen the woman's betrothed, but went on to pay man after man to cruelly violate her in turn.\nShe begged the reaper to exact vengeance on her behalf.

As the woman finished, the reaper swung her scythe in a grand arc.\nThe woman's head fell from her neck like the crescent moon above, eyes still wide with shock.\nShe'd hoped her story, born from an intense jealousy of her friend's many blessings, would inspire the reaper to take her friend's life, but the reaper had seen through her fabrication like so many lies.
A little baby boy was once abandoned in the wild.\nA proud wolf happened upon the baby boy and plucked him off the ground, taking him home to raise with her pups.
In time, the baby boy grew to be a young man. \nHe hunted alongside his canine siblings, outracing them and shooting down his prey with a bow of his own make.
One day, a group in resplendent finery appeared before him. \nThey claimed the boy was the last living member of the royal family and insisted he come with them.

But the boy, neither understanding their human words nor having the slightest desire to abandon his wolf brothers, chased the party from his home. \nTo this very day, some say the king without a crown still wanders the mountains and valleys.

The Solar Deity rains his light upon the land, bringing with it vitality and healing, transforming the barren wilderness into a land of plenty.\nThose who accept his bounty worship the deity in turn, naming themselves his children and sowing their numbers throughout the world.
Their march knows no rest, and with time, their numbers shall spread to cover the continent as a cloak of blood.

The Children of the Sun are full of their Lord's protection, their divine mission: to banish the darkness of the world with the light of their Lord.\nIn due time, the blessed Children of the Sun shall suffer no more of the world's impurity and then shall they pray for the advent of the Solar Deity's radiant spirit.

The Children of the Sun shall offer up a thousand prayers and a thousand more lives in hopes of his grand revelation.
When their supplications are reached, their god shall manifest as a staff.
So shall its light spread, enveloping the corners of the world. 
And once all is burned within its glow, the world shall be at peace...

"Please reply."\nIf you have worries, please let someone know.\nThey can help.
"Please reply."\nIf you are unhappy, please let someone know.\nThey can help.
"Please reply."\nIf you have doubts, please let someone know.\nThey can help.

Our restrictions on free speech are insane.\nBesides the media, people even have to police what they say.
The people here are insane.\nThey take their own lives to escape their shackles of confinement.
The people running this place are insane.\nThey strip their subordinates of free thought and demand that they work like machines.
The people running this place are insane.\nThey don't realize that they're the most mechanical ones of all.

"Eating."\nIt's a natural part of life. \nBut "to eat" means something unique only to us.
"Just right." \nOne person's definition of what's "just right" might not match someone else's.\nIt's a vague state of being.
But what does it mean to be "just right?" \nAnd whose opinion matters most?
That, I don't know. \nWhatever it is, all I know is that it means everything to us.

In a far-off island nation to the east, there was a kingdom whose nautical might was second to none. The people there lived with hearts that were pure, just, and beautiful, and the island had never known a defeat in written history.\nThe captain there was a peerless man who wielded a mace.

The warrior was not only brave of heart, but noble and beloved by all.\nVoices clamored for the decorated warrior to be named the military leader of the land,\nbut he would quiet them each time, saying, "It is not in me to rule."

When a foreign ship came carrying a commercial treaty to the ruler of the island nation, he unilaterally struck it down.\nIn retaliation, a warship from the Four Seas surged upon the kingdom, and her naval forces were driven to the brink of destruction.\nThe night before what would surely be their final table, battle, the fearless captain bade his men to drink and make merry, saying, "Let us protect this pure, beautiful land until the bitter end!"

That very night, the warrior was bound tightly in his sleep and shoved into a coffin, beloved mace and all.\nThey heaved the coffin from the edge of the ship and watched it sink into the dark depths of the sea below.\n"We never would have gone to war, if only you'd agreed to rule," his subordinates spat, then went to their enemy, waving a white flag of surrender.
A tune echoes in the midnight forest; beautiful, yet somehow sad.\nSuch is the music that soothes the souls of the departed.

In living life they sought fame and glory.\nNow, their ambitions left unfulfilled, these forlorn souls continue their aimless journey through the dark forest, never to be the protagonists of their own worlds.
The instrument plays its song, reviving memories of past glories and soothing their troubled souls.
Yet the song is brought to an abrupt end by a melody that foretells a tragedy... Just as abruptly as their lives were cut short.
By the grace of the gods, you have the right to be happy.
By the grace of the gods, you deserve to be surrounded by friends and those you love, and to be blessed with an enriched life.
By the grace of the gods, you will never go hungry, nor will you shiver from cold or swelter from heat.
By the grace of the gods, you are allowed to live.\nRejoice, rejoice, rejoice.
One day, I met a strange woman who sold drugs.\nShe said after just one hit, it'd be the only thing on my mind.

It sounded interesting enough to me.\nThere are millions of ways to get someone to do what you want them to, but they all took some kind of prep work.\nI found this unique in its simplicity. Just one dose would do the trick.
The drug seller counted my money with a smug smirk, then scampered off.\nI was eager to try the drug, so I stopped at a nearby village.

I sat down at the bar and mixed the drug into my beer, then chugged it down.
I waited about two hours, but I was still stone-cold sober.
That's when I realized I'd been scammed.
Well, no skin off my teeth.
The money I'd paid her with was fake, too.

I am a hand of the law; it is how I keep bread on the table.\nI hear the charges, listen to the accused's testimony, examine the overall picture using proof and evidence, and then pass my judgement. If I sentence the accused to death, I drop the axe on their necks with my own two hands.\nSince I pass the sentence, is only right that I carry it out.

I hold myself to the same rigid standards as those I judge. For that reason, I have never been late to a proceeding, nor even an execution. I like to tell myself that I am ever late to the execution grounds, I should rethink my sentence, as that would take a true act of divine intervention.

I was on my way to the execution grounds to put a particularly devious con-man to the blade.\nPartway there, a prostitute standing by the side of the road caught my eye. She approached me with a coquettish air, inviting me to sample her wares for free.\nI scrutinized her carefully, then realized she was the con-man's wife.
