The resulting explosion killed everyone, including all the miners and the wealthy owner, who was conducting an inspection at that time.\n—In order to convey this tragicomedy to future generations, the townsfolk took the gear which had been found at the demolished mine and donated it to the museum.

[Middle-aged man who passes you by on the street]
Ahh, I want a woman. I want a woman so bad.
I want to undress all the women I can.
I guess I'll never find a good-looking woman, someone better than the old lady next door who just died.
I wonder if at the very least I could find a plump and lewd old lady.

[Wealthy-looking woman coming out of an accessory store]
I am clearly prettier than her and have a nicer personality, and yet they say my little sister's husband is wealthier than mine!
I couldn't accept such a thing, so I hired some thugs to attack her.
Ahh ha ha ha ha! Serves her right!
How dare she look happier than me!

[Chubby woman in a restaurant]
That old hag at the other table is looking at me funny... It pisses me off!
Yeah, that's right, I'm in my thirties and still unmarried. So what?
It's all my parents' fault, they gave birth to this ugly body of mine and didn't teach me how to be a good housewife!
Oh, the food's here!
I'm going to fill my gut because as long as I'm eating, I'm happy!

[The locksmith's proverb]
Ever since I was a child I have always been able to open the locks deep within people's hearts at will.
I have seen things I did not want to, and known things I wished I did not know.
—Because of all this, I was severely depressed until the age of 16.
I recently acquired a large supply of gunpowder.
During the New Year's celebrations, when the King and Queen make an appearance, people from all over the country gather together.
That will be when I will blow up everything, including myself.

[Halberd of Black Judgment - At the bar]
I was studying the profile of a man at the counter.
He slapped some cash onto it to pay the bill and staggered drunkenly out of the bar.
Without hesitation I got up and followed him outside towards a blind alley.
‘You're that guy who's on the "Wanted" posters. You're that prisoner from Rainbow Light Country who escaped, right?'
With a vertical slash of my halberd I slaughtered the prisoner.

[Halberd of Black Judgment - At the street market]
That mother had come to the street market to do some shopping with her child.
As she was choosing which apples to buy, her child poked a finger into an orange and eventually tore a hole in it.
The mother, however, pretended not to notice and continued evaluating the produce.
Without hesitation I approached her and placed my hand on her shoulder. ‘Aren't you going to teach your child some manners?'
With a horizontal and then a vertical slash I chopped the mother and child in two pieces which tumbled onto the ground.

[Halberd of Black Judgment - At the main avenue]
I picked up my halberd from the blacksmith's after he had done some repairs on it and strutted down the main avenue.
My eyes met those of a man walking in the opposite direction.
‘What the hell are you looking at! Huh?'
A horizontal slash. The man's head flew into the air with a fountain of blood and then fell onto the ground.

[Judge Leon's diary]
What a day… A unanimously death sentence.
That man was so lost in delusions, though, that it might even give him some peace.
After all, he spent his days yelling that ‘in this world there is either black or white, nothing in between. And I will bring judgment upon everything that is black!'

[The royal family's heavenly voice]
We have discovered that the Prime Minister is in collusion with our enemy countries and is selling our nation's classified information.
This criminal has already been arrested and imprisoned.
The execution shall be in ten days.

[Patriotic letter signed in blood]
Dear Prime Minister, we know you are an innocent ally of ours and could not have shared classified information with enemy nations.
Even if we were to be persuaded that you had done something to deserve the King's displeasure, we would still try to stop your current death sentence.
As proof that we are on your side, all ten of us have signed this letter with blood.

[To my dear King]
Oh my dear King, I have found out that a group of irreverent fellows have been secretly plotting to help the Prime Minister, that terrible criminal.
This is confirmed by this letter signed in blood by these nine traitors' thumb prints.
I beseech you to punish these people for treason, including the Prime Minister!

[The royal family's heavenly voice]
Citizens of our glorious monarchy, I owe you an apology.
A few days ago I claimed that the Prime Minister was colluding with our enemy nations. This was, in fact, a complete lie intended to force a treacherous friend to reveal himself.
We have arrested the cabinet minister, who was using false evidence to frame the Prime Minister, and I wish to communicate to you all that I shall personally undertake his capital punishment with my own sword.
I wish this gives you all peace of mind and request that you rejoice in this era of peace.
That violin's tone is truly unusual.\nIt is deeply loved both by skilled musicians and tasteful audiences alike.
That violin sounds as pleasant as a fresh stream of water.\nTruly sensitive people probably envision a small universe inside its sound.
You don't hear it, you feel it.\nThat's right, close your eyes softly and empty your mind–

It seems that recently a man playing the violin has been appearing all around town.\nThey say that while he entrances the audience with his performance, a friend of his steals people's wallets from their pockets.\nYou should stay alert.

Hee hee hee! Why don't we chat for a while?
Me? I…
I'm a doll who was once kept as a pet by a young girl.
No, there was no mistake.
It's simply that she thought I was alive.

That child put me in a cage, just as if I were her pet bird, 
and looked after me. Isn't that cute? 
And then, well, she thought it was necessary in order to keep me alive. 
She put some feed in the cage… How crass. 
I couldn't eat it, of course. After all, I'm a doll.

But when that child saw that I didn't eat her meals,
she thought I would die. She was so worried that she started to cry.
When I saw her cry, my heart was filled with compassion, I just couldn't bear to see her that way.
So every day I wished that I could eat. Every single day.
And eventually… my wish came true.

I was able to eat.
I ate a lot for that child's sake, all the meat she gave me.
Upon doing so… I was locked.
So I want to be unlocked. I want to eat my meals.
Because if I don't eat, that child will worry about me.
Ordinary people can't comprehend the true nature of space-time.\nFor starters, space-time isn't continuous. It is discontinuous.
Such things as ‘past' and ‘future' don't exist.\nWhat people think of as ‘past' and ‘future' are simply illusions created by our brain.
Whenever phenomena occur, the brain tries to interpret them.\nThat is why people experience the so-called ‘passage of time'.

Whenever one tries to prove the discontinuity of space-time, the theory that serves as proof needs to be proven also. That is why proof is an exceedingly difficult thing to provide.\nThis is because the temporal act of ‘seeking proof' is always liable to be used to prove the theory that space-time is, in fact, continuous.\nLet's state it clearly. To prove the discontinuity of space-time one needs to provide proof for the proof itself.
The second he took that wand in his hands, he became a dictator. As a dictator, the whole world submitted to his command.
As a global dictator, nothing was impossible for him.\nBy his command people would die, and by his command also people would come back to life.

He was a dictator.\nAs soon as he wished for something, that wish would come true. Whether his wishes came first, or the world's transformation into his wished form came first, nobody could truly tell.

Then he, the dictator, became the world itself.
It became impossible to differentiate between him and the world.
The boundary between him and the world dissolved and he melted with the world.
It was a world that only he could perceive… from the very moment he took that wand in his hands.
I hate the sunlight.\nNo matter how much I avoid it, my skin always gets red and sore.
I hate the beach.\nWhenever I put my feet in the water my sandals get carried away by the waves.
I hate the summer.\nNo matter what I decide to eat, it is always mixed with insects.
…Could it be that Alice is predisposed to be unhappy?
I buried my big brother in the sand.\nThe sand tickled his face, so he laughed.
I played with my big brother, jumping into the water.\nSince it was a bit scary, he took my hand and said we should jump together.

I had a barbecue with my big brother.
He ate the meat I had overcooked
and gave me the meat he had cooked so perfectly.
However, it was so hot that it burned my tongue.

Now I'm playing a watermelon splitting game with my big brother.
But now that I'm blindfolded I can't see my big brother's face.
I don't like this game.
I want it to end soon and see my big brother's face again.

Filled with these emotions, I gave a hard swing with the stick I was holding
and my hands clearly felt how a spherical object was being smashed to pieces.

"Dorothy is turning to the left!"
"Roger that!"
All crabs who are nesting in this rocky surface must be exterminated.
That's what my sense of justice says.
"Gretel! She has taken refuge under that rock!"\n"Oh, come on, dear big brother… She couldn't have…"\n—I was foolish to expect anything from Gretel.
"Alice! Catch her before she goes too deep inside!"\n"I caught her. But she pinched my finger."\nEven I, watching it all from over here, am starting to feel a little sad.

"Playtime is over."
"If I use this artifact to incinerate the whole area…"
"I can wipe them all out in a single stroke!"
Something is wrong. By the time that thought came into my head,
the smell of burnt crab was already in the air.

Deep in a forest at dusk there lived a family of witches who had inherited the secret arts of ancient times.
There used to be a precept that forbid women who practiced the dark arts from ever marrying a clergyman.
One day, a young witch made a request of the chief sorceress.
She said "I have fallen in love with a clergyman, please let me stay married to him for life."
She was carrying a child in her womb.

The chief sorceress waved her wand.
Upon doing so, the young witch's belly was torn open and the baby crawled out from within the womb.
Waving her wand again, the chief sorceress made the child burst into flames and turn to ashes in an instant.
Having seen this, the young witch lost consciousness and became a cripple.

A few days later, as the chief sorceress was about to go and pick some medicinal herbs, she caught her leg in a trap a hunter had laid on the ground.\nAt that moment, a young and handsome man who was walking by saw her and rescued her.\nDespite having lived all her life in accordance with the precept, she was charmed by the man's kindness and fell in love with him.

She was pregnant with that man's child before long.
After informing all the other witches about this he disappeared.
That's right–he was the clergyman whose child the chief sorceress had burned to death.
She was burned to death herself by the other witches of the family and her beloved wand was pierced into the ground instead of a tombstone.

"Those savages are strikingly unintelligent, aren't they?"
"I agree. I think all human beings should try to make use of their brains."
"Wooden rods, stone axes... The weapons they use are so incredibly primitive."
"To even engage them in battle would be an embarrassment for our nation!"

"...Well then, what should we do?"
"Isn't it obvious? We are the strongest nation of sorcerers in the world. Only one approach is worthy of us."
"We must create a magical spell that will allow us to burn these savages to cinders."
"We'll incinerate them so intensely that even their bones will melt."
"Good idea, everyone. Let's create the strongest magical spell that we've ever seen!"

"We... We shouldn't do that. It is far too dangerous...!"
"If such a spell were to be cast, it could destroy the entire continent!"
"Let's seal it inside an iron frame! To prevent anyone from opening it!"
"Let's gather all the iron our country has to offer. Are any other preparations required?"
"Let's cast the appropriate spell on the iron. A spell that will strengthen it so much that nobody will be able to melt it!"

"We really succeeded in driving the savages back the other day."
"Truly. Although I got worried when the magical power ran out. But I immediately used the iron-bound book to hit them on the head. There was blood flying everywhere."
"Oh my! That way of fighting is more appropriate for a savage than for yourself!"
"I agree. But those damn savages sure know how to fight!"

That man had a deep understanding of the magical arts and felt practically no attachment to this earthly world.\nHe had no interest in earning money or attaining a successful career, so one day his wife handed him a letter of divorce.\nThis didn't affect him in the slightest and he continued the family tradition of being a calligraphy brush seller, which earned him enough to stay alive.

One day, as he was passing by the marketplace, he stopped and stared at the eaves of a traveling street stall selling curiosities.
On the eaves there hung a lamp whose appearance the man liked so much he bought it and walked back home.
He turned the lamp on cried out in admiration.
Within the darkness which had been repelled by the light there had appeared a ‘world of wonder'.

This ‘world of wonder' was only visible for a short while.\nFurthermore, he could only see it once a day.\nBut the man was so enamored of this ‘world of wonder' that he couldn't control himself. He tried turning the lamp on many times until it broke.

Half-crazed, the man returned to the market in search of the same item but the traveling stall had already left.\n‘I can't die! Not until I contemplate that ‘world of wonder' once more–!'\nGrumbling quietly, lost in a deep delusion, that man is still wandering aimlessly to this very day.

There was once a naval country with a strong military force divided into two cliques, and disputes between them never stopped.\nOne day, two underlings from each clique started fighting in a bar and this triggered a confrontation among 1000 soldiers in the harbor.\nThe navy commodore heroically appeared at the scene and addressed both clique leaders: "Withdraw your troops. The king wishes for you to live in peace!"

But neither of the leaders paid any attention to these words.\nThe commodore stuck a weather vane on the bow of his ship and gave an order to his subordinates, who started rowing towards the open seas.\n‘If I manage to hit that, you will cease this dispute!' Having said this, he placed an arrow on his bow and tensed his bowstring to the limit.

He secured his aim and released the arrow. But at that instant, a mysterious light shone on the opposite shore.
This caused his aim to falter and the arrow grazed the weather vane without hitting it.
‘The commodore has missed the mark!' exclaimed the clique leaders in scorn, this way enraging each other's troops.
So the battle recommenced and the commodore died by being engulfed in the violent brawl.

The king, who had been standing on his castle's balcony observing these events with a pair of binoculars, lightly chuckled to himself.\nFor someone like himself who wanted to amass all the power he could, the commodore and the clique leaders were an inconvenience.\nThat is why he had ordered someone to put up a light on the opposite shore which would make the commodore miss his shot. It had been his plan all along. He later falsely claimed that ‘I tried to prevent it with all my might, but in the end it turned into a tragedy.'

That king was an arrogant and narrow-minded man who was hated by his people.
One day, a man was thrown into jail for being a suspected spy.
When a government official saw how elegant and refined the man's demeanor was, he informed the king, who decided to speak to the man in person.
Then, the king noticed it. That man was a world-renowned violinist.

However much the king interrogated him, though, the man did not admit to being that violinist.\nThe king secretly thought to himself, "he's trying to sell himself and his songs for a high price, isn't he?" And so, he suggested to the man, "if you play a single one of your songs for me, I will set you free."

The violinist held his violin and made his bow run over its strings.\nUpon hearing him perform his overture, with its overwhelming sense of presence, the king and his retainers were deeply moved.\nHowever, the violinist suddenly stopped playing and said, "the rest of this movement is pure silence. It cannot be heard by fools. Ha ha ha!"

Infuriated, the king said "I will punish you for this stupid musical joke!" and killed the violinist himself right there and then.\nAt that moment, a messenger from the emperor arrived and his words sent shivers down the king's spine.\n"A message from the emperor. It reads, I personally invited that violinist to visit you. I hope you have given him a warm and cordial welcome."

"Hey, everyone! I have discovered a document which contains classified information inside a bottle which probably floated ashore!\nLet's see. What does it say...\nDiscarded proposal for the summer event...?"

[Plan outline]\n1. We'll spend an insane summer on the island where all swimsuit photographs for all social-network games in the world are taken.\n2. There we will find various photography sets ready and we will proceed to make the characters take photographs of themselves in swimsuits in order to increase sales.

3. Alice and the rest will deepen their relationship with other characters from different titles who have also come for photo shoots (we will have to blur out all characters from other titles for copyright reasons).\n4. The photo shoot should go smoothly but it will cause our slow-selling app to suddenly get an excess of exposure. To control this, we will release a large number of ethical nightmares.

5. The strong moneymaking desires of all the producers will help us brush away any ethical concerns and achieve a wonderfully risqué photo shoot. But…

"As usual, there is nothing of value here!"
As Dorothy proclaims these words, she softly returns the event plan proposal to the pile of documents it came from.

I hid in a bushy thicket in that hill and nocked an arrow, pulling my bow taut.
The shot flew into the sky and pierced the skull of an enemy admiral who was in the middle of a war council with his commanders.
As the scene erupted into chaos, I gave them all a sideways glance.
"Farewell, I wish you sweet dreams as you die."

I hid the body of the guard I had killed with my short sword and climbed up the tower.
I nocked an arrow, pulling the bow taut.
The shot pierced the sky and inserted itself in the king's neck just as he was delivering a speech from his castle balcony.
The audience started shrieking just as if someone had dropped a beehive on them. I then withdrew from the scene.
"Did you see nice dreams on your way to death?"

I threw the door open and nocked an arrow.
"So, you've probably already earned enough to pay for my drinking expenses–"
A wisp of air was released from my hand and flew into the mouth of a man who stunk of alcohol.
The arrow stuck itself deep into that man's throat and he fell dead to the ground.
"Apologize to my mother in hell. You will most certainly have sweet dreams while you die, my dear good-for-nothing father."

He was such a gentle child. My husband was a retired soldier, a drunkard, and he used to hit us both…\nOne day my son left home and said that "I will prove that I can feel more happiness than anyone, more than all the unhappiness I have felt until now!"\nI at least hope he dreamed beautiful dreams as he was dying… That's all I am worried about now. My son…

An unmarried man, a literary genius, used to live in a mansion with a beautiful view built upon a hill.\nHe was a gentle and cultured man and when his wife passed away he poured all his affection onto the child they had had together. Together with the old butler who lived in the mansion, they formed a family of three.

One day, a poetry recital was to be held, so the literary genius left the child under the old butler's care.\nOnce the butler had finished cooking the child's meal he went to call him.\nHe found the child lying dead in the mansion gardens. A small meteorite had sunk into his head.

The old butler thought of communicating this fact, but he realized it was likely he would be doubted so he decided to prioritize his safety.\nHe sold the meteorite to a blacksmith and buried the child's body, telling his master that ‘the young master has disappeared without a trace.'\nHe assumed the master would make all efforts to find his child.

But hearing that his adored child was gone, the master fell into deep despair and locked himself in his room for a few days.
Then one day, as the old butler was sweeping the garden, a hammer fell from the top window and hit him straight on the crown of his head.
Was it due to unjustified resentment felt by the literary genius? Or was it just a mere accident?
The event is shrouded in mystery.

Due to a longstanding war, a certain nation's citizens continued to live in misery.
The people asked the monk for advice.
The white-haired monk told them to endure all that pain and distress.
The people did as they had been told and withstood the pain.
But no matter how much they endured, they never saw a sign of hope…

The villagers visited the monk once more.
"We would like to know for how long we must endure this pain. What is it exactly that awaits us on the other side of this ordeal?"
The monk replied:
"You have all made an effort to endure the pain. I am moved by your efforts. I will reward you."

He led the people down into his cellar. All of a sudden, hooks came flying and sunk themselves into the villagers. They started screaming and tried to run away.\n"Why are you running away? From such marvelous pain!"\nThe monk spoke these words with hooks stuck into his body. Soon everyone in that room perished, including the monk, and the room became completely still.

The room's back door opened and a youth walked with a sickle in his hand. He gave his father's corpse a respectful glance and made the following oath.\n"Father… I have learned much from you. I will now take your place as a missionary for pain. I will teach the truth of pain to all the people."\nThe monk's son climbed up the stairs to the ground floor. His manner and his way of speaking were just like his father's…

That swordsman had a natural talent. He was so fast that no one could follow his movements.
He wasn't just strong. He also had a friendly side. For instance, he loved birds and always carried a bag of birdseed with him.
He wanted to reform society and was part of a group of swordsmen who protected the capital.
But this group was kicked out of the capital by the conservative faction of the government. They were surrounded by hostility.

When the conservatives saw that the master swordsman, who they knew was part of this group, did not rise to lead it as an army, they became suspicious.
It was expected that he would, but he was in fact resting at a lakeside medical resort.
His bronchial tubes had been weak since birth and this filled him with concern, which in turn aggravated the pneumonia.
That was why his fellow swordsmen had not made him join them in battle.

A few days later, the master swordsman had a dream. He dreamed he was practicing his fencing, dripping in sweat together with his fellow swordsmen, all of them in a great mood.\n–The following morning, the examining physician gave him the news. Every single one of his fellow swordsmen had died heroically in battle after giving it their all.

The swordsman made an effort to walk his sick body towards the lake, where he sat down for a while in contemplation.
He then gently drew his sword and performed a solitary sword dance.
After it, he quietly exhaled his last breath.
A kingfisher flew towards the clear-blue skies in the distance.

You said you would become the bride for the sake of the village
On the wedding day you were going to dress up beautifully
So you gently smiled and asked me
If I could prepare you a bouquet

I did everything that I, a florist, could do for you
I prepared a gorgeous bouquet
I let many flowers float on the waters
Of the lake that was to be your ceremonial space

You clothed yourself in a stunning dress
You held the bouquet I had prepared
Tied to your slender legs, you carried stone weights of varying sizes which you dragged along with you
You, the bride, sank into the lake

I couldn't find your body, so
That must have meant the bridegroom liked you
Instead of your body, the only thing that floated to the surface was the bouquet
Who cares if this village falls into ruin, anyway?
Time ponders…\nAs a result of the condensation of the universe's existence after its genesis, life emerged and was able to perceive time.
But before long, all beings become unable to sustain their own existence. As existence expanded, it became unbearably light and pale.

All change ceased in that universe.
After that, no matter how much time passed no change took place.
Nothing affected other things, and nothing was affected by other things.
All awareness faded like mist.

Time thinks. It thinks that if there was no subject to be aware of it, it would surely perish.\nHowever, time itself wouldn't even care if it disappeared. It wouldn't even warn us. It would have nothing to do, so it would just observe how the situation unfolded.\nIt would just gaze at reality peacefully…
"Why have things turned out this way. I only…"\nOne day, Pinocchio met a youth who felt regret for his actions.
The youth was wiping his blood-stained mouth with the back of his hand.\nHis appearance was that of someone who has committed their first crime. And that of someone who has become an adult.
\n"Don't worry. You will soon grow used to it. Look at me, for example. I'm a puppet built for that very purpose."\nPinocchio tried to cheer him up with these words. However—
"Ha ha! It was just a dream."\n"It felt like I was remembering something I had forgotten…"\nA giant shadow passed next to Pinocchio as he fell asleep.

He was a simple kind of man who never stood out, but at some point he had started thinking of chopping many women into little pieces. One day he decided to put these thoughts into practice.\nWhenever he mutilated a woman, people said that the murderer must have held a strong grudge against her. In fact, however, he had simply cut her up and that's that. Whether this was even something he had desired to do was not clear to him.
One day, he met a very mysterious woman.\nShe was OK with being cut into little pieces. This was because she was a cyborg.
Every time he cut her up, she simply waited for the pieces to reassemble themselves and whenever he felt like it he would chop her up once more. He repeated this many times.

A few months later, the women-mutilating murderer who had sowed panic in that town struck again.\nHe had understood something about himself.\nHe realized that despite having the option of mutilating a woman who could reassemble herself, he always chose the option of cutting up women whose bodies did not reassemble.

[Diary of Royce, Commander of the Red Dragon Knights]
We must be careful about today's capture.
He is nothing but a headhunting scoundrel.
According to our spies, he even has dried heads hanging in great numbers from the eaves of his hiding-place.
I must have a talk with my wife because tomorrow anything could happen to me.

[Imperial Newspaper, Extra Edition - headhunting scoundrel arrested]
The headhunting scoundrel who had been terrifying our streets was finally captured yesterday.
The second the Red Dragon Knights took action, he had no way of resisting them with his sickle and was arrested with ease.
It is still unclear why he committed all the atrocities he did.

[The Scoundrel's Testimony]
I poisoned a man I met on my travels and stole his money. That's how everything started.
After I had been walking for a while, something startled me. The man whom I had just killed was walking towards me!
After that, wherever I went I would always catch sight of that man.
This filled me with such fear that I decided to cut his head with a sickle to prevent him from appearing again.
But no matter how many times I sliced his head off, I would always end up seeing it again. That face...!

[Diary of Navarre, The Executioner]
Today, at the execution, I cut that scoundrel's head off.
As I was walking home, I heard footsteps close behind me so I turned around.
Standing behind me was...none other than the scoundrel I had killed with my own hands!
I ran home raving and shouting and locked myself in my room. All the townsfolk, including my family, had the same face as that scoundrel.
I had to slice their heads off! I needed to slice them off...!

The war, raging a dozen years or more, had forced the people into poverty. This greatly saddened a priest, so he decided to ask the gods for help.\nThe gods gave him permission to craft a harp from the wood of a sacred tree and to take it back with him.

The priest walked over the land, playing his harp wherever he went.\nWarriors swinging their swords in furious anger suddenly cried out and clasped both hands in prayer, and the priest joyfully exclaimed that ‘with this I can end the war!'

After playing his harp here and there, it took a relatively short time for every single conflict to be brought to an end.\nThe priest sent prayers of gratitude to the heavens. ‘Oh gods, it is as if I could perceive your power with my own eyes!'

After the wars had ended, the people began to focus on the pursuit of knowledge, they deepened their understanding of morality and ethics and raised their consciousness.\nNow everybody is an enlightened being and everyone is in dialogue with the divinity that exists within them.\nHuman beings have ascended up the evolutionary ladder and have become the gods of a new world.

Hey, so you're a prisoner?
I'm gonna have to perform a medical examination on your body, including your anus.
You're only admitted into this prison if you're not carrying anything with you. Only the head warden is allowed to carry a weapon.
If you get beaten by his rotten rope club, say goodbye to your bones.
Don't you even think of standing up to him.

So you're new around here, huh?
I'm the warden of this prison, so I'm in charge!
You could say I'm sort of like justice itself here. I'm the law!
Well, just try and reincorporate yourself into society as soon as possible and don't get in our way!

That damn warden. I won't forgive him.
Since my wife is known to be a beauty, he angrily told me I should let him sleep with her. When I refused, he started beating me with his rotten rope club.
Now my nose is broken and my front teeth are cracked. I'm a wreck.
How much longer will we have to put up with his tyranny...?

Oh hey, Mr. Warden.
How does it feel to be betrayed by a lackey and thrown into my section of the prison?
Huh? –Oh, this weapon was given to me as a present by that lackey of yours.
So, get ready to savor the taste of your beloved rotten rope club...!

A father who had just finished work was relaxing at home when his five-year-old child came into the room.\nWhen the child saw the gun lying on the table, his eyes sparkled and said, "That's so cool! Let me touch it!"\nThe father chuckled in embarrassment. "Nope, you can't. It can only be touched by people who know how to handle it, like me."

The child ran off to the town square, where his friends were playing, and proudly told them what he had seen.\nBut his friends didn't believe him and called him a liar.\nThe child barely contained his tears as he said, "OK. If you don't believe me, I will bring it here myself!"

When he took the gun from home and showed it to his friends, he was ecstatic with pride.
However, when he noticed his father running towards him with an angry face, his heart froze.
In an instant, something red burst from his father's chest. His father's face stiffened and he collapsed.
When the boy saw smoke coming out of the gun, he realized he had instinctively pressed the trigger.

Suddenly, the town was in uproar.
The knights hastened to the scene, but the young boy calmly pulled the trigger and opened a hole in the forehead of the knights' captain. Then he ran away.
A few days later, an influential figure from the criminal underworld who had witnessed the events picked him up and made him an underling.
Pay close attention to him, because in a few years he will have surely become an expert gunman.
Fashion changes constantly in every town and in every historical period.

Fashions transform from one stage to the next.
When they complete the cycle, old and outdated fashions are given new life.
New things can be learned from the past.
So, generally speaking, fashion and trends will always change.

How do trends come into fashion, exactly? And how do they change?\nThere exists a strange rumor.\nIt tells of a group of people who decide what will become fashionable. According to the rumor, their existence has transcended this superficial world which lets itself be manipulated by fashion…

In the depths of a remote mountain there lived a group of monks.
They had no interest whatsoever in this world. They existed free from all early attachment.
In their field of vision they saw a wonderful design for a 6-stringed instrument…
Despite never breaking their pure state of mind, they strummed the strings of the instrument they were envisioning.
When they did so, they heard a loud and joyful cheer coming from a distant town.

If I want to be young, I must spin it counterclockwise.
If I want to grow old, I let it spin clockwise.
The magical hourglass keeps spinning around and around.
I just have to make sure all of its sand
doesn't fall down.

It feels as if I've been walking for a long time.
It feels as if I was just born yesterday.
Recently my life feels like a dream.
How did I pay
for this hourglass when I purchased it, I wonder?

Round and round and round.
Which direction is counterclockwise?
Which one is clockwise?
Please, could you tell me
why this hourglass is so important to me?

Also, could you tell me who you are?
Oh no, please don't cry.
Look, the sand is about to finish falling.
If that happened, something terrible…
Um, what exactly was it that was supposed to happen?

The woman is tied up. The man swings his sword. Blood flies out. The man overflows with ecstasy. This is his third victim this week. He enjoys repeatedly stabbing her. After he's cut her up, he needs to go procure another one. As he leaves, he has to remember to close the door and make sure the fireplace is extinguished.

Something black appears and then disappears. He feels a presence. It follows him around. It holds a grudge. It seems it has come to this world for revenge. When he thinks it must be dimly standing in the distance, it suddenly appears behind his back. When it has shown itself, it kills by physical and other means. It wants dead friends to join it. The more it kills, the more friends it has.

Its purpose is to kill. It has the power of bringing death into existence. That is the power of space. The power of the night. It is impossible to predict. When this power is used, it occasionally has ominous consequences for human beings.

Humans were the creators of the night's power. Its existence was so large it transcended them. It created humans and tormented them. The reason humans are given brief moments of daylight is as a contrast with this power of night. All hopes they acquire during the day are stolen during the night and destroyed. But there is absolutely no malice in this. And yet humans will never stop interpreting this as an act of malice. In fact it is an incredibly pure act. The evil intent inherent in this pure world...

A girl holding a huge wand has appeared in front of your eyes.
The girl looks at you with teary eyes.
"My job is to collect human lives.
But I haven't met today's quota, so I'm in trouble.
That's why I need to ask you. Could I please take your life?"

"If you promise to give me your life, I will grant you one wish.'
Hearing the girl's proposal, what do you reply?
[Choices]
* "I refuse!" →Make my wand evolve!
* "I'll give you my life!" →After making my wand evolve, raise my level up to MAX!

After refusing her offer, the girl clicked her tongue in disapproval.
"Well, I will still have to eliminate you, even if it's against your will."
The girl's big wand shone and you were eliminated.
You didn't even realize you had died then and had become a ghost, so you couldn't access the path towards reincarnation. [BAD END]

After accepting her offer, the girl convulsed with laughter.
"Oh my God. Are you serious? It should be my job to adapt myself to the customer's wishes!
I have never seen something so embarrassing!"
In a fit of anger, you stole her wand and shouted something or other
as you showered her with blows. You beat her until she stopped breathing. [BAD END]
Interlocked fingers are not connected by a thread of love or by a solemn vow.\nWhat connects two hands together is the solid fact of their difference in temperature.
If they can both stay by each other's side.\nThey won't need to make an oath or a promise.\nI wanted my heart to be pure enough to believe that.
The sun's rays don't reach this relationship, so it always seeks the darkness.\nSince it is not thrown away, it accumulates.\nThe more it accumulates, the more I want to destroy it.
More than sleeping by your side I prefer crying alone, quietly.\nThat's why I'm erasing it. Our connection.\nThen I will engrave it on your heart. An eternal proof.
I'm not talking of the present. This is a distant memory.\nA breezy hill colored by sunset.\nWe were there, just the two of us.
—I hold a small child in my arms.\nThe child is crying as he tightly grabs onto my finger. My heart is filled with both a deep affection and an urge for destruction, and this disturbs me to the core.

Warm and cold.\nI was enveloped by these contradictory temperatures. All I could do was exist within them. My heart couldn't balance them out. Instead, the heat and the cold quarreled against each other and I wasn't able to control them.
Before long, my heart became still as if it had broken.\nI hugged the baby tightly and let words of atonement and teardrops fall onto this world...

There once was a master gunman who loved chaos and war with all his heart.\nHe was well known in the criminal underworld as a professional killer who could handle any situation if the price was right.\nHis only interest was to do things that would shake society to its roots.

There was a country ruled by a virtuous king whom everyone called the "benevolent king". Both of those words awoke a desire for rebellion in the gunman which made him desire to kill him.
The gunman pretended to be a servant and crept into the castle. When he entered the king's room, he pointed the gun at him.
"I see, you have come to kill me. Shoot if you will, but even if you kill me you don't disrupt this country's peace."
The gunman pulled the trigger in silence and the king's brains spilled out.

The benevolent king was killed by an assassin's bullet—
When the news surfaced, the country was in great distress for a short while, but the turmoil was immediately kept under control by the heir to the throne, the new king.
"The benevolent king will live forever inside all of your hearts." When the new king gave this speech to the people, everyone was moved and the country became even more united than before.
"Damn you, benevolent king!" said the gunman, grinding his teeth.

The gunman pored through the reference books until he found a weak spot in the country, something that prevented it from falling into calamity, and loaded all his ammunition at this spot.
The country's foundation collapsed and out of it crawled the Beast of Calamity, who swallowed the gunman in one gulp.
The Beast of Calamity destroyed that nation in an instant and wreaked havoc on all neighboring lands.
After his death, the gunman's Gun of a Hundred Poisons, a gun that had injured over one hundred people, was introduced into the criminal underworld.
The skeleton on the tip of this wand moans. Just like it formerly did. Desolately.
At night the skeleton screams. Just like it formerly did. Piercingly.
By its mere existence, the skeleton shows us a world beyond this world.\nHe shows us that all of us, without exception, will eventually go there.

It speaks a visceral language.\nIt says "you will all one day become like me. Death awaits you all."\nIts position atop the staff seemed to spew forth these visceral words, proclaiming them against the members of the living...

[Spell Book of Ripples - Preface]
This book describes some very valuable spells.
These spells can only be applied onto a single individual.
Don't worry, however. The book includes additional instructions to make these spells spread far and wide like ripples, thus perfecting the spell-casting.

[Chapter 5 - Practical Examples of Spells (1)]\nIn order to use the techniques described so far, you should use a spell on a reasonably good-looking woman of your choice.\nThis spell will then spread to the dirty men who touch her mucous membranes, to those men's wives, to those wives' lovers, spreading endlessly.

[Chapter 5 - Practical Examples of Spells (2)]\nNow, lust is certainly an instinct to prevent your blood lineage from dying out, so by mixing this instinct with a spell an incredible synergy can be expected.\nThis way, in just a few generations every single human being will be cursed and the entire Earth will transform into a metropolis of death!

[Afterword]
We apologize for going a little crazy in chapter five.
The thing is that if one could spread a rumor about how the sexual act carries a death spell within in, the suspicion this would raise would escalate until all was in chaos!
After all, rumors such as these act like ripples, spreading in all directions.

There was a country in the arid desert where the people's fortunes could be divined on a sheet of glass. One day, this sheet of glass was smashed due to a priest's carelessness. The broken shards of glass got stuck in the eyes of a girl who happened to be near there and so she was blinded.

In order to hide his mistake, the priest pretended the girl whose eyes had been pierced with glass was now a prophet. She had absolutely no ability to predict the future. And yet, the girl resigned herself to her role.

The girl was so kind that she always predicted what people desired.\nAfter a dry season she would predict that "rain will fall tomorrow." To the sick she would predict that "you will heal in three days."\nThe people soon lost their temper at these predictions which never came true and gradually started calling her a liar.

It was eventually decided that this fake prophet was to be executed. On the day before the execution, this blind girl had a dream that the country would perish in a sandstorm. This was a real prophecy. She tried screaming this to the people before being executed, by nobody took her seriously. After her death, all the nation's citizens were swallowed by the sand.

11/21 6:00\n50,000 curious onlookers had surrounded the entrance to Cafe Aliya in Shinjuku.\nImages of the corpse with its brains gouged out spread across the internet in the blink of an eye, and the following morning all news channels had to reprogram their feature news story to fit this event.
The subtitle glued me to the spot, but not because of how weird the topic was. It was because I had seen the exact same name written in a text message the previous night.
That name, which I hadn't seen in over five years, was Kazuhiro Iwama.\nHe had been the individual who had made me want to become a journalist, the man who was everything I had ever wanted to become.

Why had Iwama done such a thing?\nHad he been dragged into this situation…?\nMany questions swirled around my mind, but the very first subject line I saw when I opened my e-mail confirmed all my suspicions.

11/21 6:10\nAttached to Iwama's e-mail was a pitch black image file. I checked the image's Exif, as I had grown used to doing, and the GPS data for when the photograph was taken pointed to an institution called the Comprehensive Research Center for Quantum Mechanics.

11/22 10:00\nI visited the institution pretending I was a writer for a science magazine and they let me in so easily I was almost disappointed. As I walked in, a man in a white coat took me to a reception area and introduced himself as ‘Sato from public relations.'

11/22 13:00\nTo summarize, during my talk with Sato I learned that this institution was doing research into ‘expanding the possibilities' for human life.\nFor example, they were studying how to keep living brains in cold storage or how to save human personality onto a computer server.

11/22 14:00\nHe told me they were conducting many such studies, but that at the end of the day it wasn't working out too well. That if only they had unlimited time and energy then things might turn out better for them.\nThat was practically all I got out of my 4-hour-long conversation with Sato.

11/22 18:30\nThen, Sato took me to their research lab. It was as big as a university auditorium.\nA group of white-robed scientists stood in front of a giant screen and were monitoring human-sized capsules placed at the back of the room which seemed to be part of the experiment.

Perhaps the data on the screen was positive? Sato's face lit up for a moment just like a child's. With the enthusiasm of someone who is showing their secret base to a close friend, he carefully told me about every single machine in the room. Then, finally, he caressed one of the capsules and passionately told me ‘this is a dream machine which allows humans to live inside virtual space.'

11/22 19:30\n The young scientists approached Sato and referred to him as the head of the lab. When I asked him what they meant,\nhe gave me an answer that seemed like an excuse. ‘With our budget we can't hire a proper PR representative, so instead I take care of that role. In fact, however, I am head staff of this institution.'

I was surprised to learn about Sato's actual position but in fact he continued talking in a humble manner, as if he wasn't the founder of the place. Seeing this, I thought of the expression ‘too much humility breeds contempt'.

11/23 7:00
This was the day after my visit to the facility.
Early in the morning I received unannounced visitors.
Outside my front door were a young man and a woman with pale blue eyes which nicely matched her pale hair color.
At first I didn't recognize them without their lab coats, but I soon saw who they were. They were the scientists I had seen in the facility.

Why had they come to my house?
The woman answered me as I was just thinking this.
‘We are spies.'
Her eyes did not seem to be lying.
As I asked for details, they both told me they had lost friends because of that institution. Essentially, their objectives were the same as mine.

The young man told me ‘since you're a journalist, we would like you to write articles disclosing information about that place.'\nThey would continue to inspect the facility, would share with me anything they discovered and I would secretly spread that information via illegal channels.\n‘Why did you come to me?' As I expressed this doubt in words, the man told me that ‘a man called Iwama passed responsibility over to you.' I unconsciously swallowed.

Apparently, before Iwama's death he had told them to get in touch with me in the case that anything happened to him, and gave them my contact details.
After hesitating about whether I should trust them I asked ‘is there an underground area in the lab?'

A pair of wealthy parents had twins.

The little brother pushed past the cowering servants, lit a torch and tried to burn down the garden.

The flaming sword had saved the kingdom.

In a cabin in the woods there lived a woodcutter, a virtuous man who never told a lie and was well-liked by all.\nOne day, the woodcutter's daughter rushed from the cabin, hurrying to where the knights were stationed.\n"Help me, please! My father is abusing me!" she shouted tearfully.

The knights knew the woodcutter, and well understood he would do no such thing.
But the daughter's act was convincing.
Hearing the news, the woodcutter went to the knights' station to apologize.
"My daughter has pulled a prank on you. I'm terribly sorry."

When ordered to return home with the woodcutter, the girl broke into tears, crying to the knights, "You can't send me back there to die!"\nSeveral days later, the girl was sobbing in the mountain hut when a witch appeared.\n"The knights told me what happened. Take this to protect yourself," she said, handing the girl an axe. "A wound from this axe, even a tiny scratch, causes pain no living person can bear."

"Oh, thank you, Witch!" cried the woodcutter's daughter, hefting the axe and splitting the witch in two.
The girl was extremely attached to her father, and would constantly tell lies to get attention.
Slinging the axe over her shoulder, she set off toward the office of a young, handsome doctor.
"That woman wanted to seduce my father. She had to be dealt with," mumbled the girl as she went.
The dream she had that day seemed to unearth torturous memories. The scene around her was indistinct, but she saw a snake coiled beside her, flicking its tongue, hungering for her hatred.
The world came into focus, and she saw a girl with red, rosy cheeks standing in the pale white snow. Her gaze found a hut, the light of a warm fireplace seeping from the windows.
From time to time, a smiling woman peeked out at the girl from behind the curtains. More than the cold, the girl hated that woman. She hated how that woman's whims controlled her fate.

She hated that woman who would toss breadcrumbs
from the window, as if feeding a bird.
She hated the weakness that made her say, thank you.

that loved these black-hearted sisters who laughed at her.

Finally, one day, the man met someone who didn't hate him, an orphan who had lost his parents to another murderer, just like him. And for the first time, he realized his mistake. Afflicted by crushing guilt, he sought refuge in the Bible, believing he would be saved if he obeyed its teachings.

One evening, the orphanage was attacked. The man stood and stared at the mounds of corpses. Thankfully, the orphan had survived. Eyes full of tears, he clung to the man, crying the names of his dead friends.

"He who dies without guilt will be called to paradise." Suddenly he thought of this Bible verse. Using the ax in his hand, he sent the orphan to heaven to see his friends. This was the first time the man killed to save a soul.

Its delicacy brought tears to their eyes, its wistfulness took their breath away.\nFirst the sound of the flute would steal their hearts, and only then they would hear the dark undertone.\nBut by then it would be too late. They had already turned to hourglasses.
