a very cute↑ bear too!↑

The evil wizard fell in love with the princess at first sight of her. Proposing marriage, he was refused.\nUnreasonably resentful of this, the wizard dug through his books, throwing open the most taboo of taboo grimoires.\nThus, its seal was broken and a legendary evil dragon descended on the realm, raining tyranny and destruction upon it.

Seeing their country in crisis, the princess and her heroic lover stood up against the dragon.\nThe man challenged the dragon, but none of his blows could pierce its hard scales, so he retreated from the battlefield.\nThe hero considered what it would take to inflict damage upon the dragon.

The hero decided to seek out their country's guardian deity. He held audience with the God of Flames, asking for divine protection unto his blade.\n"I cannot grant your wish. The power of gods is not for mortals to wield. The flames will destroy your body," the God of Flames told him, yet the hero insisted, "Even so, I must try!"\nThe God of Flames finally folded, and granted the hero's blade his divine protection.

Thus, the hero met with the dragon on the field of battle again, and was able to overtake it.\nThe night he felled the dragon, the hero embraced his princess. Yet, through his sword, the flames were now resting in his body. In a years time, a grotesquely melted baby was dragged from the princess's womb.\nIn her confusion, the princess too died. The hero also fell from a high fever, never to return.

There was once a warrior famed for being peerless with a long sword.\nHe was stubborn in the old ways, but he was also fond of telling jokes and was quite amicable.\nThe warrior, owing a great debt to the shogun, appointed the next shogun as per the dying man's request written on the memento given to him.

After appointing the position of shogun without permission from the emperor, several influential conservative warriors conspired, resulting in an insurrection.\nThe long sword wielder lead the troops himself, and utterly destroyed the opposing forces in a great battle.\nThe shogun was well pleased with the warrior, and appointed him to a high post.

The shogun, however, was a complete and utter fool, and governed poorly.\nThe long sword-wielding warrior gathered his comrades, and appeared at a private meeting of that country's influential persons.\n"Let's banish the shogun, and return his power to the emperor!" they said, demanding warrior sign a pact in blood.

Just as the warrior refused their demand, the sliding door flew open, as sword-wielding warriors appeared one after the next.\nAfter killing dozens of them, the warrior's entire body was pierced through with a rain of arrows as he died in a crimson dance.\nThe story of a warrior who sacrificed himself rather than give up his loyalty to his lord is immortalized in a play called "The Crimson Death" that is performed even today.

Month: X Day: X day
Today I really felt it in my head.
In pain,
I let someone glance at my diary.
All wrapped up.

I'm mad, so I'm gonna do something mean!
Reincarnation.
As punishment, I've covered the diary page you're reading with poison.
From the fields.

In front of you, you can see blue medicine and red medicine, right?
If a bug
doesn't take the blue medicine, it'll die.
It flew away.
If you take the red medicine, you'll die. Heheh.\nIt's the theory of evolution.\nNukazuke.

A certain man was arrested on charges of attempted theft.\nTaking one look at the man's villainous face, the judge didn't even attempt a fair investigation.\n"With no margin for taking into consideration the circumstances, there's no chance for rehabilitation," he decided, sentencing the man to death.

After the execution, the wife of the executed man gathered information from news reports.\nThe reports wrote that he was an unsociable man, but was kind to his wife, and that he had turned to crime to pay for his sick daughter's medical expenses, invoking people to discuss the matter.

Those sympathetic to the man sentenced to death gathered their voices, writing one letter-to-the-editor after the next encouraging the widow.\nThe judge's reputation fell, and the path to the political world was closed to him.\nThe judge, muttering that it was punishment for a thoughtless judgment, slit his own neck with his family sword.

The judge couldn't have known. The widow had been spouting nonsense.\nShe was lovers with a news reporter, and had conspired to make money off the story of her deceased husband, going so far as to create a believable plot with him.\nThus, the judge was the victim of two thoughtless judgments.
That hero boasted an immensely obese body.
Thanks to the hero's extremely thick blubber, he could absorb enemy attacks.\nAnd because of this, he was marvelously strong against strikes, and served as a capable shield for his allies.

In a certain battle, during an exchange of blows, a sword pierced the hero's belly. The blade cut through his flesh, but the hero hardly felt any pain.\nHowever, for some reason the enemy took the flesh stuck to the blade and put it in his mouth. Afterwards, the man fell in great pain and died.

From that day forward, the hero had a rough time of it. As word of his belly's "death meat" spread, those wishing to kill those they hated by feeding them the meat assailed him one after the next. One night, even one of his allies who he had adventured with snuck into his bedchamber to attack him. Losing all trust in humanity, the hero departed from his friends to live a life alone as a recluse.\nBefore long, he became known as the Suffering Hero…

Since birth, I've been diagnosed with a serious illness.
I've been in a hospital all my life, and have had many operations.
My mother and father often come to visit me.
So, no matter how much it hurts, I can endure the pain.

One day, I lost my hearing, but the doctors had told me long ago it was a possibility, so it doesn't really bother me.\nFather, Mother. Please don't cry. I'm okay.\nA quiet world really isn't so bad. I'm fine.

The book I read yesterday had something interesting written in it.
It said that if you play a flute on a deathly silent night, the sound will be like that of the moonlight.
A sound much softer than that of twinkling starlight.
It will be a high sound like that of a bell clearly ringing.
I wanted to hear that sound, even just once.

Telling my mother and father this story, they played a flute for me one silent night.
I couldn't hear anything, but
I'm sure it must have been a beautiful sound.
But truly, I want to hear my parents' voices again.
If that wish were granted, I could live my whole life without hearing the sound of moonlight.

Long ago, there was a young man named Toro.\nOne day, Toro visited a beach. There he found the remains of a hot-air balloon that had drifted ashore, grown dirty with age. He encountered a group of youths who were poking it with sticks and throwing rocks at it.

Toro paid the youths some money and bought the balloon from them.\nJust then, the hot-air balloon swelled with air and urged him to ride it. Toro obliged, and set off on a journey to soar the world's skies.

That balloon once belonged to a certain noble lady, who kept it in her room as an ornament. She was ill, and spent her entire life in her sickbed. She liked to read books and listen to stories from travelers, and often dreamed of places around the world. Before long, her country was invaded, and she died in the ensuing chaos. Before anyone noticed, the balloon ornament had disappeared.
A few days later, Toro's dead body was found on the beach. He had been lynched by the youths, dying from blood loss due to his injuries. In his hands was a balloon ornament…
Within an old book, the scenes of a world without living creatures unfolds between the pages.\nIn that realm, wind blows on occasion. Sometimes strong, sometimes weak.
In the dead silence, only the wind blows.\nIn that realm, there are no animals. So it's a trivial thing. The wind stirs only the leaves of plants.

There may have at some point been living things moving about this realm.\nThey may have fought, raised children, and lived. In the lands where they acted and died, their stories were born. On one such sad occasion, they were all visited by calamity.\nHowever, now that not even their traces remain, all has become nothing. It's as if nothing was ever there to begin with.

Is it a beginning or the end?\nThere's no way to tell if the scenery we see there existed before those living, moving things appeared above the ground, or after they all went extinct, and that world had ended.\nThe only certain thing is the wind is blowing. Without a change.

Rain Prayer

-A ceremony for calling rain during a drought.
-The nature of the ceremony differs greatly by region.
-Most continue until rain starts falling.

Rain Woman

-A demon who calls forth rain.
-Refers to a woman who, when making plans to go out, has a high probability of causing it to rain that day.
-Some Rain Women are employed in Rain Prayers.

Rain God

-A god who controls rain and storms.
-The object of worship during a Rain Prayer.
-There is a theory that Rain Women are children of the Rain God.

Legend of a Certain Village

-Villagers who became angry when it didn't rain after a Rain Prayer sacrificed the maiden used as a Rain Woman.
-The Rain God, happy to have his child back, blessed the village with rain.
-Since then, the villagers would always sacrifice a Rain Woman during a drought, but the Rain Woman's curse brought a flood to the village, and it now sits at the bottom of a river.
Hey, big brother. Look at me.\nHey, big brother. Look at me.\nPlease, big brother… Look only at me.
Hey, big brother. Don't walk behind me.\nIf you do, I won't be able to see your face.
Hey, big brother. Don't sleep with your back facing me.\nI want to touch you. I want to touch your heart.\nI can't help it. I really can't help it.
Oh, big brother.\nEven if this sweet world is but a crow's fleeting dream…is it foolish of me…to want your everything?

That's the horizon of this world. The Dragon God appeared, splitting the surface of the waters that had been calm since the beginning of creation.\nHe sank ship after ship, and laid waste to all ports.\nSeeing this, the Sea God said with indignation "How dare you do this to my people?!" and there challenged the Dragon God to battle.

The Sea God and Dragon God put their entire existence into the battle, as a fierce struggle of offense and defense unfolded.\nThe winds howled and the sea raged, and the sky was dyed an angry red reminiscent of the end of times…\nThe Dragon God used its fangs to cut into the Sea God's windpipe, and the Sea God fell.

A king of men, upon seeing the Sea God fall, let out a cry of grief. He had sworn a vow of friendship with the Sea God.\nIgnoring the pleas of his vassals to stop, the king picked up the deceased god's sword and went to battle with the Dragon God.

The Dragon God had felled the Sea God, but was himself injured.
After fierce fighting, the human king had avenged his friend, but died from the burden of using a weapon only meant for the gods.
Afterwards, a huge wave engulfed the entire world…
A rise and a fall can, after all, happen in an instant. All things must return to the mother sea.

Lend me your ear for a moment.
In my country, whenever someone has a claim to make, it is customary to undergo the "Rite of Battle." Using this ceremony, things are decided with a battle of swords.
But if you ask me, it is nothing more than needless bloodshed.
We should resolutely abolish such a savage custom.

"Let's see this country reborn as an even greater nation!" With my heart full of ambition, I aspired to march into the senate, but was stopped by a guard.\n"I am a sage of the field. I have a complaint to levy with the senate, so please step aside," I told the guard, who responded thus.\n"Understood. Under the Rite of Battle, you must draw your blade and force your way in."

From there, I had to undergo the Rite of Battle several times, taking a number of lives.
The senate clamored as I entered covered in the blood of the fallen.
I took a deep breath and raised my voice.
"Our country's Rite of Battle is an act of barbarity and has slowed our development by a hundred years. We must abolish it at once!"

Until the notion passed the senate's judgment, every opponent to it had to be dealt with through the Rite of Battle. Even after its passing, every citizen who opposed the new measure had to be engaged with the Rite of Battle, and even the god of war who was unhappy with the neglect of the Rite of Battle had to be dealt with using the Rite of Battle…\nI could do nothing but sigh. How many more times would I have to perform the Rite of Battle to put an end to the Rite of Battle…?

In the depths of an underground labyrinth… An adventurer, who had used up all his tools and provisions loitering around, was driven into a corner. There, he found a certain tome. The tome had the words "Book of the Waterfowl," and a picture of a waterfowl floating on the water's surface painted on it. Right after that, he met with a monster that he could not beat no matter how hard he fought.

The adventurer had heard of it. A waterfowl appears to float elegantly along the water's surface, but in reality, below the water its feet are eagerly paddling away, allowing it to swim. Praying for any way to save himself, the adventurer concluded that this tome must have given him the the image of a waterfowl's nature as some kind of magic.

He then mustered up the last of his strength and fought the monster. But, just as expected, he could do it no harm. Finally, he let loose his final trump card: the invocation of that magic tome. Its power seemed to reach out to the approaching enemy.\nAnd then, as the enemy's power swelled up, the adventurer fell to a single blow from it.

In reality, a waterfowl does not paddle its feet eagerly under the water's surface. It paddles lightly, going forward with smooth efficiency. Magic too, is made like that. Using a minimum of physical strength, maximum force is generated. Yet, for some reason, that mistaken statement about the waterfowl spread, and that tome was made with malicious intent from some cursed inventor who knew the truth…
Q. Is this a pen? Or is it a horse?\nA. No, it's neither a pen nor a horse.
Q. Is this a bear?\nA. No, it's not a bear.\nIt's Dorothy.
Q: Don't you think Dorothy looks like a bear?\nA: Yes. Alice is more of a bear than Snow,\nbut Dorothy looks even more like a bear than Alice.
Q: How does Dorothy feel\nwhen she wears the bear mask?\nA: She's as cool as a cucumber.

There once was a traveling warrior whose sword was his only friend.
He traveled ceaselessly in search of vengeance, pursuing an ax-wielding man who had murdered his family.
Then, one day...
Spying an ax-wielding man who resembled his foe, the warrior licked his chops.

Steeling his courage, the warrior yelled, leaped, and sliced.
Following a fierce battle, his opponent fell.
But on looking carefully at the face of his fallen foe, the warrior once again tasted despair.
The dead man was not the mortal enemy he had pursued.

The warrior pulled himself together and continued his journey.
Spying another ax-wielding man who looked just like his foe, he cheered, "This time, it's him for sure!"
There was a ferocious struggle, and finally the man fell beneath his sword. But again the warrior's heart filled with despair.
The man he had killed was not his mortal enemy.
The warrior tossed away his broken sword, pried the ax from the dead man's grip, and hit the road again.

He was walking through a town when without warning a swordsman charged toward him, weapon raised, roaring, "Vengeance at last!"
The warrior tumbled to the ground, skull split by the assailant's sword.
As death embraced him, he heard a bewildered voice. "What? I could have sworn he was the one!"
Thus, the quest for vengeance against the ax-wielding enemy continued...

Where's there demand, there's supply. It's a basic business principle.\nWherever there's a dangerous, demanding task, I step in and get things handled.\nWe're all going to die someday, so you might as well fill your days up with thrills.

Infiltrate enemy territory, and steal the cipher key—this was the General's request.\nSo I became a traveling merchant, and approached an intelligence officer.\nTo come straight to the point, I managed to make off with the cipher key, and stole away looking innocent as a schoolgirl.

The meeting place was a cliff that towered above the sea.\nThe General showed up, surrounded by bodyguards, and I handed over the cipher key, but just then, gleaming objects emerged from the bodyguards' overcoats.\n"You know too much. But you won't be running your mouth off when you're six feet under," the General sneered.

Without missing a beat, I pulled out a copy of the General's account book.
"Always keep an ace up your sleeve."
In my hand I held proof that the General had pilfered a huge sum from the national treasury and was loaning it out illegally at extremely high rates.
"If I don't return safe and sound, the original will end up in the hands of the authorities."
The General admitted defeat and let me go.
Even in a cloudless night sky,\nthere are times when you can't see the moon.\nEver think about why that is?
Well, at times like that,\nthe moon gets tired of just hanging around in the sky,\nand it changes shape and goes down to earth for a visit.

The moon likes to turn into a cat
and stroll the streets at night.
It watches people,
and eavesdrops on them,
and decides which of the people is its favorite that night.

It is said that the mooncat grants that person
a small wish.
So if you cross paths with a cat in the nighttime,
be nice to it.
Some small, nice thing might happen to you.
Am I stupid wanting to send her chocolates even though I know she won't get them?
Am I stupid to believe that love is more than a card and a candy heart?
Am I stupid because I despaired of my helplessness and went crying to my friends?
Am I stupid to because I finally lost my nerve and just ate the chocolates myself?
One day, the young queen passed away. Not long after, the king died too.\nPeople whispered that the king had read the diary left behind by the dead queen and killed himself in despair.

What was written in the queen's diary? Rumors spread through the kingdom like wildfire.\nThe queen had been a young woman when the couple was wed.\nHer beauty had been legendary in the town, and one day the king, who was strolling the streets in disguise, had seen her and immediately fallen head over heels.

At the time, the queen had had a lover, and while reluctant to give the king her hand, at her parent's urging, she had agreed to the wedding.\nSo the people gossiped that the diary must have had nasty things to say about the king.

After the king's death, the queen's diary, which he had kept under lock and key, was read by a few members of the royal family.\nThe queen had written not a word about the king. From the day they met, to the wedding day, to the days they spend together, not a single, solitary word...

There once was a ninja called the Gray Wing, a shadowy, chameleon-like figure who would slink unnoticed into his enemies' midst.\nThe Gray Wing may have been a dreaded adversary, but he was not a god.\nDriven into a corner by the king's security force, left with nowhere to run, he set himself on fire and burned to a crisp.

Following the Gray Wing's death, confidential information about him continued leaking out little by little, and the security force began doubting themselves.\nNo one knew the Gray Wing's true identity. So how could they be sure the man who had burned himself to a crisp was truly the Gray Wing?

The security forces panicked.\nEvery trifling incident seemed to them to be the Gray Wing's doing. They were jumping at shadows.\nAny one of them could be the Gray Wing, they realized. Nerves frayed, they could not let their suspicions rest.

The king went pale when he heard the reports.
For some unknown reason, the men of the security force had begun killing one another.
The few survivors had life-threatening injuries.
The people came to call this gruesome incident "The Gray Wing's Revenge." No one ever found out for sure if the Gray Wing was alive or dead.

What does a craftsman keep in mind when making an instrument?
The timbre, and the way the instrument sounds when played.
That goes without saying.
But some instruments are different.
For instance, this one, which was forged from steel.

The ties between war and music go back to ancient times.
For example, songs and dances have been used to pray for victory.
And music has been used to accompany marches.
Music is a necessary part of war.
And that's what this instrument was made for.

Pluck the strings of this harp,
and it makes a sound like a heroic warrior drawing a stiff bow.
Play it normally, of course,
and its clear tone resounds through the battlefield.
Needless to say, it is solidly built to withstand abuse in battle.

But its forte is the music of the battlefield itself.
The sound of arms clashing, flesh slicing, metal clanging.
Break a bone with it, and its strings ring out in sympathy.
The sound will shake you to your bones and make you want to scream.
Let's just say it has a reputation for making a racket.
I have seen many men die.\nI have caused many men's deaths.\nAs a wayward soul, I knew that one day the god of death would catch up with me.

When that day came, I realized the god of death and I were alike. I too had turned to a sinister, inhuman being.\nFighting with all my strength, I kept him from reaping my soul, but he gouged a deep wound in my chest with his sickle before disappearing.

I did not find this strange. I bore no grudge against him.\nI was just relieved that at last the end was near. But my body was oozing pus, beginning to decompose. The rot of the open wound spread, eating me from inside. Afflicted by unspeakable pain, for days on end I impatiently awaited my final breath.

Today, at last, it will all be over. I retreat to the decayed citadel to quietly await my final moments.
"There's just one final thing I want to know."
I slice open the festering wound with my sword, pull out my entrails and kiss them. The taste of rot fills my mouth.
"This is the taste of my own corruption, the taste of the lowest, ugliest demon on earth... ah, this is the sweet taste of sin..."
The country was split into two religious sects that were constantly at war with one another. Each sect believed that God would descend at war's end and slice down the enemy with a holy scythe.
Yet no matter how much blood was spilled, God did not appear. On both sides, the corpses of devotees towered over the battlefield. The war went on until everyone in the kingdom was dead.

Then God appeared to the kingdom devastated by the holy war. He swung his holy scythe, reviving the soldiers buried in the earth. Once again, they separated into two camps, and the endless slaughter picked back up as if it had never ceased.
When God went back to heaven, laughing at the sight of blood and entrails strewn across the land, he went to the other gods and said—Who do you think will win this time? Gentlemen, place your bets.

There once was a magician who made a magic book that could turn anything to steel.
The curious magician went around turning all kinds of things to steel, until one day it occurred to him to test out the book's magic on a person's heart.
As the experiment's subject, he chose a woman, his unrequited love.
Sure enough, the instant he used the book, her heart turned to a cold, hard hunk of steel.

The magician immediately regretted what he had done, but had no way to change the woman's heart back.
He made his mind up to understand her heart just the way it was. To do that, he used the magic book to turn his heart too to steel.
At that moment, he completely lost interest in the woman—
because he understood completely how she felt and thought.

From then on, the two remained close, but without any romantic interest in one another.\nLike mushrooms in the forest, they stayed by one another's side until they died, with absolutely no passion.\nBefore long, the town they lived in was wiped out when a nearby volcano erupted.

Ages and ages later, when the ruins were excavated, the townsfolk still remained there, hollow husks of human beings buried beneath layers of ash.\nBecause the magician and the woman were huddled closely together,\nthe people who unearthed them oohed and ahhed, amazed that the bonds of love had withstood the test of time. The tale of their eternal love turned to legend…

A blade unearthed from the wasteland.
Too big to be called a sword, too heavy to fight with, too ugly to be ceremonial.
What was it for?
It left the archaeologists scratching their heads.

When they researched the site where the blade was dug up, and referenced documents from the same time period,
they came upon a story about the blade.
The knight who had owned the blade
had single-handedly wiped out two whole enemy kingdoms.

They analyzed the blade to find out what it was made of, and to their surprise,
they found it contained not only steel, but also human blood and bits of bone.
The archaeologists believed the blade had been made of the weapons and bodies of dead men,
to serve as a warning against war.

War broke out, and the archaeologists found out the tale was true.
The knight appeared in the storeroom where the blade was kept, exactly as the ancient documents described him.
He claimed to represent the legion of souls that resided in the sword.
They would never rest, explained the knight, until humanity realized the foolishness of war.
My name is the Black Book. Are you the king who will lead the world to salvation? Don't be so surprised, Your Majesty. For me, it is a simple matter to speak human words.

I sympathize with your distress, Your Majesty. On this occasion, however, we have no choice but to let them deal with your sister. When sorrow overtakes you, you may come to me and speak of your tribulations.
Reading is an admirable pursuit. Your Majesty—for me?? I shall peruse this volume if it comes on your recommendation... What is that? You think it odd for a book to read a book?

Noir? I would prefer to dispense with this nickname. My name, Your Majesty, is the Black Book. I am a grand tome of human wisdom... thus, to refer to me by such a curious moniker is, dare I say, inappropriate.

The people in the church murmured prayers, their eyes fixed on an ominous stone carving of a bull's head. A solemn atmosphere hung over the chapel. The worshipers were praying to select a sacrifice to offer to god. Following a long silence, the priest announced the sacred mandate: a shy young girl would serve as the sacrifice. Tears streamed down her cheeks as the priest let her down a corridor into the inner sanctum.

The crowd filed out, and silence settled again over the chapel. A boy stood there in a daze. He had been the childhood playmate of the girl who had been chosen as the sacrifice, and he had always had a crush on her. She was so shy, so quiet, and he was determined to watch over her. He could never forget the memory of her smiling face, which she had shown to him alone. After making sure the coast was clear, the boy crept into the inner sanctum.

At the end a dimly lit corridor, the boy spied a light on inside a room. He peeked in and saw the girl all alone, crying. The boy took her hand, and they ran from the church. It's okay, it's okay, I'll never leave you, he gently assured her as she sobbed, shoulders heaving. But the girl did not respond. She just hung her head, mumbling beneath her breath.\n

The girl's voice gradually got louder and finally turned to screams. "God, at last, you've chosen me! Give me all your love, more and more and more and more and..." As tears of joy streamed down her face, she drew out the sharp bull's horn she had secreted away and stabbed herself in the heart. The bloodstained bull's horn gleamed vividly, looking almost alive. \n

The man went to war for the sake of his beloved wife. On the battlefield, his chest was slashed and his belly was split open, but nothing could bring him to his knees. He was an immortal warrior. He wasn't gifted with any special physical ability, so if he weren't immortal, how could he have made it through?

The man had been immortal since he crossed paths with a small, beautiful bird one fateful day. Moved by the man's devotion to his wife, the bird had said to him, holding out a feather, "Carry this feather with you, and you will live to see your loved one again."

When the war ended, the man collected his payment and returned to live with his wife in the village. They lived in such poverty he couldn't even afford clothes for his wife. Nonetheless, his love for her gave him a reason to live.

Once again, the man went to war for the sake of his beloved wife. On the battlefield, his chest was slashed and his belly was split open, and he fell down dead. That very day, back in the village, the man's wife had gone to a merchant and sold his beloved beautiful bird feather.

Flames swallowed the house, leaping up as if to burn the black night sky. The boy barely escaped, but his father, his mother, his siblings, and everything he owned went up in flames. All the boy was left with was a battleaxe the bandits had left behind, and the burn marks on his body. He waited for the wounds to heal, cursing the gods for condemning him to this fate.

The boy grew up to be a man, but still the burns did not heal. He tried all types of medicine, but there seemed to be no hope of recovery. Each time he brushed away the maggots gnawing on the scars, the pain would flare back up, and he would sink into a foul mood. Searching for a way to forget the pain, the young man joined a band of mercenaries. He realized that the moment his sword descended on an enemy, then and only then did the pain ease. He had finally found an escape from his suffering.

Hired to fight in a conflict with a neighboring kingdom, the mercenaries laid waste to an enemy village. The young man wildly swung the battleax, determined to force his pain on others, to drown his suffering in the murderous ecstasy of war. He burst inside a home, beheaded the father as he pleaded for his life, hacked the mother's body to bits while shouting curses, and tossed the baby into the burning stove. For a short time, he forgot the pain of the burns.

Swept up in the ecstasy of slaughter, he lit fire to the room where the corpses lay, just for fun. On his way out, he spied a young girl standing near the burning home, crying. The moment he laid eyes on her, he remembered the fire of his youth that had taken everything from him, and the pain of the burn wounds flared up. Understanding there was only one way to end this suffering, he lit himself on fire, and handed the bloodstained battleax to the girl.
The king sung the praises\nof the eternal kingdom and the sun that would never set.
The queen sung the praises\nof the great king and his marvelous achievements.
The prince sung the praises\nof the staunchly loyal soldiers, always marching forward.
The jester just sung a song,\nridiculing the three members of the royal family who had rested on their laurels and met their doom.
She was slender, with smooth, white skin.\nThe hint of a dark shadow in her expression highlighted her beautiful features.\nBut something about the sword in her hand didn't seem to fit the picture.
Anger, sorrow, hatred.\nWhen emotions overwhelmed her, she would swing the sword, so there was never a lack of blood to quench its thirst.\nThe problem was that she couldn't put the sword down.
A heart and body in constant conflict.\nNo one in the world could understand her.\nAnd loneliness was eating her alive.
The long war came to an end, and darkness devoured her.\nBut her heart remained at peace.\nBecause she faced fate in the arms of the one she loved.

Your wish will be fulfilled
over Ikuma's dead body.
What do you want for in this lonely world of two?
Are you smiling?
Are you filled with sorrow, thinking it all a waste?
So many times, we have seen that at the final moment,
you have the urge to scream.
………………
…………
……

Case 1
Shadows, shadows, shadows, pressing in on all sides...
the shadows are trying to devour the other me.
What am I supposed to do?
My sense of being has never been too solid,
and now the shadows are threatening to devour it.
"Stop... don't touch.
It's... it's mine!"
This genuine desire wells up from deep inside me.
I give voice to my feelings for the first time,
and my determination takes on a concrete shape.
I feel it burning in my chest.

Case 2
But the black shadows will not stop attacking.
They are constantly gouging deep gashes into me.
I won't give in.
I can't give in.
I'm sick and tired of him laughing at me.
Rousing every bit of my meager strength, I tell myself,
move, move, move...
my nearly broken legs will not obey my will.
The pain prevents me from concentrating.

Case 3
It's okay.
I know what to do to get my mind under control.
"............"
I call his name like a magic spell,
and think of his hateful face,
and my pain eases.
It's okay. I can still fight.
I can protect him.
"Wait for me, my friend!"

Your wish will be fulfilled
over thousands of corpses.
What do you want in this lonely world of two?
Are you smiling?
Are you filled with sorrow, thinking it all a waste?
So many times, we have seen that at the final moment,
you have the urge to scream.
………………
…………
……

Case 1
I have no more strength left.
I gave everything I had in that last attack.
My emotions, my heart, my love, my warmth.
Now I feel nothing... nothing at all.
My vision is quickly turning black.
Ah, I did it!
"Well, guess this is goodbye..."
As the faint spark of life inside me burns out,
I crawl toward the girl in pieces on the ground,
and shut my eyes, seeing only darkness.

Case 2
"It's... so warm..."
We crossed paths in the depths of the darkness,
and at that instant,
it was as if we had known one another forever.
My light is...
always warm.
Like yours.
The light inside you is just like mine,
yet different at the same time.
I want to touch it again...
your soft cheek.
The deepest part of your filthy, decayed heart.

Case 3
But I can't.
In my mind, I reach with the hands I no longer have,
and embrace the girl with her eyes quietly closed.
Then, I murmur softly, "thanks"...

[Business Terminology: 100 Common Mistakes]\n■ Introduction\nPeople are constantly misusing business terms, thinking nothing of it. We hope that listing some common mistakes here will help you understand these terms and use them beautifully and correctly.

■ Mistake 1: Assessment
Situation: Conference Room Late Night
"What's your deal?
Do you want to do an assessment, or what?"
This man is a bully. He pretends to be asking for my opinion, while actually forcing his own opinion on me.

"I see... But it's my first time, so I'm not sure how good I'm going to be at it."\nI'm so tense I can barely get the words out. Still, doing my best to give him what he wants, I start the assessment.

■ Explanation\nAn assessment is a type of evaluation or review. It involves evaluating the impact the assessment subject has upon others. This term is not used in serious situations like the one in the example.

There once was a beautiful, elegant, ladylike princess called "Her Excellence of the Holy Blossom."
A knight protected the princess at all times.
The knight knew that he was the product of an adulterous affair by the princess' mother, the queen.
Because of this, the knight and the princess looked just alike.

Her Excellence of the Holy Blossom longed to see the world outside the palace, and begged the knight, "Please, let me go for a walk on my own."\nThe knight at first held her back, but his half-sister persisted.\nOne day, he at last gave in, and escorted the princess on a walk.

The knight turned away for just an instant, and Her Excellence of the Holy Blossom went running toward the market. She walked around for a while, and was taken captive by bandits.\nAfter three days and three nights of searching, he finally found her. A group of men had drugged her and turned her into a pleasure slave.

The knight made his mind up to kill them all, the princess and the men.\nThen, he went to a back-alley doctor and had a sex change operation.\nThe knight returned to the palace disguised as Her Excellence of the Holy Blossom. No one ever saw through the ruse.

The undertaker and his family rarely appeared in public, so the townsfolk saw them as strange, shadowy figures.\nAt funerals, the undertaker's eldest daughter, a beautiful girl in mourning clothes, would march along at the head of the procession, holding a staff.\nNobody knew her name or anything else about her.

One day, a man whose wife had recently died took one look at the beautiful girl in mourning clothes and fell in love.\nWhen the funeral ended, he proposed marriage right away, but she bluntly said no.\nThe man was not discouraged, and kept pursuing the girl.

"Your wife goes in the ground, and five minutes later you're out chasing girls!" Outraged, the man's family disowned him.\nBut she was the only thing he cared about, and he didn't let it bother him.\nFinally his persistence paid off, and the beautiful girl in mourning dress agreed to his proposal.

Soon after marrying the girl in mourning clothes, the man suddenly dropped dead.
The widowed girl went back to work at the funeral parlor.
A friend of the man saw her marching along at the head of a funeral procession and fell in love at first sight.
Once the funeral ended, he rushed to propose marriage to the beautiful girl in mourning clothes...

The imp blew Satan's flute, inviting people to follow the path of evil.\nOne day, an archangel grabbed hold of him as he was passing by and told him,\n"I have blessed you, and now your flute will no longer tempt people to follow the path of evil."

Convinced the archangel was lying, the imp blew the flute.
A man walking along the roadside picked up a stone and tossed it. It shattered the window of a house.
Smoke began billowing from the window. Seeing the smoke, the townsfolk rushed to the scene.
The imp had unwittingly done a good deed.

Unwilling to give up, the imp blew the flute again.
A man who had been standing alone waiting rushed up to a woman, snatched her bag, and ran off.
The imp grinned, but soon found out the truth.
The bag had been filled with drugs, and the buyers, left high and dry, turned paranoid and began killing one another. The authorities sent the woman a thank-you letter.

"Enough of this nonsense!" grumbled the imp, tossing away the flute and returning to depths of hell.
A curious child came upon the flute, picked it up and blew it.
The king and the bishop were passing by when they heard the sound and turned to give one another a look. They ducked into a hut, where the knights witnessed them making wild manly love.
Overnight, both the monarchy and the church lost their authority, and the kingdom descended into chaos and war.
We fought for what seemed like ages.\nTo kill those things that took a twisted human form.\nTo protect those precious to me, with my own hands.
We were deceived for so long.\nDeceived by people in a land we've never been, whose faces we've never seen\nIssuing orders from a safe distance.
We must have been in love.\nAnd despite the fact I couldn't save you,\nbut I never got to thank you for saving me.

These fragments glimmering deep in my depths...
they seem to be the vague memories of people...
the faded remnants of human wisdom...

H-hold on! I'll have you know my name is not "Booky Wooky!"
You may call me "Grimoire Weiss" I am a great compendium of ancient wisdom.
Treat me with respect!

You might imagine that destruction is the inevitable result of swinging a hammer, but with this hammer, that isn't always true. Sometimes it does not destroy what it hits. According to the law of cause and effect, swing a hammer at something soft, and it ought to break.

But this is a mystical hammer. Swing it, and what happens next is not determined by the law cause and effect.\nThis hammer works by a different law, the law of effortlessness. Effortlessness is the way to nirvana, where nothing is born and nothing dies, and this hammer belongs to that world.
Intuition and insight come without effort.\nThe right answer may end up to be the one drawn effortlessly from all the others, by a way of thinking that goes beyond cause and effect.

A magician puts something in a hat, and pulls out some other, apparently unrelated thing. But the trick is never as thrilling the second time, because the audience remembers what it saw the first. The trick no longer seems effortless.\nAnyway, until you swing the hammer, you don't know what will happen. It is useless to expect a certain result or want a certain outcome—you have to give up all effort.

[El Cid, the holy knight]
Has the ritual ended at last? Has His Holiness blessed you?
Then take this bow to His Majesty the king, so that the king of demons may be conquered!
Wh-what are you doing? C-cut it out!

[The Great Rodimus, Commander of the Demon Army]
Mwahahaha. What a chump! When did knights get so weak?
So this is the bow of legend. Once I give this to the Demon King, I'll be running this show in no time!
Everything's coming up Rodimus!
…hey, wait! What's the deal, man?

[The Cunning Bikaja, Demon Army Advisor]
Settle down, now! We're both working for the Demon King, let's act like it!
By the way, I like the looks of what you've got there. Let's have a look-see.
Only to borrow? Buddy, I did you a favor by asking nicely.
How's about instead of asking, I just break your neck!

[Jim, a poor orphan boy]
So far, so good–I snatched it without anyone seeing me.
It will be worth it to see the knight dead and the two demons at each other's throats.
But it doesn't really matter. I haven't eaten for three days, and somehow I have to scrounge up some money to buy bread.
I know, I'll go to the pawnshop in town and sell some stuff. Don't know how much longer I survive like this…

Eeeee.... eeeeek.... eeeeeeeek...
To the sound of three rusty squeals, I awoke.
It was morning.
Forgetting everything that happened in the wee hours,
when the squeals sounded, I was reborn into the world.

Screee.... eeee.... eeeeek....
A shrill racket announced nightfall.
From the moment this sound rang out, I was no longer myself.
My father entered my room,
mistaking me for my missing mother, calling out her name.

Eeeee.... eeeeek.... eeeeeeeek...
Morning had come again.
When I woke, I was no longer my mother—I was myself.
I rinsed off my sweat in the shower, went to the breakfast table,
and found my father there. He softly greeted me—recognizing me this time as myself.

I haven't heard either sound today.
My father has had an accident, shouts a voice on the other end of the phone line.
Now I can be myself, even at night.
I don't have to be reborn when morning comes.
I'm so glad I mixed those sleeping pills into his morning coffee.
The girl lay in bed.
One cold, cold morning, the girl decided she wasn't going to get out of bed, and she didn't. She just lay there.
She couldn't understand why people were always hustling and bustling and doing silly things like working.\nIt was so much easier to stay huddled in the blankets, cozy and warm...
The girl kept laying there, forever and ever.

There once was a book about happiness of all kinds.
Read it, and you'd learn many different ways to happy.
The book was made of the feathers of a lucky white bird.
You could only obtain the book by luck.
You just had to wait for it to flutter down in front of you, feather-light.

One man read the book
and learned the secret to building a healthy body.
Someone else read it, and learned how to get rich.
Another a new way of tending farmland and breeding crops.

Someone else gained the secret
to amass bountiful while asleep.
And yet another person learned how to build a machine
that could automatically make all the things needed to live.
It is said all the book's pages were blank white sheets.

What the book's owners learned would be imprinted on their brains forever.
When the book left its owner, it would flap into the air
and elegantly fly away.
The book would only grant knowledge to people who truly needed it,
those who quietly struggled like a swan desperately paddling beneath the water's surface.
"Listen up, rich folks, hear my song.\nYou've got power now, but it won't last long.\nYou think you're better than us, but you're wrong."
"People are all sacks of organs and flesh,\nsome a bit prettier, some a bit less.\nSo you've got money–we're not impressed."

As the masked woman belted out a song berating the nobility,
the crowd roared with approval.
They all longed to glimpse the face of this mystery lady,
and at last she gave in to their urging, taking to the stage and flinging off the mask,
revealing the wrinkled, spotted face of an old lady.

The crowd immediately deserted her.
Rather than a wrinkled old lady,
they wanted a young, beautiful girl to berate the nobles on their behalf.
Now a target of scorn, the old woman was beaten to death by street thugs.
A passing noble took pity on her and had the battered body buried.

Thank you for wanting me.
But I know you don't want the real me,
you just want the mask I put on for the world's sake,
don't you?
Nobody wants the real me...\nto be wanted, I have to hide what I really am. I have to do what I'm told.
I hate it when you say I'm just like a little doll.\nAnd quit saying I'm just like an idiot.\nBecause that's what I am, that's the real me.
Hey, are you listening, Mom?\nI'm telling you this because I love you.\nNo matter how much you hate me, I'll never quit loving you.
Ever since I met that big bear, something's been wrong with me.
This place is a mess. But I put off cleaning up.\nI've got laundry to do. But I can't manage to get out of bed.
I just laze around all day\nin my PJs.
Sorry I'm such a lost cause.\nBet you don't want me anymore.\nI'm begging you... please don't leave me.
[Master's Secret Techniques, Part 1]\nAlways think ten steps ahead of your opponent.\nWhen you sense him about to come at you, turn his own strength against him take him down.
[Master's Secret Techniques, Part 2]\nWinning battles is not necessary. All you have to do is not to lose.\nSurvival itself is your victory.

[Master's Secret Techniques, Part 3]
The wise are always willing to adapt.
Shed the skin of the past. Don't hesitate to transform.
Be natural, like flowing water.

Oh, that dojo?
The disciples there easily bested every advancing opponent.
Unable to bring down the fortress, the enemy withdrew. Though the people have no place to live, still they remain there, open and unashamed.
Interesting how allegiances change as quickly as the way the wind blows, isn't it?

Here I will write down my tale.\nA meteorite fell from the sky, and the world ended.\nThe people without wings eked out a living on the contaminated land, staring up at the winged people on the floating island in the sky.
A boy who lived on the contaminated land wondered aloud, "Why don't I have wings?"\n"Because you were born that way. Give it up," the adults commanded, but it only strengthened his urge to rebel.
The boy collected birds' feathers and stuck them together with wax to make wings, attaching them to his back.\n"Look at me!" the boy cried, flapped his wings and lifted off.

Spying the flying boy, the winged people calmly took action.\nThey drew their bows and loosed their arrows from the flying island, shooting the boy down.\nThe wingless people sunk into despair, and decided to spend their whole lives crawling around in the dirt.
Ow, that hurts! I'm bleeding! I'm soaked with blood down to my legs.\nTwinkle twinkle little star, how I wonder what you are.
The shafts of sun shining through the trees are stabbing my eyes… ouch, it hurts!\nI have to think about this. To the prince covered in dust rags, hello from inside my head.
The smell of shattered metal. The deepest depths of a stench-filled valley.\nBut the off-white middle finger sticking up from the ocean is twisting completely, revealing a cherry tomato.
Who has made me this way?\nAt the end of my penance, criss-crossed with compromises, I meet the devil.\nOnce my cup ran over, but then it was shattered and filled with tragedy.

Earthquakes, lightning strikes, tornadoes, tsunamis. Faced with this string of natural disasters, the people proclaimed, "The end of the world has come!"
Unable to stand by watching, a holy man built a shrine, and placed a flame stone inside it.
"It won't stop the disasters completely, but it's better than nothing."
Slowly, the disasters began to settle, and at last peace was restored to the world.

There once was a young man determined to make something of himself. But he had no special skills and fell into despair, his dreams shattered.
Hearing of the flame stone, he made up his mind.
His future held nothing but downfall and death. But if he stole that stone, the world would be filled with suffering,
and his name would be remembered for all eternity.

The young man crept into the shrine and stole the flame stone.\nBut to his surprise, nothing seemed to happen.\n"The string of disasters that had nearly destroyed the world should pick up where it left off," the young man told himself. So he kept on living, stubbornly waiting for that day to come.

The young man entered middle age, passed the prime of life, and then became a doddering old man.\nHe thought to himself that the legendary holy man was a fake. The string of disasters had run its course. It had nothing to do with the flame stone.\nBut to tell the truth, he didn't care. He had lived to be an old man. "It hadn't been such a bad life," he thought to himself.

3 years ago...
Is he going to eat through the blood tax?
People's happiness should be prioritized over pioneering!
I'll never forgive such an evil king.
As if!
2 years ago...\nWhy don't you pay attention to flood control in this village?!\nSpending taxes just to fill bellies for a day will hurt the future of the people. Why can't he understand that?
1 year ago...\nWhy?! Why is this world slaughtered by villains who make a living robbing others?!\nI will kill the one who imposes misery on others for their own sake!

Voice of the citizens...\nThe land has been declining for many years, and there was no future for us. Both the king who was worried over it and the kind lord were killed. Moreover, the village mayor, who became a thief to give bread to his children, was also murdered last year.\nWhy do we have to suffer like this? Pease tells us. Voice of the travelers...

That pterodactyl hunts for food in the skies.
When its giant body spreads its wings, it swallows the entire city in darkness.
Every once in a while it breathes out fire, burning its surroundings.
The city people are terrified of that thing.

Under the Lord's orders, the city was told to defeat the giant beast.
How if it soars high above the sky?
The people of the city created a mysterious arrow.
One that targets the dragon's shadow.
When the pterodactyl looms above, and the city falls to darkness, they would shoot this arrow at the beast's shadow to sew it in place. And then, they'd strike.

The day the pterodactyl's shadow would fall upon the city had arrived.\nThe city folk gathered all at once and pulled the bow's trigger, releasing the mystic arrow.\nThe beast's body became heavy, tore through the wind, and plummeted to the ground.

One’s own shadow becomes part of another when covered by another even greater.
The city folk tried to rush for cover and escape the pterodactyl's quickening descent.
But they couldn’t.
By the time they realized their own shadows had also been sewn to the ground, it was too late.

There were rumors in the sea.
Apparently, when entering the sea alone at twilight, you'll be kidnapped by a sea giant.
Who is the sea giant and where is the source of the rumors?
The rumor that no one can quite clearly explain seems to be passed down from a long time ago.
One day, my younger brother disappeared.

He was a baby who had just weaned, and it seemed that he'd gone somewhere when mother took her eyes off him.\nThe men searched all over, but nothing was found.\nMy mother fell asleep in because of her heartbreak.

I stood alone on the beach at twilight and called my brother's name as  a dare.
Something floats between the glittering waves that reflect the orange twilight.
It looked like a giant seahorse. It was the sea giant.
I found the little child sleeping on its back and I screamed.
I screamed for my brother to come back to us.

The sea giant replied that it would return the child if I came in his place.
I step into the sea without hesitation.
My healthy younger brother, or I, who was was sickly by nature and always bothering my mother.
I know exactly who should be with my mother.
My tears fell quietly as for the first time I felt the joy of filial piety.

There was an angel girl who was triple-threat, being a tomboy, cheerful, and caring.\nShe was interested in humans, but the archangel did not allow her to go to the lower world, saying, "It's too early for a half-hearted person like you."
The angel girl snuck down to the ground, taking a chance when the archangel was away.\nThere, she met a boy with lonely eyes.\nHe had just lost his love in an accident.

The boy was wouldn't open his heart and hated having the angel girl look after him at first.\nHowever, the boy and the angel girl gradually became attracted to each other.\nAnd then, an angry archangel came to banish the angel girl.

The archangel sighs heavily when he sees the angel girl who thinks only about the boy whether asleep or awake.
The archangel renounced her as an angel, so she reincarnated as a human on earth.
She will meet the boy again and so their fates may be tied.
Later, the girl who used to be an angel was so full of bliss that she blew a whistle loud enough to thank the archangel.

I was shown many different worlds after I encountered the little snake, its scales a warm, dry sort of gold that reminded me of sand. Upon being shown these visions, I felt an almost unbearable sense of frustration begin to rage like a fire inside me, threatening to burst the confines of my chest.

On one particular day, the visions showed me a young girl's demise, her mind dulled from the cocktail of drugs washing through her body. She felt nearly no pain as she desperately held her severed right arm against its stump, sluggish brain wondering over and over why it wouldn't stay put, head slowly shaking in confusion.

On yet another day, I saw another man attempt to hang himself, maddened by despair after his bride to be had been stolen away by none other than his own father. The attempt failed, leaving him unable to move at all, let alone to make another attempt on his life, and nothing but a long convalescence awaited him as his nurses ignored his every whispered plea for death.

I was shown so many moments of quiet desperation, every pang of sorrow exquisitely beautiful, each realization that all hope was lost tinged with the same lovely hue. When I realized this, I couldn't help but feel a small tinge of jealousy as I lifted my eyes heavenward, wondering if I, too, would ever be touched by such splendor.

The legitimate child born to the king and queen came from its mother's womb along with the corpse of a centipede. The king took one look at it and spat, "Evil!" and had it abandoned in a remote forest.

More than ten years past, a civil war broke out in the country. Though the entire royal family had been murdered, the Chancellor and his group fled into the forest. There in the forest was a tall young man living amongst the animals. Recognizing the boy, he then pleaded, "O' Centipede King! Fight with us!"

Although the centipede king could not understand nor communicate with humans, the moment he was handed a battle axe, he showed unparalleled bravery. Because of this, the Chancellor raised him to the rank of general and through valor, suppressed the opposing party.

When the kingdom had restored to its original state, the centipede king was met with strange looks. The Chancellor then poisoned the boy and succeeded the position as ruler of the kingdom. Later after he left for a long trip, he was found dead in a gruesome state. He had been attacked by animals and devoured alive.
For ages, foul waters pulled into the sea, and it suppurated, growing foul itself.
It twisted inside the fish who migrated through its waters, and any who consumed their poisoned flesh would find themselves eaten away from the inside, dying in agony.
It was even said that whenever the light of full moon touched its waters, those who lost their lives beneath its waves would walk the shore.
These pallid dead would beckon the living to return with them, to enter the land of the dead that waited in the black deep.
This stave echoes with the war cry of the Thunder God.
A deafening rolling rumble that rakes against the ears of every mortal in range.

All who hear it cower in the face of its enormity, for they know the Thunder God has seen their perfidities and come to exact just punishment. They are filled with the dread certainty of it. Those who know the wrongs they've committed immediately repent. Those unaware of what sparked his wrath can only pray.
In this way, the roll of the Thunder God's call kept the land in harmony.

"The marshmallows are ready!"
Dorothy held out a marshmallow she had roasted on a stick.
Careful not to burn my tongue, I nibbled on the lining crispy layer first, before biting down on the gooey center. It instantly melted in my mouth.

"I burnt it again..."
Looking over, I saw Sleeping Beauty struggling to toast her marshmallow to a perfect brown.
"It's okay. I can eat it like this."
Peeling off the burnt bits, I popped the rest of it in my mouth. If only she were more awake, she'd look more her age.

"They taste even better smooshed between crackers!"
The crisp texture from the crackers combined with sweet chocolate added a new sensation. After a sip of black coffee, I caught myself smiling.
"The Three Little Pigs would probably enjoy this." Wiping the chocolate from the corner of Sleeping Beauty's mouth, I began to plan our next camping trip.

The annoying morning chirps of the birds woke me up.
I rubbing my sleepy eyes, I tip-toed around the snoozing Alice and out of the tent.

The scent of last night's fire lingered in the air.
I could hear the murmur of a river of in the distance. The tree's branches swayed in the wind.
I wanted to sleep a little longer, but this is just as relaxing.

I took in deep breaths, as if breathing new life into me.
Mornings like this aren't so bad.
It's rather pleasant.

"Waking up in the morning is kinda nice."
My words were quickly followed by an exaggerated yawn.
"Yaaawn... A nap sounds better though."
I smiled imagining Alice shaking her herself awake.

A small light flickered in the pitch-black world.
The flame danced in the gentle breeze. Gentle, yet mesmerizing.

Outdoor grilling is another special experience.
The aroma of the smoke and the charcoal flavoring adds a unique taste making the trip worthwhile.

"...But that not all there is."
The two girls looked back at me with calm expressions. While not quite as apparent, it was a warmer expression than usual.

"It's almost like magic."
Camping is fun no matter what you do. Ordinary moments turn into special memories.
Realizing this, the red-haired scientist turned the magic of camp into her new obsession.

I'm just your run-of-the-mill girl.
Who I'm really proud of is my big sister. She's beauty who turns everyone's heads. Not to mention. she's our lord's girlfriend.
What a dashing and wonderful man he is, too. Oh, how I envy you, Sis.

I was walking absentmindedly down a path in the forest with my little sister.
Was our sis abandoned because he found a gold digger? Did he strangled her because she threw a fit?
No... I'll have him pay for this!

The Witch of thh Dark Woods said to me: "You wish to be my apprentice, eh? Are you prepared to walk the fires of hell?"
Years later, I became a witch. And with my new powers I summoned demons to attack our lord.
After capturing him, I clenched my sword with all my might and killed him.

One day I had finally found a good man and was wed. But he found another woman.
Just when I had proof of the affair, I was poisoned.
When my sister learns of this truth, surely she will take the same path as me and seek revenge.
Th-that's right... The fires of hell will destroy the cause of death. Please before... I'm burned...

He was a musician, and every day he stepped to the podium to wave his conductor's baton aloft. The orchestra he lead was a fledgeling one, but he could see a far off future where they made beautiful music under his direction. He could practically hear it.\n\nOne day, a group of callow young nobles came to his area and began kicking up such a racket night after night that it got in the way of his music.

One night, as the musician stewed in frustration after night after night of this inconsiderate noise, a strange old man came to call on him, and presented him with a new conductor's baton.\n\n"Use this to reclaim your music," he said.

That night, the young men were at it again, and the musician took up the baton given to him by the mysterious stranger. He stormed over to the young nobles' rooms, raised the baton, and began to conduct.\n\nWith each sweeping gesture of the baton, blood spattered across the ground.

He ended his performance to find not a baton in his hands, but a scythe. All around him, the world had returned to a peaceful and comforting silence.\nThe musician tilted his head, smiling, once again listening to that lovely melody only he could hear...

There was once someone who decided to live apart from his ordinary fellows, becoming a swordsman.\n\nHe surpassed all others in his victories with a sword, and none could defeat him in a ordinary challenge.
There was once someone who became utterly detached from mundane affairs.\n\nHe was immune to the allure of riches and beauty both, and had eyes only for his own studies.

There was once someone who threw himself into his studies, up on his lonely mountain.\n\nHe watched a falcon wheeling in the endless blue of the sky, watched its sharp descent as it dove on the hunt, and attained enlightenment.

There was once someone who pursued the magic of that bird, its enchanted wingbeat, studying, training, and honing his skill with a blade to the utmost.\n\nFor that, he abandoned language, consumed that magical bird, imitated its enchanted wingbeats, transformed himself mind and body.
There was once a man who had a magical artifact that let him see the future. With all that would be known to him, there were none able to stand against him.

However, although his victory was assured, he knew his enemies would refuse to surrender. They would elect to die fighting against him, instead. They would elect to bring the world down with them, creating a great weapon of self-annihilation that guaranteed a future where only he survived.
Left alone in that world, he knew with certainty he would have nothing to look forward to for all the rest of his days but solitude and loneliness.
Right before the battle was to start, he took the artifact that let him see the future and flung it away into the sea.\nWhat would happen to it after that, or to him, he hadn't any idea...
A phone rings. Someone picks it up, and hears a voice.
All those who hear this voice go mad.
In their madness, they make a phone call.
A phone rings. And another. The world is filled with a cacophony of ringtones. They grow more numerous. They grow louder, and louder...

...The Dáinsleif\nA legendary enchanted sword which is said to refuse its scabbard until it's drunk dry the blood of those it fells in battle. We have here an instrument which has been given the same name. A violin named after an enchanted sword. One does wonder if it possesses any of the same powers...

I've heard rumors.
Rumors that its sound will resonate until it's consumed the blood of its violinist.
Rumors that it forces its violinist to play until they are consumed.
Rumors that the bit of red on its body must be blood.

I've heard other rumors, too.
Rumors that the strings of this terrifying instrument will slice off the fingers that try to silence them.
Terrified mutterings of those afraid to approach the sinister looking violin.
Even more rumors, that any who hear its music will surely be cursed.

I asked the violinist about the rumors.
She assured me that the people spreading the rumors were all fools, saying "This is a beautiful instrument, with a beautiful timbre, like no other! How are they so scared just because of a strange name?"
Scoffing, she stroked the instrument. "But that's alright, isn't it baby? Just means I get to keep you all to yourself. All mine..."
She smiled, pale bloodless lips and sallow face a marked contrast to the startling red staining her fingertips.
It's been cold tonight. It's freezing out, and the night has been so long...honestly I half thought it would never end, but it's almost over now.
Just open your eyes. Can you see it? That pure light surrounding you, a gentle light that brings blessings.\n\nThe morning has come.

Dawn.
Bringing with it a peaceful death.
A gentle death.
A blessed release from living.
Freedom from your mortal flesh.

Congratulations.
Congratulations on your death!
A stirring round of applause for the coming morning.
Congratulations!
Congratulations!!
I gave you a present!\nIt's a charm with bells that make such a pretty sound...\nNow we can be together always!
Just as the sun is beginning to rise, I hear the sound of bells beginning to fade into the distance.\nI smile, watching you go, knowing you must be returning there once again.

The moment when the morning dew spills from the buds of morning glories.
When one licks the crumbs from the corner of their mouth.
And the sound of gurgling that quenches my parched throat.
They all bring back a single memory.
The dream the scorpion showed me was sweet yet limited, granting me both the greatest pleasure and a feeling of inadequacy I could not reach.
Just like the moment a boy become a man.\nWhen an innocent relationship succumbs to instinct.\nA moment of change where you can't look back is the most glamorous and seductive.

Each time I was shown a scene, I became more excited and the heat gushing from deep inside me became more intense.\n...I beg of you. I want to experience this sweet excitement forever. Leave me in the moment of joyful pleasure.

A city where everything is sophisticated, clean, and orderly. That's where I live.\nI was on my way to work as usual when I came across a dispute. A woman was having an argument with a mounted policeman and tried to snatch a rifle from him.\nThe gun went off and the noise was so loud that I fainted on the spot.

When I woke up, I found myself in a small, bleak room, being cared for by the woman from earlier.
"This is my hideout. I thought I should tell you the truth to make up for all the trouble I've caused."
I asked what she meant.
"Humans have been immortal for a long time, but instead we erase our memories at regular intervals."

She told me everything. She said that although she had become immortal, the human brain has its limits, and if she didn't erase her memories at regular intervals, she would become disabled.\n"I don't care if I'm disabled. I just don't want to lose the memories of the people I love. That's why I'm fighting the system."\nI squeezed her hand and replied, "Let me help you!"

Oh, my. Look how happy he is, smiling and laughing.\nOh, right. It was loaded with magic bullets. As I recall, artists and writers abused it because it gave them divine inspiration, thus it was banned. But since it can be used as gunpowder, it's at the military's disposal.\nUnlike dying by a gunshot wound, you die while having a fantasy dream.

That axe was made by a mediator between man and God.\nIts power was infinite, surpassing all limitations.\nAfter an ancient mythical battle, the axe was housed in a forest created as a place for humans and gods to interact.
Usage of the axe was limited to that forest, and the events that resulted from its use could only be ascertained by those who had seen the axe in the forest.

It was a forest of infinity, to retain and enshrine the power of infinity inside. The fact that the infinite forest kept in contact with the outside indicated that the outside world was itself infinite.
The axe exists both in the forest and not in the forest. If one of those states is to be fixed, then the laws of the world would be both right and wrong, and then neither would exist...

I found this book when I was sorting through my grandfather's belongings.
It had an old cover and a creepy spider stuck to it.
The spider was made of rusty metal.
But when I opened it, all I saw were yellowed pages with no writing on them.
I couldn't figure out what the hell it was.

I hooked my fingers around the rusty spider's legs.\nBlood poured out of my fingers and onto the spider's back.\nThen, unexpectedly, the spider began to move, and the blood was sucked up by its dimly glowing back.

After the spider absorbed my blood, words appeared on the blank pages.
[How to Curse and Kill Your Enemy]
[How to Summon Otherworldly Demons]
[How to Transfer an Old Spirit to a Young Body]

That reminds me.
The morning my grandfather died, I woke up extremely uncomfortable.
The memories of the decade or so that I lived felt like someone else's.
Suddenly, my way of speech felt childish.
Who is inhabiting this body, thinking and acting as me?
The smell of the clotted blood that clings to me... I wonder if you'd still wash it away, for me? Wash me clean of all this red.
I keep on moving forward, with memories I can forget held within, alongside a tiny spark of light. Moving forward is the only thing left for me to do, now...
If I'd never met you that day, I might not be in such dire straights now.
Even so, meeting you taught me I could still love someone, despite how empty I was inside. I want to thank you for that, and I...

Yes, that's right, I can hear the voices of the fae. I've always had powerful spiritual senses, ever since I was a child, and I could sense things clearly once I was ten or so. Fae are playful, and they'll tell you all sorts of things, hah!

Hmph. "Voices of the fae"? You expect me to buy that dreck? Just a grab for attention if you ask me! People come to you asking if you can find lost items or lost people and you just tell them whatever you think they'll believe. It's all a bunch of nothing but they still come thanking you when they find whatever it was. Ugh, I swear there's no hope for this world.

I got a real serious request from the royal knights. Someone kidnapped and murdered a kid and they want my help finding some kind of clue to who did it. I went to to the scene of the crime. The spirit of the kid was still there, but the only thing it told me was that the killer might have been some sort of creature, something made from the darkness swirling in human hearts. Crazy stuff, right? So obviously, that was a pack of lies.

Obviously at the time it was pitch dark out. Pitch dark, except for the two points of red light that appeared while I was talking to the kid's spirit. The ghost was right there, hovering, and then this voice said, "So, you've seen my true form, have you, girl?" I tried to stammer out a reply, but my hands rose of their own accord, crushing my windpipe and smothering my words. I struggled and flailed for control. It was an awful, painful way to die, really.
Hey now, you two. You two kids. Come over here and help a poor old fortune teller make a living, won't you?

You're lovers, aren't you? Come here, try playing this instrument. They say that couples strongly bound by fate can make the most beautiful music if they play it. If you can play something lovely it'll be a sure sign.

...Oh dear. Hehe...\nThat was just awful. I didn't even know it was possible to make such terrible sounds. You two must be the most incompatible people I've ever seen. Hey, now, sorry, I'm just telling it like I see it. You should probably just break up and save yourselves the pain

...Keeheehee! Those two aren't going to last long after this. God, I can't believe these fools! Every one of them thinks they're fated to be together. Can't handle the fact that it's all just coincidence 99% of the time. ...Still, can't deny it'd be nice to hear something lovely played, just once before I die.

The first things I'd discovered, buried in the swooping curves of the script that seemed to float upon the mirror's surface, was prophecy. And the prophecy those words was unerring, infallible. No matter how little I wished to know, no matter how thoroughly I detested the knowledge when I had it, the words would appear as long as the staff willed it so.

I. What I think of my new wielder.

SpinelessImpotentBlathererPervertDisgustingWretchWretchWretch
ObsceneDamagedStubbornWretchDarkCrawlingFoolVillainYouDisgustMeDisgustingDisgusting
FreakishdesiresCruelUnjustSlovenlyLittleToadNotYouNotYouNoNoNO!

II. A few things my wielder needs.

MannersCourtesyMortificationOfTheFleshTemptationTormentInHell
FinancialRuinPayForWhatYou'veDonePunishmentHideYourselfAwayBeStruckByAnEarthquakeFallVictimToVisciousCrime
KillingInstinctsRegretRecriminationGriefLustPrideToSufferATragicAccident.

III. A glimpse at my wielder's future.

DeathByCurseByStrangulationByGunshotByKnifeByMiseryByHangingByTorture
ByDrowningByCollisionByCrushingByBurningBySuicideByStarvationByMadness
ByExecutionExecutionExecutionExecutionExecutionExecutionExecutionExecutionExecutionExecutionExecution
Surrendering myself to the hatred, I kept up the slaughter. And, when more came to avenge my victims, I killed them too.

The cycle repeated, teaching me again and again the fragility of life. I learned too, how beautiful love is, how it can shine through even as the life that sustains it is extinguished. I came to know them, somehow not entirely consumed by revenge even as they excoriated me for my heinous actions.
Even so, I came to realize that a noble soul can do nothing in the face of an overwhelming power, and that this...this is the reason sorrow exists in the world.

The dream the wolf gifted me with was endlessly desolate, and endlessly revelatory, exposing all the truths of human nature. Even now I'm still shaken by it, cast adrift in an endless, maddening darkness.

There once was a young musician who loved the flute. He found two other musicians with the same passion as he, and so the trio traveled the country playing for the public. Their performances were well received and were always welcomed with a warm round of applause.

The young male had fallen madly in love with the female musician. However, the female, obsessed with romance, revealed one day that she had no problem sleeping with another man if he failed to meet her needs.

The other middle aged flutist was a man in body, but carried the heart of a maiden. And he was in love with the young man. Overcoming the obstacles of gender in the name of love had set the older man's heart ablaze.

Though the young man appeared eloquent in public, underneath that guise was a perverted sexual deviant. Every night he'd rub and lick the ■■ of ■■, relish in the scent and indulge himself with ■■. It is their distorted chords that excites the people.
Does this outfit suit a warrior of Justice?\nAs long as it's what everyone wishes...
Thank you for your support.\nI didn't think I'd live to see the day.
I only hope this won't be the last time I'm presented such an award. Until then, I will greatly honor this moment.
...Surely my chances are slim towards setting a record next year.

That day was like any other day. The dawn of a new day.
The house was usually full of rustle and bustle, but today it was quiet. Too quiet.
That morning, a single gunshot flew straight through the window casting a warning.
And for that house, the day never begun. Not that day, nor the next, nor the day after that. Never again.

The neighbors of that house thought the owner to be a nuisance for years. He began his mornings in the loudest manner possible. Then one day he was shot in the forehead by the first shot that signaled the start of the day.

Name: Frontier Flask
Size: 10x12x03
Material: Unknown metal
Decorative Material: Unknown mineral
Usage: To store alcoholic beverages

Magic Effect 1: Preserves current state\nMagic Effect 2: Atomic conversion of contents (into alcohol)\nRemarks: Any object inside this flask can be converted into liquor. Time needed for conversion is inversely proportion to the magical strength of the contents.

Additional Research: Conversion of water into an alcoholic beverage
Object: Water
Conversion Period: 1 day
Taste: Thirst-quenching, refreshing
Remarks: Types of water have may have varying flavors. Additional research is required.

Additional Research 2: Conversion of body fluids into alcoholic beverages
Object: Blood
Conversion Period: 3 days
Taste: Mellow and rich. Slightly addictive.
Remarks: Taste varies on age and sex of the donor and condition of blood.
Rumors have begun to spread about a vampire. Further research is temporarily abandoned.
"My brother is more important to me than anything. That's why anyone who would make him sad is evil and ought to expect to die for it."
"Brother, did...did I do something wrong?"\n...The girl looked down at her hands, wrapped around the throat of a girl who'd been pierced by arrows.
...The boy himself trembled as he looked at the girl he'd been happily chatting with moments before, now so suddenly and violently dead.\n"Brother, please. Please don't look at me like that..."

"If it wasn't for that little snake, Brother would never have had to suffer...I'm sorry."\nThe girl woke screaming from the nightmares that continued to plague her, as she would do over, and over again, until she broke.

Chirp. Chirp. Chirp. A little bird sang on incessantly.
I put down the reference book I was reading and cupped my head in my palms.
How many times now has it gotten on my nerves, disrupting my concentration?
Chirp. Chirp. Chirp.

My parents send me money, despite being tight on savings.\nMy family's fate rests on me passing my civil service exam this year. If I fail, we'll be left for the wolves.\nI'm studying for my life here, and yet you keep chirping away without a care in the world...!

Chirp. Chirp. Chirp. Chirp. Chirp. Thwack!
That last one was the sound of the end of my patience.
I grabbed my club and flew out the window. And smashed all the little birdies to death.
Thud! Thud! Crack! Smack!

Huh? Who are you?
Hmph. Just the neighbor. Sorry, but I'm in the middle of my studies, so come back some other—Wh-Why do you have a club?!
I have to pay for cruelly killing your little friends?
W-Wait— Thwack!

Behind the guise of a magic violin was a demon.\nThis demon violin was left behind in an abandoned castle.\nBut then a fool who set forth in the ruins found its beauty inspiring, and so played a song. At the end of it, the demon deemed the performance so poorly that he devoured the poor soul.

One day a man appeared, and with that violin he began to play. At the end of his performance, the demon declared it would eat the musician. The man then said, "If I must be devoured, then so be it. However, as a musician, it would bring me much sadness to leave this world have that be my final piece. Allow me one final serenade before taking my life."
