There was once a gentleman who loved the arts with a passion, and would venture to the museum on each day he had free for personal pursuits, passing the time from dawn until dusk. One day while he took in a painting, a woman called out to him. She told him of her dream to be a painter, and asked if he would view her work.

She led him away, and the two found themselves at her studio. She reached out, fingertips brushing against the watercolor painting propped against her easel. When she did, the paint fell away, transmuting itself into a fine golden dust. He was flabbergasted, but she merely smiled sweetly and said, "This is no mere parlor trick. My touch can reveal the true nature of things."

"I see," he said, realizing the line about wanting to be a painter had been a mere lure for him. "What do you want, then?" She laughed, saying "I'm simply dying to reveal the truth of you, good sir. I've hardly seen another better at hiding his true nature beneath a pretty facade."

The gentleman was aware, suddenly, that he had likely put himself in great danger coming here. Alas for him, this insight came far too late. The woman reached out and brushed him with her fingertips, and in the blink of an eye he transformed into a wickedly sharp scythe. It seems the gentle art lover had been but a mask, concealing the merciless killer beneath.

Welcome to the manor. I take it you're the new crop of servants? How marvelously upstanding of you to support your families like this. You'll need to carefully follow my orders if you want to work here, and I may have a few...special requests. If I do, I'll use this flute, so make sure to obey. If you don't, well, I don't like to think what the magic of the flute's going to do to you.

You there...you know, you've got a lovely face. Almost as lovely as the melody this flute makes. I'd like you to hurt yourself, by tomorrow. If you don't, then I may have to do it for you. Perhaps we could flay the skin from your lovely face?

And you, why you're as slim and willowy as the flute! I'll need you to put on a pound or few. If you don't, well, perhaps a little light disembowlement?

Ah, what gorgeous lustrous hair you have! I'll need you to chop it off, or I'll have to do it myself, and I might just take off everything above the neck...You understand, right?

...Oh, dear! You've all done so well! Scratches on your face, a short boyish haircut, that roly-poly figure in your ragged clothes...

It's only, well, I'm terribly sorry...

It seems like the flute doesn't think any of it is good enough.

Ooh! Look at this wonderful meal, I'm certain it has many beautifying properties...There's rolls made with the skin from a lovely face, sausage made from fresh entrails, and a whole roasted head!

It's not quite enough, either, but I'll be sure to offer your families jobs to help them get through the financial hardship of your loss.
There's not enough tragedy in the world, as it is. There's not enough despair of the sort that comes when people are made to suffer an unending chain of hatred and misery.
There's not nearly enough, and I suppose I must be the one to fix that. I have to. Just as Crow told me to do, in a dream. I must weave a harmony of all the world's sorrow.

Now, won't you bemoan your sorrow? Won't you scream out your misery?\nThere's no need for anyone to stay on the sidelines. You, all of you, and I...we're going to build a harmony of sorrow, the misery of all humanity.
So, let me hear your lovely voice?\nI believe in you. In the power of our harmony.

Once there was a world whose lands were brimming with truly astonishing power. All of its flora and fauna instinctively drew upon this power, sustaining their own existence. I was one of their number, a plant that came to be known as the World Tree. There was one thing in the world however, which could not draw upon the power of the land: Humankind.

Humans struggled to survive in those lands, rife with powerful creatures. They struggled, and struggled, and ultimately left the lands behind for a life among the branches of we trees, who had by this time grown large as the very mountains. They tapped our branches and drank our sap, consumed the fruit we bore. They felled still more branches to make their houses, and stripped our bark and leaves to craft clothes for themselves.

For a time they gained a place in which to live in peace, and prospered, multiplying. They built a civilization and multiplied still more, flourishing in their arts. In time they crafted books from materials harvested of our bodies. In time, they at last learned to draw upon the power in the land, using us as the conduit. This final art of theirs, however, we could not endure, and we began to wither.

I cannot be sure when my conciousness was drawn forward thus, when I learned the words and wisdom of humankind and became aware of myself in a new way. To be blunt, it is creepily unpleasant, to feel these humans crawling all across my body. My spirit has not yet withered, for all their depredations, and I look forward with joy to the day this species of pests will perish, once my mortal body succumbs to their blight. My mind will endure.

A certain Saint once said:
Only believe, and you will be saved.

Now, perhaps you'll say such words are foolish. Even so, I can attest that my belief has saved me. In fact, my belief has opened many possibilities.
Why do I feel unhappy? I asked myself this, and wondered how happiness might be gained. I felt all would be clear once I knew the underlying reasons.

Once I knew, all I need do would be to eliminate the sources of my unhappiness, one by one. To find sources of happiness, one by one, building up my joy like bricks in a wall. Yes, I was saved because I had faith. I became a nun in order to live up to the love of the divine.

A certain girl once said:
Brother? I think I messed up. If only you were here, Brother, then I...

I think, perhaps...I've been too arrogant?

I heard a rumor about a mysterious armory. They say that if you answer the voice within, one day a unique weapon will be made ready for you, and you alone.\n\nI want to bring hope to people. I want to be light they look to. ...And I wonder, what sort of weapon the armory will gift a person such as me?

I heard the voice as I entered the armory, echoing from somewhere within. Did I come seeking light? This must be the question. It's just as the rumors say! "Yes!" I answer enthusiastically, and this time the light asks me what sort of light I seek. "Hope," I say, and the light pauses now. "What is hope?" it asks, and I respond immediately, "Hope illuminates and brings warmth to the people it touches."

"How warm is it, then?" ...Very warm, I answer, even as I begin to have misgivings.\nStill the voice presses me for more details. "Warm enough to burn?" "How many lights? Is more always better?" "Do you favor physical attacks or magic?" "How are you feeling?" More is better, no, I don't think so, a strong defense is the best offense, and... er, I'm sorry, it's getting hard to hear you....

Before I realized what had happened, my body had been transformed into the Torchbriar Blade. The light I emit is indeed hot enough to burn, shining out of innumerable thorns. Oh. I see.. 'More is better.'

I really am a very unique weapon, created for myself and no other. I can be a light of hope for others, now, I suppose.

...Still, it's not exactly what I had in mind.
"I won't want anything, anymore. I won't even try.\nSo please...please, don't take anything more from me."\nThe repo man smiled a crooked smile, and raised his fists to take her life.

A job well done, the repo man wandered away into the void, still smiling. "It's a dream. And a dream, after all, may come true," he said to himself, tongue darting out to wipe away a vivid red stain at the corner of his mouth with a horrible smack of his lips...

"No matter how much their lips protest, in their hearts, people long for me to do as I will. It's obvious! They're simply afraid those around them will judge them for that desire. I would never judge you. We are the same, after all... you have the same scent about you."

And the girl, who still refused to acknowledge that no one, not others and certainly not herself, understood her heart, sat for a moment in a crimson-soaked silence before giving herself over to rage. She determined to find other girls, girls with the right potential, and make their wishes come true. She did this countless, countless times, even knowing how it would end...
The creations of a certain mage. They look like no more than pieces of ordinary currency at a glance, but are clearly some sort of magical artifact.
The mage who created this artifact claimed to hail from another world entirely. The design of it is said to match one of the currencies found in that world.

It seems that despite being a mage, he'd nearly ruined his health and livelihood with gambling to the point he saw death as the only option to escape. Throwing himself from the top of a tower, he instead found himself falling into this world.

His life in this world has been much richer, generally. Whenever he felt the urge to return to gambling, he would look at the artifact and shore up his resolve. By turning the currency of his own world into an artifact, it seems he's managed to escape the greed that nearly destroyed him.

A dragon lay collapsed in a heap upon the steep, rocky banks of a river. It was as small and delicate as a cat, and terribly weak. A boy found it, and clutched it to his chest, keeping it warm as he carried it back to his house. The next day, he woke to the sensation of something soft brushing his cheek. It seemed the little dragon had grown quite fond of its rescuer.

They spent their days rambling through the mountain wilds, and grew ever more fond of each other. His parents were initially inclined to forbid him to keep the dragon as a pet, but the adorable little creature soon won over the hearts of even the village elders.
However, the dragon was silent. No matter how hard it tried, it couldn't make a sound, only tiny, rasping sounds. So the boy prayed, hoping one day he'd get to hear his friend's voice.

One day, the village was attacked by bandits, who put everyone to the sword. Seeing the slaughter, the little dragon found its body engulfed in flame, and transformed to a towering, enormous size. In a blaze of revenge, it dispatched the bandits, letting out an anguished roar in front of the body of the boy. Then, in a beautiful voice, it began to sing a haunting requiem.
What are you, a freshman? What's your major? How many credits are you taking? Oh, Introduction to Chocobo Science?

Geez, not interested in challenging yourself are you? What? Who told you it would be difficult? Don't believe a word of it! As long as you've got a plan for writing reports, you can basically sleep through it and still pass!
Here, I'll lend you this book. Just copy stuff out of here, to write your reports and you'll be golden! A guaranteed A+, I tell you!

-Remember to cite your sources.
-Please keep verbatim quotes to less than 200 words and make sure to clearly attribute the source you copied from.
-You need more sources than just 'Chocobo Memoria,' so take more care in doing research.

All assignments that violate these rules will not be counted towards your grade, so please resubmit the necessary papers by the end of the week.

It's a pleasure to have the chance to work with you. I'm Nolo, from the department of chocobo weapon quality control. We thank you for submitting Chocobo Feathers for our consideration. There are a few points that need to be corrected, so please read our findings carefully.
I'm afraid that the chocobo-like color does not meet our style guidelines, so please lower the saturation of the hue after consulting page three of the regulation book.
The wings have no sense of movement to them, so please consult the model design and try to keep in mind a chocobo's wing flutter when you draw up the new feather design.

Thank you for your time. This is Nolo, from the department of chocobo weapon quality control. How are the revisions coming along? The deadline for resubmission has already passed, so please get in touch with me as soon as possible.

There was once kingdom, and in it, a young knight. He was cheerful, loved flirting, and could never walk away from someone in need of help. "As a knight of Grandshelt," was one of his favorite phrases.
He met a girl as he travelled in search of crystals. She told him she'd lost her doll in the woods across the way. "Leave it to me," he said "There's no need to worry, I'll find it in no time."
He found the doll under the trees, but the moment he laid his hand on it, the doll began to laugh. It was an eerie sound. Enveloped by a blinding light, that eerie voice echoed through him.

"Keheheh...I sense a desire that doesn't exist in this world."\nHe opened his eyes to see two dolls standing in front of him, whispering. Oh, right, the boy thought. I'm dreaming. Of course.\n"Welcome, to what I'm pretty sure is the worst world ever," one of the dolls said in a genial voice.
[Reporter's Observations I]\nA rich man died. His last words were, "Shiny." The very last thing he said before his death. The rumor grew from this, somehow, that he must have hidden a great treasure.

[Reporter's Observations II]\nPerhaps something about what he'd said leading up to his death had led people to this conclusion. After he died, various people (read: probably charlatans), ran about busily unravelling the mystery of "shiny."

[Reporter's Observations III]\nHowever, no one ever came upon an answer. The mystery remained a mystery until 15 years after the rich man's death. "Shiny." It was the name he'd given to his favorite toy sword as a young child.

[Reporter's Observations IV]\nThe toy was still in the house he'd been raised in. Picking up the dust covered thing, one could press a button in the hilt. If you did, the little toy blade would shine. It was a toy made to resemble a legendary sword, and one of his favorite playthings.\nThis man, who had for himself wealth, land, and fame, one of the few richest in the world... It seems certain to me that this man still remembered fondly playing with this toy sword as one of the most fun times of his life.

In the old times, as the continent lacked any particular ruler who held sway over the land, the people found themselves mired in conflict, with various battles large and small cropping up on a near daily basis.\n\nAccording to our national archives, a Goddess who was greatly pained by this violence and strife gifted a sword to the one who would become the first ruler of the land, and bade him bring about peace.

This First King used that sword to put down the warring in every corner of the land, successfully building a unified country. Ever after, the line of royalty have passed down the Goddess' Sword as proof of their right to rule, keeping it under the tightest of guard at the Great Temple.

"Well, that's what they say, anyway. It's obviously all lies. How is one sword going to help you put down a continent-spanning war? That sword they've made such a fuss about? The one sitting in the temple? It's just for show. The fifth ruler in the line had a blacksmith make it. It's not even fit for actual use! I mean, have you ever seen someone fight with a sword shaped like that?"

When the king heard of the woman who was spreading such stories around the taverns of the capital, he was furious. He sent his soldiers after her, but she threw back her illusion, dazzling them with the shining light of her true form.\n\n After revealing herself to be the Goddess, she accused the king's entire line of appropriating her image without obtaining the legal copyright. After the king paid a truly astronomical settlement, the Goddess agreed to lay hands on the sword, transforming it to the Goddess' Sword in truth, in exchange for further royalty payments in perpetuity.

She awoke, and found she remembered nothing but her own name.\nWith boundless curiosity, she somehow found a place where the dimensions bled into each other, and beyond it, a world of stories.\nAwaiting her in this world were two frankly odd looking dolls.

"What is it you desire?"
"Desire?" She thought about it, hesitating.
Closing her eyes, she wracked her mind, so empty of memories, for the answer.
In the darkness behind her eyelids, she saw a certain boy's face.
"I'd like Rain to... er, that is... I'd like it if he paid a bit more attention to me!" She declared.

"Seriously?" Said one of the dolls,"That's what you're going with?"\n"Eh, sure. That, then. We can totally do that for you!"\nEven as the dolls spoke, she found herself enveloped once more by the light.

"He'll certainly pay a lot more attention to you now," cackled the dolls.
She looked down and found that not only had she lost one of her three dimensions entirely,
she was left with but a mere handful of pixels to call her own.
It was an onerous curse, and she felt herself despair at what she'd become.
Hey, Rain?\nWanna watch us eat?\nIt'll totally be fun!
Yay!\nAlright, ready...? Hehe...

Nom nom nom...
Nom nom nom...
Well? Amazing, huh?
We're just getting started!
Ahh...We're stuffed!\nThanks for the meal!\nOh it's, your treat, right? Thanks!
"If you're done, dinner's ready!"\nThe force with which the words were said underlined a powerful desire to just ignore the situation currently unfolding.
"Please, don't worry about it. It's not your fault, Miss Mermaid."\nI knew Fina was trying to make me feel better, but...\nI wished she'd worry less about me, and more about herself.
"These things happen!"\nRain flashed a brilliant smile.\nHe was trying to be mindful of my feelings, too, and it made things even worse.
Freezing, clipping through walls, glitchy movement...So many bugs have happened outside of the scenario, but I'm doing just fine. Tell me, Author, is this right? Am I to be forgiven for this?

The man drew his sword.
It was a legendary blade, passed down to him from ages past,
and it held the power to defeat evil.
All around him was a battlefield.
Hordes of demons swarmed before him, but he swung his sword.
And as the light flashed off the blade they all turned to ash.

The demons had caused the destruction of the man's village,
a debt of revenge that ensured he spared them not the least whit of mercy.
Wherever he found their ilk, he would exterminate them down to the last.
His wrath was so great that in a matter of a few years it seemed demons had vanished from the land entirely.
Unsatisfied, the man began to wander in search of survivors, utterly consumed by his yearning for revenge.

Eventually he discovered a village
where the children of the demons who had slain his kin gathered together,
living a peaceful, quiet life of cooperation.
He set into them, and the children fled,
wailing in terror as he cut them down one after another,
staining the holy blade red with their blood.

He had just raised it once more, ready to bring it down on a young demon girl
who shrank in terror even as she tried to protect her little sister,
when the blade began to shine.

In an instant the light engulfed the man's body, turning it to ash.
It had fulfilled its sacred writ, cleansing the world of his evil.

There was once a girl in a certain kingdom, skilled beyond measure in the workings of airships.\nHer dream was to build a magnificent airship of her very own.\nIt was a rather expensive dream, to be sure.

Cloistered alone in her workshop, she made gradual, inching progress through trial and error,\nuntil one day she had designed a revolutionary new sort of mech.\nShe called her new autonomous mechanical chocobo simply "Mechabo."

One day, two strange puppets came to see the girl.\n"Hm. Excellent craftsmanship... I think there might be a market for these things," said one.\nThe other nodded sagely, and the two odd little dolls departed without any further comment, which wasn't at all ominous.

Though she had her doubts, the girl followed the strange puppets' advice and embarked on a journey of invention.
Soon, more and more innovative Mechabo hit the market. Mechabo with touch screens, Mechabo that vacuumed your house while you're away...
The years flew by, and the girl finally amassed the wealth she'd needed to create her airship.
But the demands of her business empire weighed heavy on her, and looking up at the sky she knew her dream would never be.

Blacksmith:
Kids these days, they just don't have any of that old stick-to-itiveness!
Every kid I ever gave a go as an apprentice just up and quit, almost right away!
If you want to wield the hammer in your own right, it takes an apprentice two years of prep
and three in the oven before they're even close to done. That's just common sense!
They've got to sit by their master's side and watch and learn for themselves, day after day for that whole time!

Blacksmith:
And now we've got these schools popping up all over town, bragging that they'll teach you to make chocobo weapons.
They claim they can do it in just three months!
And the idiots STILL managed to add a bunch of breaks in.
You can't learn a damn thing with that kind of half-assed training,
let alone the craft of chocobo weapons! Ridiculous!

Townsperson:
Hm? That old blacksmith shop? Smithing schools?
Everything like that went belly up about six months ago.
You remember when that weapon factory
got built in the capitol, right?
The one that automated the whole process? They were churning weapons out like crazy.

Townsperson:
Well, thanks to that you could finally
find good quality chocobo weapons for cheap,
but all the old master craftspeople lost their livelihoods.
It doesn't matter whether you trained for three months or ten years,
you're not gonna be any match for a machine.
It's pretty sad when you think about it. A damn shame.

Lost in the forest, I stumbled upon a fantastical place that seemed full of twinkling stars.
I found it to be inhabited by strange, pale creatures I'd never seen before.
I had, it seemed, stumbled right into their village.
Among these strange creatures, I couldn't help but screw up my nose a bit,
as the fragrance in the village was... quite indescribable.

Strange as they were, they accepted me into their midst.
For three days, I shared their hospitality and took my meals with them.
Although neither of us could understand the other's speech,
I was certain I felt a genuine connection between us nonetheless.
Unfortunately, I wasn't able to stay long.
I needed to hurry back.

With guidance they provided, I was able to find the forest's edge.
My guide was one of the village warriors, in fact,
and she protected us from the monsters we encountered with a sturdy spear.
Finally, we reached the treeline, and it came time to say goodbye.
She pulled me close, then, and gave me one last soft embrace.

Gate guardian!
Thank you so much for finding Pero!
When Pero got separated during a walk, we looked everywhere, but...
Wh—...Where have you been, Pero?

Once, there lived a musician.
His compositions were heartily mocked by the critics,
and hardly could you find a single person who would pay to hear his songs.
The only one who loved his music
was his wife.

One day, the musician found a lyre.
No ordinary lyre, it had been dropped into the world by a god in ancient times,
and anyone who heard its music was irresistibly enchanted by the sound.
Overnight, his music became beloved by people throughout the kingdom.

The lyre's music was beloved by everyone, that is, except his wife.
She insisted the music it produced wasn't truly his at all.
Their relationship descended into strife until one day, she fled the home altogether.
With his wife gone, the musician continued to play the lyre
until one fateful day when it was stolen by an unknown culprit.

With the lyre gone, his fortunes once more reversed overnight.
Unable to continue paying his rent, he was forced to leave his house.
He found himself, some days after this, sitting on the side of a road
and playing a banged up lyre he'd found discarded.
He heard footsteps, and looked up as they approached, fingers still moving on the strings.
And, as he stared up into the eyes of the woman who had always loved his music so,
he kept on playing, all words lost to him.

There was a village of people
who broke into groups, one East, one West,
each group then clashing with the other
over something quite trivial indeed.

One day, a flurry of crystals
fell from the sky like rain.
They were a kind gift
carried forth by the moogles.

These crystals had the wondrous ability
to draw connections between people's hearts.
The people of the two groups, upon taking the crystals in hand, felt their hatred vanish.
They once more joined hands all together in harmony.

The village, newly unified by their strong bonds,
thereby turned to raiding their neighboring village.
In creating for themselves an external enemy, they strengthened the bonds even further.
The conflict escalated to a war in earnest, and the village was destroyed.
The moogles who had blessed them with the crystals in the first place
never again deigned to appear before them.

That's how I heard it, anyway.

The tome had written within it every scrap of military strategy that could be found through time and across the world. Warriors seeking to formulate a plan of battle valued reason far more than intuition. They may have been thus regarded as cold hearted, but if that was what it took to prevail, to protect their homes...

"Gh...But, why? Why won't you follow my orders?!"\n\nThe young officer had taken in the circumstances of the battlefield and developed a precise plan in response. However, the results were disastrous.

One day, two puppets appeared before him.
"You really don't get it, do you? Clueless."
"Then, tell me what I need to..."
"Keheheh... It's easy! Desire is the key. Satisfy that and everything else follows."

The young officer began rewarding his soldiers with land and money for every victory. After his greatest triumph, a new page was added to the book.\n\n"Know their desires, control their desires, and you needn't fear one loss in a hundred battles."

"Wanna make a bet?"
The blond boy's voice is disarmingly serious.
"I've got one coin."
"If it lands on heads, then you'll give up on your revenge and join me."
"If it lands on tails..."

Heh, he seems like a pretty funny guy. I'm kinda surprised there's anyone like him left in the world.
"It's a bet, then."
"Alright."
The coin glints in the sunlight as it tumbles through the air.
How's it going to land...?

Before the tumbling coin can stop, time stops instead.\n"Now, now, you mustn't cheat..."\nThe puppets switched out the coin for another, laughing creepily as they allowed time to move forward once more.

"No way! Tails...?!"
"Keheheh....Ahahahaha!"
I guess I've got no choice but to get my revenge, then. I guess...I guess that really is the only thing I can...
With that, the girl left.

[Investigation of a Certain Tribe and a Certain Bow]

The tribe has lived as hunters for generations past, being in possession of a bow made from a single massive fang. This weapon exuded a certain terrible sort of dark beauty. It became an emblem of the tribe, being passed down from leader to leader across the years.

It was said that the bow was still inhabited by the spirit of the owner of the fang from which it was crafted, and that only the chosen head of the tribe could hear the spirit's voice. By heeding this voice, they were able to easily search out prey. The whole tribe feasted on the most tender of meat, never fearing the sting of hunger.

The tribe declined to stay in one place, knowing that overhunting a single area would throw the ecosystem into chaos. Thus they wandered instead, leading a nomadic life and well accustomed to being treated like strangers wherever they went. It only made their tribal bonds stronger.

They didn't restrict their hunting to the wilds, but wandered even in cities so thick with buildings that nary a tree could be seen along their roads. And yet, they still found the most tender, delicious meat wherever they went. Worryingly, reports of missing children were common in the wake of the tribe's travels. Even more worrying, considering the fact, ah, that I believe I neglected to mention...the fact that the fang was said to have come from a minor deity well known to have a taste for mortal flesh.

I pondered, before reaching a conclusion: "Today, I will die."\n\nI had dared to set foot in the Sylvan Sea, from whence none return. As I walked, night fell over me like a shroud. Still I kept walking. In the darkness a single light wavered. It was a pale, wan light that sent a shuddering chill through my body: Demonfire.

In that moment I didn't feel anything as admirable as fear. Arriving at the flickering Demonfire, I saw that there was a small wooden hut. Inside, a warm fire crackled, with logs stacked nearby, as well as emergency rations. I realized I'd never had emergency rations before.\n\n"Well, might as well get in a last meal."

I gnawed on the hard rations, until I'd eaten them all. All at once the light dazzled me, and a terrible roar assaulted my ears. I looked out the window to see pitch black clouds rolling over the sky, and a pale lance of lighting reaching down to strike the earth.\n\n...At once everything around me was gone, leaving me adrift in a void. The roar came again, booming like the big bang itself and I saw before my eyes a vision, the shattered particles of all the world coalescing into a new star.

Planets were born, then oceans, and animals, and people, and cultures. Lightning stitched itself across the sky, as if embroidering the--\n\nFalling. I was falling, and then I was as I had been before, in the small hut in the woods. I scrambled to me feet, suddenly full of a drive to escape the Sylvan Sea, to live long enough to leave something of myself to a new generation. It seemed to me at once that the Demonfire must have been a message, my late mother reaching out to aide me. I resolve to ask her once I reach the next life.

Mr. Bear's bag.
A magic bag.
Just one look, and you'll get your wish.
Just one wish, and the bag will make it happen.

Wish to do something fun,
and get magical medicine to make the world bright.
Take a dose, and, oh, my...
the world seems to sparkle!

Wish to laugh out loud,
and get a delicious looking mushroom from the bag.
Just a bite, and, oh, my...
you can't seem to stop laughing.

If you only have this, every day will be a wonderful treat.
Even if walking seems like too much trouble.
Even if sleeping seems like too much trouble.
Every day will be nothing but wonderful fun, forever and ever.
The knights served, fulfilling their duty to the sometimes merciless king, who they nonetheless revered. They served, fighting with all their lives.
The lords had idealism and philosophy on their side. But they were, nevertheless, born into that position. Even as children, it was a near inevitability they would ascend to that exalted position.
Those born into this status would often forget the responsibility that attended it, coming to take the power they wielded for granted, and allowing the countries they helmed to slide into corruption.

Who knew when sunlight would next pierce the gloom? Who knew if sunlight would ever shine again? Perhaps, it never would...\nThe knights serve today, too, in a world that's lost all hope. They bend the knee to lords utterly undeserving of respect.
The man had lived half his life as one of the city's impoverished citizens, and went hungry because of it.
He occasionally liked to stop by a certain little tavern to lift his spirits, and it was there that he heard rumors of a certain book, said to teach the ways of evil to all those who read it.
He managed to get his hands on the tome in question, and found himself lured towards more and more evil acts as he read. His evil ways began to gradually eat away at his humanity itself.

He became well known and beloved in the town, through his charity to widows and orphans, and the funding of scholarships. His nights were still spent perusing the book, as his adopted son, orphaned at the man's own hands, slept peacefully beside him.
Alright!\nAre you guys ready? We're gonna go ahead and get started, then!
Lacrosse! Yeah! Yeah!\nNumber One! ♩ No one's even heard of it before!\n...And if they have, they only know it involves sticks!
Lacrosse! Yeah! Yeah!\nNumber Two! ♩ The rules are different for men's and women's lacrosse!\nExplaining the rules usually involves a lot of comparisons to other sports!

Ah, I see the look of incredulous indifference on your face!
"What's the point of telling us this," that expression says!
"What are you even talking about," you add with a subtle arch of your eyebrow!
Well, I'm glad you asked! Allow me to get to my point, and there IS a point...!
And that point is...info about most things is usually boring.
Thank you for coming to my talk.

Whether you need to hunt up some supper, tidy up, or do a little weapon maintenance, why not save a lot of time with a little bit of money by getting this multi-function dream for yourself? At least, that's what I'd usually say, but right now? Well, there's just something about the look in the client girl's eyes.
For today, anyway, I go along with things and throw myself into the chores. Breaking a sweat isn't such a bad thing, every once and a while. As long as it only is every once and a while, that is.

When I get back to the mansion, I can hear her singing. Figures. Her voice is every bit as beautiful as those eyes of hers. It's practically overflowing with all the desires she keeps bottled up inside. Just one more reason I'm so drawn to her, I guess.
So I figure, I'm gonna do everything I can to make sure her every want is taken care of, at least for the very short time remaining that she'll be my client. Childhood is so fleeting, after all...
"That actually looks surprisingly good on you." After I put on the maid outfit, the girl looked me over and nodded in satisfaction at what she saw.
"Hm...Why don't you try this on, too?" She made me try on even more girls' clothes, that satisfied smirk never leaving her face.
"Pinocchio...you might just have a knack for this," she murmured, and soon I was shoved into and out of everything in the mansion's extensive wardrobe in turn, until my face was burning.

"I don't...know about this..." In fact, I'd had a bad feeling about it from the very beginning, and wish I were the kind of person who could've put my foot down. I start to listen to that bad feeling a little more, now.
On that particular day, my sister came to me with an odd sort of look on her face, hoping to get some advice. "Do you know the scariest thing about letting yourself get stuck in a rut?" she asked.

The fact that she came to me for advice in the first place said a lot. It wasn't like her, and suddenly her voice was filling with remorse as she regretfully begged me to forgive her for her foolishness.

"I'll show you a new side of me, tonight," she said, laughing ruefully. "And you? You show me what's on the other side of that calm and wise exterior of yours." Her grin was unsettling, as she laughed again.

She kept looking at me with that feral grin, chest swelling in anticipation, my sister. She bit back her smile, trying to stifle it, saying "Maybe I laid it on a little too thick? It's hard not to, when he believes just about anything..." and I don't think the words were meant for me to hear.

She'd been cursed. A death curse, a clock ticking down to her appointed demise. Fortunate for her, perhaps, that she didn't see much of value in the word to tie her to it. She did think, however, that it might be nice to see her friends and family again one last time.

And so she travelled to visit them, stopping by their houses one after another. She'd not been the type to visit often before, and they would smile in surprise, delighted to see her. Her days spent with them were an equal delight, filled with a warm happiness.

Then, she didn't die. Instead, she got word that one of her relatives had passed. And then another. And a friend, and another, one after another, until not a day went by without news of death reaching her ears. In the end, not a single person she'd visited survived long after she bid them farewell.
She lived on, after that, never again able to see any of the people she longed to meet again.
Stab, run 'em through, kick 'em while they're down.\n...Be as proud as you like.
Steal, pillage, consume.\n...Stay unaware that this is the law.
Violate, invade, attack 'em again for good measure.\n...Do it to your heart's desire.
Thought it cost you the light in your eyes.\nThe swordarm sheathed in misery shall flourish.\n...Deep, deep down, no matter the depths.
The knights raced their steeds across the open land, a group of nomads who never stayed long in one place.

When they fought, the people of these grasslands brought to bear superior mobility and fierce valor against their opponents. They prospered, and raised more children in the way of soldiers, always expanding their range.

However, they were also a people, who, once losing their momentum, found it perilous hard to get back again. Careless, they soon found themselves stymied, besieged on all sides by the settled peoples.

The nomads, though they were nomads no longer after being forced under the stewardship of the settled folk, could not resist becoming as tame as the tubers they farmed. Alas, for their days of dignified freedom on the open plains were long behind them...

"Sis! Just once, I wanna sleep in a really really soft and fluffy bed! So fluffy that you'd just sink into it! Oh, and I want it to have a canopy! A huge canopy with lots and lots of fluttery drapes hanging down around me!"

"Well, once you go to sleep, your dreams will come true. When we wake up, we'll both be princesses! We'll sleep in a big fluffy beds and met wonderful princes!"\n\nThose were the last words the young sisters ever spoke to each other, before succumbing to illness and starvation in the gloom of the back alley they called home.

The spirits of those two innocents were reborn, and just as the elder sister had promised, in their next life they were princesses. They slept in luxurious beds and both eventually married wonderful princes, before being swept up in a peasant revolution and beheaded in before a baying crowd.

In their prison cell together, the night before the execution the two sisters whispered in the dark.

"Sister, I hope that in the next life, we can live humble lives. Think how much happier we might have been had our lives been untouched by politics..."

"I'm sure that when the dawn comes, your dreams will come true. When next we wake up, we'll be two ordinary people..."

There once was a devil.
It was his daily habit, to sit upon a hill in the Netherrealm, gazing upon the mortal realm with his third eye.
He would laugh in delight, as he watched them fall into destitution,
engulf their lands in conflict, and lament their lives in despair.
Until one day, the devil found himself hopelessly besotted by one of these mortals, a holy paladin, no less.

He desired to make her his own, so much that it consumed him.
However, for a devil of the Netherrealm to meet someone in the mortal world,
they require a mortal to expend their own magic power and summon them.
The devil began to devise some way he might induce the object of his desire to summon him forth.
First, he found the governor of her province, whispering to the man that he ought to raise taxes.

Next, seeking to enmesh her in conflict, he spurred those around her to anger,
and finally he threw misfortune after misfortune in her path, that she should look on her life with regret.
Soon, she indeed stained her hands with the dark act of summoning a devil.
Before the devil realized what was happening, she had plucked out his third eye and feathers both,
crafting a dark weapon and performing a ritual that bound him inside of it.

With the power of his third eye at her disposal, she rather unsurprisingly swore vengeance against the one who had caused her to suffer so.\nThence forth, the holy paladin wielded that weapon, laughing gleefully at the helpless, anguished cries of the devil bound within.\nThey truly made a perfect pair.
The melody boldly and urgently cuts through the wind, so as not to bore the audience.
Faithfully attentive to the rhythm of the slaughtering, passionately creating a sense of elation towards the chorus.
The sound of the scythe, melding with the agony of death, resounding in perfect harmony.\nWhat a delightful reverb!

But something's missing.
Of course. The performers lack enthusiasm.
Well then...
Allow me to prepare the most fitting stage that'll have you wailing in despair.

Although he was known to be a quiet, good-hearted sort, he was nevertheless sent to prison, condemned to be executed. His crime? After his wife and child were murdered, he sought bloody revenge upon their killer, chopping his body into pieces and feeding it to his livestock. Alas. The night before he was to be executed, an earthquake tore the earth asunder, and as he stumbled from the crumbling walls of the prison he turned his face heavenward and screamed at the gods:\n\n"Fine! I'll build a just world by myself, then!"

He returned home, surrounding himself with like-minded people willing to work for his cause. They impeded the magistrate who came to re-arrest the man, and the official denounced them, shouting, "You who prevent me from bringing this man to justice share in his sins!" Even before he was done speaking, the man was on his feet. He smashed the magistrate down with a blow from his hammer and exhorted his followers,\n\n"Listen up! Get out there and root out evil wherever you find it! Anything else and you might as well aid the evil with their crimes!"

He gathered more and more followers, becoming regarded as a hero and a focus of faith. His followers took up the hammer as their weapon, wielding it wherever they went in imitation of him. One day, after the group had grown to hold formidable power, the king of a neighboring country came to them seeking aid. He gave them their own land, christening them his Holy Knights.

From their own sovereign territory, the Holy Knights went forth and toppled their former king. Their benefactor held a feast in their honor, massacring the lot of them as they became addled by drink. The king went to bed that night secure in knowing he'd gained advantage and cleaned up his loose ends in one neat package. He was found in the morning, his head caved in by a hammerblow.\n\n"Master!" Shouted the last remaining Holy Knight, who had declined to attend the party because of a slight cold, "Watch me! I'll build a world without tragedy! I'll do it myself!"
The staff was born from the power of sacrifice, of the fight they endured. The frustration and regret the sacrifices felt, all those helpless, useless feelings...they were a marvel.
Why is this happening to me?\nThose words echoed in the sacrifices' hearts even as their tears flowed without end.\nBut their deaths were not in vain.

Their regret grew ever more bitter, gaining a power all of its own, until it unleashed that bitterness upon the homes and families the sacrifices had so miserably failed to protect in the first place.

Each and every one of them wondered in despair:\nwhat had they ever done to deserve this?\nBut that's not how it works at all, you can't think of it like that. Sin, Reward, Punishment, it's all nonsense. No one deserves anything, we all just get what we get...

October 1st\nBeing a part of this organization is suffocating. I don't understand how these uneducated, ignorant people came to be in a position to control the outcome of research in the first place...That's the biggest mystery here, honestly.

October 9th\nI've never been good at people, or, god forbid, office politics, and I've always known that about myself. I can't stop myself from being furious with the supervisor who insists I improve my work ethic. Why doesn't he improve his terminal idiocy, first? At the very least, he should admit his stupidity caused our problems in the first place. I've recommended he do so many times, but he doesn't seem receptive to the idea.

November, Date Uncertain
"It isn't just a matter of whether your theory is sound, or not!"
Apparently, the supervisor who's face I can't even look at without being overcome by rage has recommended I be fired. Well. Fine, then. Whatever you think is best.

I told them as much, documenting my final thoughts on the matter before I left, completely secure in the knowledge the laboratory would crumble without me there to hold it up.

Unknown Date\nIt's been months since then. In contrast to my convictions when I left, it seems the lab has survived just fine without me. But...that's alright. It's fine. Really. Now that I can work without being held back by those hacks and their constant interpersonal drama...well. I've been able to fully develop my own theories.

Snff...Hck...\nIt's so heavy...so suffocating...it hurts so much...\nPlease, just let me out of these things, I can't take it anymore! I think one of the springs just wrenched my arm so bad it might be...
I'm sorry, I'm sorry, I’m sorry! I promise I'll be more independent from now on if you just, please, please...

"Pinocchio! How's it going? I thought you might be a little tired by now, so I'll take the Corrective Measures off for a bit, okay?"\n\n"Th...Thank you...I thought I was going to die if I had to stay like that any longer...!"
Five minutes later.\n"Alright! I think that's enough of a break! You've only got 99 sets left, so let's get back to it!"
Long ago, a single firebird lived on a mountain. It was quite the rare sort of bird, and indeed, the only one of its kind on the mountain, without any fellows to call its own.

This solitary firebird loved to sing. It would soar to the mountain's highest point, and serenade all the creatures who called the mountain home. Its voice was so wonderfully beautiful, that all who heard it felt a profound peace in their hearts. One day, in its search for a companion, the firebird flew as far afield as the mountain's foothills, where humans were known to dwell.

The people of the foothills welcomed the firebird, with its beautiful voice. However, its presence soon lead to conflict as they fought among themselves to posses the rare bird. This saddened the firebird greatly, and a young man approached it, promising to craft a flute that would make such sweet melodies people would cease to covet the firebird so fiercely.

The young man did as he said, creating a beautifully melodious harp, and the human's passion towards the firebird did indeed wane. Sadly, however, he was killed by those who'd grown covetous of the flute. The firebird mourned him, singing a sorrowful requiem as it returned to the mountain's peak.\n\nThe firebird lived there alone until the end of its days, having lost the only friend it ever made.

He'd killed five brothers, and their lord father, boiled away his gold like it was water in a teapot as he secured the allegiance of nobility across the board. At long last, the time had finally come to place the crown he'd coveted so long upon his own head. It was then that he finally realized the feeling that had plagued him so long, the yearning he'd suffered with, was gone.

The view from the throne was boring as hell. The only thing the heavy crown was for was giving him upper back pain, and honestly he wanted to chuck the damn thing across the room half the time. He didn't know what he'd been thinking, back when he'd wanted to be king, so sure that the view from the throne would be dazzling. Equally sure that the beautiful crown could never truly be his. It was just too improbable.

The moment he'd gotten his hands on his goal, his world had turned to gray dust and ashes. There was nothing to interest him in any of it, not the beautiful princess betrothed to him, not the vast country under his control.\n\nHe understood his own nature, now. The struggle itself, that was what had given his life meaning. The dream, now that it had been achieved, was worth less than a pebble on the roadside.

That very day, he quit the castle, never to return. He was determined to search for a new dream, even more unattainable than his first. He kept searching, determined to find a dream big enough to stake his life. He grew old and withered and even then searched on, unaware that his quest for a new dream had become the struggle that gave his life meaning.
In Another World Entry 1\nThe slave trader reminded me that there's no refunds if slaves run away.\nI've never seen a world so infested with scum.

In Another World Entry 2
It was my first time having a meal with the girl.
If I'd to guess, she didn't think she was allowed to eat.
What did they put this poor girl through?

In Another World Entry 3
She won't do anything unless ordered. I get that she's been brought up like that, but in no way is that right.
But there's no other way to get through to her.
I hate this.

In Another World Entry 4
Mili arrived to this world way before me.
But what I'm really worried about is this girl.
What if she really is Rem? And she came here much, much, much earlier than the two of us?
It scares me to think that's a possibility.
I've never felt this way before.
The kingdom had become frozen.\nAnd it was done by one single man.
What he desired was an eternal pause.
It was the only way to save his wife. She was sure to die if the disease continued to progress.
His wish was granted. And for his wife's sake, he and the entire kingdom slowly froze to ice.
I wanna see something! I wanna know if a person can live all by themselves. No crying allowed! I already fed all your friends to wolves, okay?
Man, I'm sooo jealous of you! I mean, you've got another little person growing inside you so you're not really alone, now, are you? It's really lonely being all by yourself with no one to play with.
You know, I heard something pretty cool! You're supposed to judge people on what's inside, not on how they look! And it's totally true, too! I mean, even awful people have nice and neat insides!

Awww, now I'm seriously jealous! I wanna have a baby to hold like that, too! And when it got bigger we could play together! Whaddaya think, friend Snake? I really want to have a nice baby just like she does...

The torch bearing the holy flame from the holy dragon has been carried off in a raid. Placing this torch on the Kingdom's alter is enough to guarantee a year of protection...but if the flame is snuffed out before the time has elapsed, the kingdom will fall prey to dire calamity. We must reclaim the torch, come what may.

Running through the town with the torch in one hand, I'm assailed all at once by a chill wind, and a shadow begins to fall over the sun. When I look up, I see clouds gathering. Rain starts, quickly building to a downpour. I have to hurry!

The icy wind grates against my cheeks, whipping the flame of the torch until it wavers. No good, no good...I've got to get out of this! I cast around, eyes settling on a small mill. I shove open the door in a panic, coming face to face with the shocked eyes of the couple who live there. It seems I've interrupted their date night.

I quickly draw my blade with my empty hand, killing them both before breathing a sigh of relief. As I exhale, my breath sends the cloud of flour swirling. The...cloud of flour that got kicked up in the struggle. The cloud of flour that ignites upon hitting the open flame of the torch blowing the tiny mill house sky high.
Once, a certain man's family was killed in the course of a robbery, and the successful robber became quite rich off of the endeavor.

Time passed, and the course of events was changed by this random crime. As a result, things that were not meant to happen began to take place, and the man and those around him found their fates altered.
Good people are not necessarily rewarded, and nor are the evil necessarily punished. There's no sense to it, and people have called this proof that no deity orders the way of things in this world.

Yet...such a deity did exist. She was prone to following her whims and loved mischief, traits which occasionally lead her to do things that were really quite cruel, just to see what would happen. She really didn't care a whit, and fittingly, none of her mortal subjects really cared much about her either, as a result.

■ Journal Entry 1
-One month has passed since arriving to this world.
-I've been receiving an influx of requests to exterminate beasts in the city. But it pleases me that I'm needed by these people.
-I'm worried about everyone in the Mathers domain.
■ Journal Entry 2\n-It's been two months now in this world.\n-Rumors have been circulating that whoever kills Wolgarm will be rewarded by me.
■ Journal Entry 3\n-I listened to this month's reports. However, it doesn't appear anyone else from the mansion came to this world.\n-We're beginning preparations to take down Wolgarm.
■ Memo\nIt is lonely being on my own.\nSo much time has passed without a sign of a single person from my original world... Perhaps I'll never see anyone ever again.
I've been having reoccurring dreams lately. Not the same, but very similar.\nAnd in each of them Barusu dies. They're such horrifying dreams.
Speaking of which, I believe I had another similar one three months ago. But in that one, I saw Emilia crying all alone.
I can't remember what it was about anymore, but I had a similar incident when I was younger. Regardless, it was a very sorrowful dream...
If I could see myself in a dream, I'd want it to be me dashing to Roswaal's rescue! Sadly it's only wishful thinking.
Remorseful Diary 1\nI'm sorry I was incapable of performing what you ordered me. I promise it won't happen again.\nI'm sorry. I'm sorry. I'm sorry. I'm sorry. I'm sorry.

Remorseful Diary 2
I messed up again today.
Ow... It hurts...
I'm sorry...
I'll do it right next time.
I'll do exactly as you say.

Remorseful Diary 3
It's dark and cold outside.
There's a dog here next to me.
We both have matching collars.
It's a little less lonely with him here.

Remorseful Diary 4
I had a dream today.
I was living in a large mansion.
I was eating my favorite sweet potatoes.
I had a very kind older sister.
I hope I'll get to live a life of happiness like that one day.
Tale of Sword Saint in Another World 5-1\n"It appears I'm a wanted man in this world."\nConfronting the red-haired boy stood a bewitching woman by the name of Kaguya.

Tale of Sword Saint in Another World 5-2
"It would be wrong for me to be rough with a woman..."
"Oh, but I must insist.
It's not every day I encounter such a strong gentleman."

Tale of Sword Saint in Another World 5-3
The clash of steel echoes in the alleyway.
It was enough to determine their opponent's strength.
"No choice. You've forced me to raise my hand."
"That's it! Torment me to your heart's content!"

Tale of Sword Saint in Another World 5-4
"That makes five monsters in this world since my arrival.
I just wish those weird puppets would leave me alone already..."
Reinhard had little time to relax, for another assassin was closing up behind him.

These seeds here, you plant them.
Plant one of them in the heart of the person you love.
I highly recommend red flowers.
They grow through flesh and blood, so it's absolutely beautiful when they fully bloom.
It gushes with love and affection because it shares a part of them.

My mother went first. She was a good mother to me.
I didn't have a father, so to me she was like a goddess.
So when she died, it left me devastated...
That's when the idea hit me. I'd plant one of roses she used to grow inside of her.

Corpses release a strange smell when they begin to rot.
But what I learned is that the smell isn't so bad anymore when you plant flowers in them.
Like, even the soil smells different. Fresh and full of nutrients.
The problem is when the flesh gets soft. When that happens I use the bathtub as a planter...
You can tell I worked hard to grow it.

If there's someone out there who you think would bloom a beautiful flower... That's love.
That's how I knew I was in love. I could see already see the flower to be from her.
There's no turning back.
...I'm going to plant it while she's still alive.
I was in the forest chasing a pretty butterfly when a beautiful lady came and played with me.\nShe knew a lot about flowers and taught me the names of all sorts of 'em.
The lady from the forest came stopped by my porch and played with me again.\nThis time she gave me yummy flower honey.\nIt was fun talking to her as we ate it.

I really like the lady.
She smells like flowers and is nice to me.
If only I wasn't such a kid...
But I've decided to confess to her tomorrow.
I didn't see the lady today.\nI did finally catch that butterfly from the forest the other day.\nI'll keep it as a specimen.

I was awoken by the cry of someone's death in the distance.
As my mind and vision focused, I realized I had become a small child.
So I guess this is reincarnation.
I have clear memories of my previous life.
In that time, I lived the life of a murderous bandit.

I guess I'm just a bad guy to my very core.
For whatever reason, I became a thief in this life as well.
But for some reason, when I went to steal from a castle, I noticed the archer I killed in my past life guarding it.
Everything's repeating itself. Everything's beginning to play out just as it did back then.

On his last breath, the archer fired his final shot at me. It missed me completely.
And again I watched him die. In exactly the same fashion as my old life.
It was too late. Just as I remembered that was the moment my memory cut off, I felt a shock at my throat.
The last thing I saw was my own blood running coating the arrowhead that had impaled me.

"Take that! That's the same arrow I shot in my previous life...!"
The arrow the archer shot before his death in that life had somehow traveled through time to kill me in the present.
I let out a painful scream, the last that would escape from my mouth.
The next thing I knew, I was awoken by the cry of someone's death in the distance.

Diplomatic negotiations were unsuccessful, and the enemy had invaded the kingdom. The difference in military strength was overwhelming. The kingdom's soldiers fought back, but in the end were outnumbered.
The musician of the kingdom strummed his lyre.\nIt was a magical instrument said to be used in times of trouble.
When the enemy heard his performance, they suddenly grew angry. Unable to keep their composure, they fell for every trick in the book.\nThe winds shifted in the kingdom's favor.

However, the lyre was originally the kingdom's beloved treasure. But their mild disposition resulted in their overthrow by the current kingdom. The people of this kingdom were hot-headed already. As the melody continued, so did their rage.\nIn the end, both armies suffered a great many casualties and the victor left undecided...

A man reached the end of an expedition, and found for himself the Unicorn Spire. It was the tool he needed to defeat the Administrator, who sat astride the world banishing chaos and filling everything with unbearably tedious order.\n\nThe Administrator called down cataclysms, seeking to drown the man, but with the power of the Unicorn Spire, the man resisted.
Changing tacks, the Administrator caused honey to drip from the sky. Overcome with the impulse to taste it, the man could not resist.

He opened his mouth to the honey. It was the most exquisite sweetness in the world, and more than enough to make him forget his mission. Forsaking his cause for pleasure, the man tumbled into the abyss.
The Unicorn Spire watched as the honey it had proffered led the man to his death, making sure its job was done. Then, mission complete, it moved on to the another plane seeking its next bearer...

I was, as they say, born with the a heart like that of tigers or wolves. I've sullied my hands with any number of foul acts, and never scrupled to starve another to feed myself. So, don't waste your words, Father. I'm not gonna repent, I don't want your redemption, and Hell sounds like a pretty fun place, actually. Now, it's time for you to go.

You're a bit late, aren't you, Father?\n...Oh, your son has a fever? I used to have a kid, you know? The brat was dumb as a brick, always picking fights over stupid shit. Went and got himself killed in one of those fights, just like that. Hm? What's with the waterworks, Father? You're sorry for my loss? Tch, what loss? I'm much better off!

What?! That old priest died of a broken heart after he lost his son to illness...? That's... Tch, why's a good guy like that gotta kick it but a total bastard like me gets to keep breathing? Hey...can I go to the funeral? Just lemme out of here for a day, I've gotta give him a piece of my mind, before they put him in the ground!

Ahaha, I heard that ruthless criminal broke down crying when they told him I died. I really got him with that story I made up about having a kid. God, this is priceless. Anyway, I think it's pretty clear I won the bet so I'll be taking this...!\n\nHm? What's with that expression? ...Standing right behind me? Who is?
Something was odd about the dream the Serpent showed me. I did exactly as it told me and yet afterwards it still had no trouble finding any number of reasons to scold me.
Today is no different. One of the seniors pushed all the unpleasant work onto me and went home early. I have no choice but to do my best. I have my orders, after all.
At first everyone had the grace to at least keep their comments out of my earshot. Now, they badmouth me right to my face. Lately just being there fills my chest with a horrible buzz of anxiety.

I'm so jealous...I just want to be like everyone else, to cheerfully join in a normal conversation. But...something like that really is out of my reach. Isn't there anyone in the world who would accommodate me?
I'm so sad.\nOur new information-based society is structured in such a way that it leaves behind the indolent and the traditionalists.
I have a dream, a dream that I might one day create a completed tragedy. But the only one who believes in me is you, Bear.

As you mocked me for blaming my own sloth on others, Bear, your expression was brighter and more alive than I've ever seen it...that was the first time I understood that my dream would never come true.

Talent + Education + Practice. That's the formula that decides ability. I've understood that much, at least, for ages. Still, I refused to acknowledge my own lack of ability. Tell me, how did I look to you? ...Dreaming of a tragedy, the final act decided before it even began.

The overlord of the Red Peoples, with his endless bravery and daring, forced the Blue Peoples to submit and brought them under his rule. In the midst of this turmoil a single soldier of the Blue Peoples journeyed to an ancient shrine to pray that he may be given power.\n\nThe god of the shrine deigned to manifest, calling out to the soldier, "This is the Ravenous Axe. In return for granting absolute power, it consumes the life of its wielder. Will you take it up?"

The soldier considered this, and upon accepting the weapon, presented it to the Red Peoples' overlord as tribute, explaining the god's warning. With a sly smile the soldier went on to wonder if the overlord would be able to make use of the axe, knowing the man loved nothing better than a challenge.

With the Ravenous Axe in hand, the overlord was reputed to be nothing short of invincible, and other peoples were felled like wheat in the face of his battle prowess. He exalted in his victories, declaring to all and sundry that he was not so weak as to be consumed by a weapon. Before he could even finish forming the sentence, however, the man crumpled to the ground, unresponsive. Victim to a sudden cerebral haemorrhage, there was never any hope of saving him.

Even as the overlord's seven year old heir ascended the throne, the soldier who had so neatly disposed of the overlord began to foment rebellion. However, one of his subordinates, who disdained him for the cowardly and deceitful assassination of the overlord, revealed his location to the enemy and he was shortly put to death.\n\nThus did the Ravenous Axe bring ruin upon those who would wield it, whether directly or through subtler means.
Where do you want to go for Christmas this year?\n--Wherever's fine.
What do you want to do for Christmas this year?\n--Eh, I don't really have any strong feelings about it.
Who are you going to spend Christmas with, this year?\n--Honestly? That's what I want to know.
If only you were here...\nI know I could die without regrets.

Christmas Eve.\nA wonderful night! More than any other night the whole year, on Christmas Eve you go to sleep excited about what the next morning brings. It always feels like Christmas morning is so far away...it's always hard to sleep, and happy all the same.
Even so, some people don't like Christmas Eve at all. They know themselves better than anyone else, and hate the way the morning brings the same thing.
It's really sad, but even people like that sometimes grow up to meet someone who can make Christmas special for them. I don't know how often such a wonderful happy ending happens, though.
That's why it's okay. The present isn't everything. Even if you don't care for it now, you'll have a wonderful Christmas someday.\nThough...I can't guarantee that.
If I had someone who truly understood me, I'd want to get them a present that they'd absolutely love.
If I had someone who truly understood me, I'd want the gift I received to show they understood how powerful my feelings are.
With Christmas finally here...\nWell, even if the present I picked out isn't exactly what you wanted...do try not to let that show on your face.
I'll try my best to do the same for you.\nI'll...well, I'll do as much as I can, anyway. I mean...I'll try.

Another white Christmas, this year. Snow falling all around me, my namesake. I really do love winter. A day like this, more than any other, brings out people's kindness towards each other. It's a holiday I treasure.
Let's make a meal that will warm us, body and soul. The aroma of roasting turkey and fresh bread... Just for today, let's set aside the killing. Let's have a truce.

The table piled high with an improbable feast, the holiday revellers who just as improbably polish off each and every dish. The rush to prepare a few more dishes for the table, smiling offers to help with the meal. The rest of us, killing time together with stories and games. We're all different, but each of us wears the same warm smile.
...I wish our story had been like that.
I've acquired a bow crafted of carved ice. Everything struck with an arrow loosed from this bow bursts with spiralling blooms of ice crystal.
I shot my father. The arrow trailed glittering snowflakes as it flew. My aim was true and it stuck fast into his chest, before a lovely bloom of blue and white ice burst from within it.

It was beautiful. To see my father, a malicious tyrant who had abused his family more than he had our livestock, become the canvas upon which such beautiful art would bloom...\nNothing else I've seen has moved me quite so much as that.

Yes, it is fitting that all the tainted things of this world should be covered over with the pure and the lovely.
Things such as you.
Such as me.
Such as the world itself.
Yes, far better for all of it to be covered in a meadow of pure, glittering white.

Another day trapped in a prison of darkness. 
It's my fault I'm here, I know that. I never wanted this to happen.
I'm still here, it seems...
Can you believe it? I'm really truly, still here. Little as I want to be.

You look like you might even believe me, but I'd understand if you had doubts. It's hard to decide, isn't it? All of those days, and all the endless, sleepless nights...I don't even know how long it's been, any more.\nI thought maybe I really would be better off dying. At least I wouldn't have to think about this anymore, if I was dead...probably. I thought about that a lot. I thought about it so much that I ended up drinking. I thought and drank until one of those nights, I ended up jumping.

Unfortunately for me, that uneasiness I'd felt all along, that sense that my mind might truly be somewhere else, some unknown place, sometimes... That turned out to be true.\nI never found out why. Maybe I did it to myself, pondering that question in circles night after night.

And now, trapped in this endless eternity, with truly nothing else to do but think, I've finally arrived at the conclusion that eluded me all that time before. I had my answers, but I no longer cared about them at all. It's not like they'd do me any good, now.\nIt seems as if this must be my punishment. I, who could never reach any answers in life has found them all in my death, and they're all I'll ever have, trapped as I am with no end to this imprisonment in sight.

It's cold. It's truly, seriously cold.
Feels like the cold is all there is, with the world sealed up under all this white.
...But, suddenly, I can still feel my heart beat, still feel the blood rush in my veins.
Someone asks me if I'm alright, and I open my eyes.
A man with a beard stares down at me, brows knit in concern.

He helped me, gave me aid and succor, until I was recovered enough to walk normally on my own.\n"My men found you locked in a small box, adrift in the ice floes in the Sea of Frozen Blades. I had them save you."\nThe bearded man...the king of this land I'd now learned, told me the story of my rescue.

He asked my how I came to be trapped in that frozen sleep, and I answered. I told him of the undersea village of merpeople beneath the Sea of Frozen Blades, of how I had snuck into their lands, intent on taking some of their blood for myself, and of how magic gone awry in the battle that ensued had seen me locked in a frozen tomb.

As I spoke of the treachery of merfolk, I could see the King more than inclined to believe me. He ordered his men in retaliation to fetch the Hammer of Confining Ice, known to release explosive power at a certain amount of water pressure, and to sink it into the sea above their village.\nI thanked him, stifling my smile. In truth, I'd been justly sentenced to life imprisoned in the ice after terrorizing the merfolk with a series of murders. This landward kingdom seems like a good enough place to pick up where I left off.

A lovely young lady, with a reputation for playing lovely songs on her harp. She played and sang, waiting for a certain man's return. The man she loved.\nShe played clad in white, in the arcing halls of a grand cathedral, and the lovely sound gathered in that space and rang out for even those outside to hear. In this way, she waited.

Someone had told her to do so once, that if she stood in the great church in her white garb and played, that her song would truly call her fated love forth to her. It was a lovely proposal, and she flushed to remember it, even as she continued her serenade.

The harp itself was special, made just for this day, a spider-shaped instrument strung with a spider's silk. It was a joke between them, and she laughed to think of it, how she'd teased him about being entangled in her web.

At long last, the door of the church swung open, and a man appeared there, lit from behind by the brightness of the day. It wasn't her love, but he smiled as if he was, approaching.\n"I asked my best friend to invite you here," he said, smiling shyly. "I've loved you for so long, and I had hoped we might be married..."\nShe stared, unable to overcome the betrayed rage rising within her as she hurled the harp to the ground, more fearsome in that moment than the venomous spider that was its likeness.

The lord is ruthless.

The damage from the harsh winter is a sure omen of a poor harvest, but he won't lower our taxes at all. We'll starve!

What? A riot? Now, don't be hasty! Anyway, look, we just need him to see how we're suffering! We'll have plenty of time to riot afterwards, if it doesn't work!
Thank goodness, the lord is surprisingly reasonable.\n\nWe're saved! ...Hm? What's... The village is on fire?! H-Hey, everyone why are you so injured? What's going on here?!

So, you're that necromancer, right?

Can you whip me up an army of the dead? I need to kill the lord!
What? I'll regret it? Shut up, I'm not gonna regret a thing! Please, just help me! You're my last hope!

Looks like the lord's whole realm is in turmoil thanks to the guns of the zombie hoard!
Of course, what with the dead army running around, His Holiness sent the Holy Knights to take care of it.

And now, that got me in a panic, I won't lie. My son is one of the Holy Knights! I screamed for them to stop. I knew I could make them see reason, but the dead just looked at me blankly and raised their guns.

I sighed in satisfaction. The ritual was over, and I was now counted among the ranks of the glorious Papal Knights.\nBut...I hadn't expected Her Holiness to be such a marvelous woman!\nDuring the ceremony, she took my hand and smiled beatifically, telling me she expected great things. I...I'm not ashamed to admit that my traitorous heart developed expectations of its own.

The Papal Knights set out on a holy expedition, battling against the enemies of God. Upon our return, I was summoned before the Papal throne, and Her Holiness laughed warmly, congratulating me on living up to her hopes.\nIt is...difficult to describe the soaring fulfilment that blossomed in me at the sight of her smiling eyes fixed on my face. Such a smile, for one so lowly as I!

Time passed, and I continued in my holy mission to cut down the enemies of God which ran rampant across the land. The more foes I slay, the more deeds of arms I gathered to myself, until one day Her Holiness summoned me to her presence once more.\nUshered into her bedchamber, she favored me with that smile again, saying she believed I must be touched by God, offering me her favor, and I...I could scarcely credit I had heard her properly. She couldn't possibly mean...could she?

Alright, next...!\nI guess we just pack all the severed limbs into crates? Geez...How many people is the new Pope gonna have to kill before she's happy? Talk about bloodlust.\nI'd seriously love to know what kind of hold she's got on people that all those virtuous young people who join her knights are willing to go along with this mess...

It came to pass one day that the man realized his wife hardly ever showed her feelings anymore. It was as if his warm, loving wife had suddenly been replaced by an emotionless automaton. Deeply concerned by the change in his wife, the man resolved to investigate, and followed her as she left for her errands, trailing her to a house on the outskirts of town.

He knew this house to be the residence of a peddler of used tools who had moved to the town sometime earlier. The man tried for a time to glimpse the interior of the house from the outside, but failing in this he turned to go. As he did so, he nearly yelped in surprise to find the peddler standing behind him on the path. He was clutching a book of some sort, murmuring to himself as his eyes travelled over the page, and before the man could so much as say a word, he felt the darkness rise up to claim him.

Opening his eyes, the man found himself sealed inside a box of ice, inside a room lined with many such frozen coffins. Although unable to move, he looked through the milky surface of the ice and could tell that each of the other coffins held another soul.\nAll were as motionless as he.

It was a day like any other, in this small town. The townsfolk walked the street, just as they did every day. They walked with perfect, regulated cadence, just as they did everyday. Their faces held no expressions.\nJust as it is everyday.

Go ahead and feast your eyes on this, the Icewood Spear!\nTotally looks like it's actually made out of ice, huh? It's cool to the touch, but it's got none of the brittleness of actual ice. Don't be afraid of melting it, either! This amazing little beauty will sparkle more than ever if you just wash it with cold water.\nSeems like it'd be just the thing for colder climes, eh?

I'll bet it'd be at its strongest in the lands of the farthermost north, inside industrial-strength refrigerators located upon the ships that ply the northern seas. Seems like the kind of thing I should put to the test...Definitely something I should test, since I'm the one who's got the spear.\nOnwards, northwards!

Ah, check out this winter wonderland, just the stuff you'd expect from the countries of the north! Though, gotta admit, these snowdrifts are making it pretty hard to walk. This looks like a job for my awesome Icewood Spear! I'll channel its true power to strengthen myself!\nOoookay, just gonna rest in this little cabin for a bit. Hm? Oh, someone's coming.

I can't believe this is happening! How was I to know this fully furnished cabin would actually belong to anyone? Let alone anyone so much bigger than me.\nNooo, give me back my spear! Wait, not like that!\nAugh...the lovely clear Icewood is stained red now, with my own blood...I see. I get it. The spear, its...its true power can only be unlocked...by a heart of ice.

Whatever they were, they had the appearance of a white mist. 
They were terrible, ravenous things that consumed anything organic unfortunate enough to be in its path.
No physical attacks were capable of harming them, for they would reflect back whatever they'd been targeted with, and they became known as the Mirrorkind.
The entire planet had been pushed to the brink of crisis, ever since their sudden appearance ten years prior.

Humanity's finest military minds collaborated to create a weapon that could fight back against them, devising a gun that absorbed the wielder's own spiritual energy, concentrating it into a potent projectile. As the new weapons became widespread, civilization pushed back the white mist predators and began to hope once more for the day they could live in peace.

Unfortunately, not every person possessed the same amount of raw spiritual power, and weaker people fell one after another, debilitated by firing the weapon just once.\nIt came to pass, in the midst of this, that the researchers charged with developing the weapon were set upon by the creatures. In desperation, they hastily injected themselves with a substance they had been researching, moments before being consumed by the creatures.

The creatures stopped, realizing something was amiss. There was an anomaly.\nThe substance the researchers had injected was one that amplified the emotion of terror. The creatures recoiled, and as the researchers had hoped, destroyed themselves as they mirrored and amplified the self-directed terror.\nTheir fear was so strong that it echoed throughout their collective mind, as far as 10 years into the past, stirring the creatures of the past to suddenly go mad and attack humanity, the source of that overpowering terror.

The adventurer who found his way to that small village immediately fell in love with its beautiful flowers. Every house in the village was decorated with them, and the adventurer soon built his own house on the outskirts, delighted when his new neighbors came bearing beautiful floral wreathes of welcome.

The adventurer returned one day from wiping out some demons that had been lurking near the village, to be rewarded with another wreath of flowers. He was told it was a celebration of his victory.\nHappy days passed in the village, until one day, the adventurer began to develop a cough.
