A short time later, the adventurer was wounded during a quest and fell more seriously ill. The villagers gifted him with more flowers, said to drive off demons, or to encourage greater health.\nThe adventurer's sickness worsened.

The adventurer never again emerged from his house, and when the villagers came to look, they found him dead.\nSoon afterwards, the villagers gathered all together and covered the adventurer's house in colorful wreaths of flowers.

You really are an idiot if you think I'm the kind of person who's gonna forgive and forget, after you only got close to me in the first place because you wanted to use me. Still, I suppose I might be an even bigger idiot, 'cause I'm actually starting to think I might not wanna hurt you.

It's like, when you learn about someone's past, there's a connection there. Everyone's experienced that kind of thing, right? And who'd ever think for a second that their new "friend" was making it all up? No one, that's who.

There's this knight who's always shouting how you can't change someone's heart with violence. Just goes on and one about it, and a bunch of people just eat that stuff up, think it's so deep and noble. ...Well, I'll bet none of them realize that guy's just making it up to. Probably has someone write that shit for him.

That's what the tiger showed me. The dirty tactics of underhanded people who do nothing but devour others. God, they're pathetic. Has-beens, all of them, it's hilarious! ...And you know, I think I kind of get it a little bit now, in a weird kinda way. 'Figure that must be what everyone else sees, when they look at me.
To grasp the path life follows, to hold its destination. To have life and death both in the palm of one's hand. Could there ever be anything more delightful than that?
Everyone I meet, without exception, trusts me implicitly. They take the substances I give them, which they know nothing of, and willingly introduce them into their own bodies.\n\nThe fools.

Even when I mix in a little bit of poison every month, the only thing that comes back to me is grateful words and generous remuneration. Well done, you idiots. Letting me lead you down the garden path to a slow, painful death.

Still, straight up poisoning people is terribly gauche, you know. The cutting edge of such things is getting a doctor to add your compounds to their medicines and IVs, that sort of thing. For a pharmacist to be anything close to a poisoner is such a throwback, it's laughable! I admit, upon hearing that I let my temper get the best of me and beat the offending doctor.\n\nI guess I must be getting senile, letting myself use such a crude method of murder.

A dauntless and brave king was out falconing when he was bitten by a yellow fever mosquito and fell ill with a high fever. The emperor saw this as a prime opportunity, and immediately mobilized his troops to invade. The dauntless king was unable to lead his own forces, and by necessity surrendered, swearing allegiance to the empire. Shedding bitter tears of blood, the king summoned a powerful magician and ordered him to remove the spirit of rage from within his chest.

The emperor visited the king at his castle, sitting for a grand feast. Deep in his cups, he tossed his goblet at the king, mocking him viciously, claiming he was a a coward without the spine to put the castle out of its misery. The king, known for his temper, became so furious he began to bleed, and his retainers feared what would happen. But the king only laughed, and prostrated himself before the emperor.

Now, the emperor had always held the king in contempt, but at this, even the ministers who had journeyed with him began to despise the king. \n\nYears later, the emperor was thrown from his horse on a long ride and immediately knocked senseless. The king, who had so long had his fangs blunted, went immediately to the treasure carriage and opened a certain box. That day, he reclaimed the Spirit of Lupine Fury that had been taken out of him all those years before.

The ministers gathered before the king, rejoicing that the day had finally come and beseeching their king to destroy the empire. Before they could even finish speaking, the king stove in the magician's skull, and then set about dispatching the rest of the ministers one after another before letting loose a powerful howl. The moment he had reclaimed the spirit, that wrath had burst out of him, focused inexorably on all who had done nothing all those years, as he was forced to endure such humiliation.

"I guess we're like, really together, now, huh? Together, together."
"I caught myself thinking of you, even when we were apart."
"Actually, I was thinking of trying to go into business again, so I'm raising the money for that right now."
"Think of it, if we succeed at this together, then we can really be together..."

"The two of us will be together always. We're one. We even bathe together. Things were so wonderful when we were children."\n"But after we grew up, people started to reject our relationship..."\n"That's why we've decided to find a world for just the two of us."

"If there is beauty in this world that refuses to belong to only me, then I'll ever so gently take it by the throat, and leave it with the loveliest of scars. Then at least, the scars, if nothing else, will be mine and mine alone."

The many dreams the scorpion showed me, and the countless feelings it let bloom in my mind seemed to melt together in a single moment. In that instant, I was certain I could feel that person's warmth. That's how I know...how I'm certain I'll be happier never waking from this dream.

Why am I so fat?
I want to be more beautiful. I want to be perfect.
But I can't control my urges.
...I hate myself.
I received a magic drug. When taken with water, all the food you've eaten will exit your body instantly. I can eat as much as I want with this! I don't have to dread looking in the mirror anymore!

I checked the mirror several times a day, and I did in fact notice small changes.\nI do feel a bit guilty for my actions.\nBut if I stopped taking it now, I would just revert back to my old self. I can't stop...

The number of pills kept increasing, and now I've downed an entire bottle. My body began to hurt and I passed out from the pain. My stomach has been aching for days since.\nBut I'm glad. This pain only proves I am losing weight.

Hmmm....this is grilling up nicely. Alright, time to cut. ...Here, this is your portion. I've got some wine I've been saving special, just for tonight. Don't worry about anything, just dig in and enjoy!

Well? Is it good? ...Really? I'm so glad to hear you say that. Hm? Which one? I can grill up some more right now, so eat as much as you like! Well, what are you waiting for? Don't just sit there, I said eat up!

Now, now, there's no need to be crude. You've gotten vomit all over the dishware!\nI think I told you to eat, didn't I?!\nWe've got plenty of meat left and I've got to make sure you finish off every bit of it, now don't I?

Diary of Vigilante Vice-Squad-Leader Atlas:\nI continued to force him to eat that which was most precious to him. He only ever became close to like-minded people, after all. It seems yesterday he lost an auction, trying to get his hands on some famous delicacies. I wonder what he'd think if he knew who outbid him? We livestock certainly know how to hold a grudge, if nothing else.

You mustn't go near that violinist. He bewitches people with that beautiful memory, searching for someone with the lovely hair he favors among his victims. If those crazed eyes light upon you...you're finished. He'd chase you and your hair to the ends of the earth.

And do you know what that violinist would do, then? Well, he'd invite you back to his mansion, to being with. Probably, you'd even have a great time at first. After all, he'd feed you wonderful food, and provide sweet scented oils and lovely ornaments, all of it to make your hair even more beautiful than before.

Unfortunately, you wouldn't be able to see that for yourself, not with every single mirror in the place broken. You see, the violinist, well...let's just say he really loves hair. That's why he can't stand to look at his own hideous head of it. Instead, he'd cultivate your own beautiful locks, he'd adore them.

So you see, that's why I have to have your hair. It's more beautiful than any head of hair I've seen before. Sorry to say, I don't really need the rest of you though, so I'll be burning it with the rest of the rubbish. I've even made a little bauble of your hair, to adorn my violin, so I can admire its beauty every day. I think I'll be able to make even sweeter music, with this.\n\nThanks for that.
For Professor Lona Sandas, who researched the cause of obesity in college: a piece of calorie free chocolate.
For the oil baron concerned about having oily skin: dark chocolate, with no added vegetable oil.
For Kenty, who was so worried about his body hair he stopped talking to girls altogether: chocolate said to have a depilatory effect.

For all present here today, I know you've created a variety of beautiful illusions to aid you in escaping your painful pasts. You no loner need to worry about such things. Eat these delicious treats, and your awful pasts will melt away as surely as the chocolate itself.
If we are to dole out to these sinners their just desserts, then we ought equally to mete out such condign chocolate to the poor but hardworking youth.
Even so...If we have a duty to distribute chocolate, how far does such a duty extend? Of course, we would be obligated to gift it to those who care for us in our daily lives...

It's only that...we really must do something with this towering spiral of stacked cacao. Just so! If we were to designate a particular day as a special day of gifting, the chocolate would have it's own value on that day.
Certainly, I do seem to remember that we made chocolates, long ago...back then, we never had the chance to give them to anyone, but this year? This year will be different...
How strange. The stuff was so bitter, but Snow managed to transform it into such adorably sweet confections...
I have questions! All of those people who were terrified of us before, how is it that they've become such fast friends with Rapunzel, now?
Snow told me that spices are necessary to draw out the flavor of the ingredients. Rapunzel told me further, that you should look for what it is the other person wants...

I spent a long time considering these questions, trying to think of how I, myself, could devise a way to make the others happy, and I succeeded!\n"Alright, everyone! Come join me, and work until we've finished these chocolates!"

To think I'd fall for a fellow hunter! Now that I have thought, I'll stay with you for life! Forever! Even should I outlive you somehow, I can't imagine ever loving another! I swear it, on this magnificent hunting rifle you've gifted me.

I can't believe this happened...how could you go where I can't follow?! Having lost you, the one I loved the most in the world, I truly can't imagine ever loving again. I'll live a quiet life, from now on, standing vigil over your grave.

Who would ever believe the day would come when I could feel the stirring of new love? Even after all my prayers and lamentations, I know you're never coming back to me, my lost love. I must move on, move forward and embrace new love. Oh, to have found such happiness again!

It's truly astonishing, to think that there would ever be a day when I had such a happy home and family of my own. Watching my cheerful wife as we dine together, our child growing within her. I should go out and see if I can hunt something new for tonight's supper. I'll just get my rif...huh? I can't pull my hand away from the stock...Wait! Wh...why is the gun moving of its own accord?! No! Not my wife! Is..Is this you doing this? Please...please, don't....!
Look, I get it, I get it! Love is a fickle thing, isn't it? Quick to cool. I should know, I've had quite the roster of boyfriends. People can break up over the tiniest things.

My first boyfriend cheated on me.
The second guy lied about his debt.
The third one was an addict.
The fourth guy actually killed someone.
And it's like, all of that is just a totally mood killer, you know?

But still! I feel like if it'd been TRUE love then it wouldn't have gone cold so easy. No matter what happened, you know? That's why I've been super careful choosing Boyfriend #5, but there really are just no decent candidates.\n\n...So I started looking at things from the total opposite perspective.

Instead of finding someone who won't do any of that stuff, I need to find someone who'll stick with me even if I cheat on him, lie about my debt, become an addict and kill a guy!\n\nIf they can love me after that, I'll know we have something that'll really last, you know?
Brother, my eyes still recall the sight of you.\nThe bruise on your skin when we'd play together...\nThe stories you created for the sister only you knew.

That was the day I'd realized it. Subtle admiration, nurtured until it bloomed into love. It was the day I left childhood behind. Still, you didn't notice  the change in me, Brother. I stood straighter, knowing I needed to be even more grown.

And I knew, I knew that love would grow until I couldn't bear it, knew if that was what I had to look forward to, then I'd best snuff it out at once. And I've been reliving that day, that moment of decision, ever since.

Tell me, Mr. Bear. Was I wrong, that day? Did Brother want us to live together, after all? It's just that now, I...I can't seem to find an answer. Brother, please, tell me. Was I too weak? Am I still a child, after all?

The girl was born in the midst of filth, a thief by the age of five, and not long sure to die for her thieving. She didn't die, however. An assassin came, and took her away, took her in. Why her? She asked, and the assassin said simply, "Anyone would have been fine. It just happened to be you."

The girl was trained in the ways of the assassin, and at length, became his trusted lieutenant. She wasn't at all grateful, though. To her, they were merely business partner, and he felt the same. It's why he didn't stop her when she told him one day she meant to strike out on her own.

Working independently, the more jobs she completed, the more she remembered her mentor. She only understood now, now that they were separated. He was a genius in the art of killing. And she...? She admired him more than she had ever realized when he was still training her. It was then, she was contacted by a client who wanted her to kill her mentor.

Why? She asked the question, staring blankly at the blood that now pooled at his feet. He said he'd just forgotten to bring any bullets. How silly of him. And then, he handed her his gun and made one final request.

The client who had orchestrated this was a fellow assassin with a grudge, eager to enjoy a scene of tragedy at his rival's expense. He was certainly nearby, even now, watching.
She took the gun, and loaded it. She had inherited his legacy, and would not fail.
The snake disguised itself as a drugseller, peddling its wares and declaiming to potential customers that a certain tincture would let the user seduce any one they desired.

I'm not a fool. I could tell I was probably being taken for a ride, but even so, the image of a certain beautiful knight enthralled by me was too tantalizing to give up. I couldn't stop myself from smiling and smiling at only the thought.

"Cost me an arm and a leg, but I guess it was worth it, huh? If it let me charm such a lovely knight this easily" I murmured to myself, later, reaching down to brush several loose strands from a peacefully sleeping face, reveling in the excitement each expression it made had stoked in me.

The true satisfaction though, was in the fact that I hadn't used the tincture at all, though I'd said so. I smiled once more at the lips that had shaped such lovely excuses, blaming that blush, the heat in those eyes all on the drug I'd supposedly used.

That girl was always taking a nap at the base of that big tree. She loved it, and it loved her. Hard to tell which one of them had the idea, the girl or the tree, but one day she snapped off a branch to make herself a staff.

That staff and the tree were of one heart and the staff remembered everything the girl had ever said to the tree as she sat among its roots.\nThe staff remembered that the girl had been bullied by the chief's daughter, that she wished that awful girl would just go away forever. The staff knew what it needed to do, and cursed the chief's daughter so that she broke every bone in her body.

The girl kept the staff with her always, and the staff came to know of everything she did. The staff knew she was jealous of her talented older sister, and the staff grew resentful of the sister as well, cursing her with heartbreak.

One day the girl grew depressed. She'd been blamed for the tragedies that befell the chief's daughter and her sister, and was so miserable she wanted to die. She hung herself from the branch of her beloved tree, and the staff cursed the branch that it would never break, and the girl would stay with them forever.

A prince eloped with the princess of an enemy kingdom. They fled towards the horizon on horseback, the princess holding tight to her love. As they arrived a t a crossroads, the young prince straightened in the saddle and declared firmly, "To the right, soldiers wait to capture us. Towards the center, bandits lay an ambush. Let us go left!"

As they proceeded down the leftward path, they came upon some rocks and a spring welling up between them.
"Do you suppose it's good to drink?" the princess asked warily, to which the prince answered in the same firm tone of voice, "I should think not! Those stones are certainly drawing up toxins from the ground!"

The princess stared at him incredulously, but this was but the beginning of the prince's declarations, and their journey was continuously interrupted by shouts of "There's a poisonous snake in the grass!" "Deadly mushrooms!" "The cliff here is unstable!"

A curious, sweet fragrance hung in the air a while later as the princess finally ventured, "You seem quite confident, but how can you know such things?\n"Oh." The prince blanched, opening his mouth to voice a reply "Well..."\nAlas, before he could form the words the two found themselves entrapped by the vines of carnivorous plants, their struggling bodies dissolved by acid as they were consumed.

A prince eloped with the princess of an enemy kingdom. They fled towards the horizon on horseback, the princess holding tight to her love.\n\nIndeed, as the prince completed the rite of banishment, trapping them both in an endless hell repeating a wandering elopement and grisly death, he leant close and mused, "Do you suppose our scattered bones will form a ring to mark our wanderings?"
Now that I think back, she used to ask me whether I'd had lungs or gills, before. She was always fascinated by the idea.
None of that is any excuse for trapping my legs in this thing and leaving me on dry land, completely unable to use my lungs. She didn't even ask first...!
And the minute she sates her curiosity, she instantly loses interest. I shouldn't be surprised, this is just like her...and now I'm trapped in this living hell.

"It's excruciating...the pain where the device pierces my legs burns horribly...please, someone, anyone...help me..."\n"Oh! Sorry about that! Give me just a sec, I'll make it better. Oh dear, you're unconscious. Well, no need to worry, once I give you this new and improved breathing device..."

Oh, me? As you can see, I'm a decrepit old man.
Ah yes, some would call me the "Wise King" ever since I figured out the Golden Rule of the world and obtained the ultimate magic.
People who aim to steal the ultimate magic show up from time to time and give me grief.
Indeed, that happened not too long ago...

As soon as they found difficulty in persuading me, they used the magic of "alteration" to steal my magic one after another.\nAll that was left was the ultimate magic, so they locked me away in prison.\nThey warmed me to brace myself if my attitude didn't change the next day.

It was that night.
As I was wrapped up in despair, the sound of flapping wings struck my ears.
Yes. It was my familiar who appeared. One who'd served me for many years.
Once I saw the dagger in its mouth and the sad light behind its eyes, I knew.
Ah, I see. You mean that I should take my own life with this?
Oh, what a kind familiar I had...

I unsheathed the dagger and held it in my throat...
and then plunged the dagger into familiar's chest.
I bathed in the spray of red nectar of life, and felt the stolen magic returning to me. Using the magic of escape I succeeded in running away.
...Hm? Why do you look at me like that?
A familiar is only as good as its use for its master, right? Surely, it's proud of itself wherever it may be!

Having found success at a young age and rolling in money, everyone asks me how I am.\nMy social status combined with the attitudes of those around have spoiled me.\nBut you want to hear about what made me reflect on it all?

Close your eyes and immerse yourself in the darkness.
 Focus your consciousness on the cosmos expanding before you.
Do you see it? The countless photospheres floating about?
They are the stars of the galaxy.

Among the myriad of sparkles, I'm just a little brighter than the surrounding ones.
If you look broaden your range of view, such brilliance will soon become hazy.
From the viewpoint of unceasing history, I am such haziness.
It's unpleasant to grow, it's just a lifelong dedication. To grow spoiled is impertinent, and is but a lifelong diligence.

[Scholar]
It is said that all successful people of this era loved this violin solo.
They would lend their ears to important research, hallucinate about universe, realize their own vulgarity compared to the brilliance of the stars, and neglect their studies. Wouldn't you suppose?
In any case, one can say that sometimes it's important to stop listen to the music.
If I were to become a virtual idol, I'd never allow anyone to take my place at the top.
Don't mention other idols' during my stream. I won't accept your apology, either.
I also won't tolerate men who have fun chatting with girls in my audience.
But if you can follow those rules...\nI'll make sure to reply to any comments that support me.\nEven in the wee hours of the morning.
If I were to become a virtual idol, I promise to never turn your smiles upside down.\nI'll keep bringing all of you joy.
And to keep you all from worrying, I promise not to collaborate with men.
But no matter how careful I am, there may be allegations of sexual favors or disagreements with other female idols...
I imagine you'll all be concerned if that were to happen, but I will speak up. Because if I don't deny it, it may cause a misunderstanding.
Rule #1:\nI enjoy falling asleep during streams.\nIf you find yourself lucky, spread the word and make it a trending topic on social media♪
Rule #2:\nIf I make it to a collab stream, don't forget to praise me! But don't attack me if I don't wake up before it's over!
Rule #3:\nDon't expect in person collabs.\nSleep is an everyday affair. Even if I'm up and it's raining, I probably won't go.
But if there's a place that would accept me as I am...\nI'm sure it would be wonderful.

Hey hey!
I'm Gems Company representative of Miyazaki and BL!
Hinaka Hoshina!
Have you guys heard?!
SINoALICE is collaborating with Gems Company and I'm the only character!
So today I'm going to stream myself pulling from the grimoire!\nHere I go!\nCool! I got Red Riding Hood! She's my favorite!
This Hamelin guy seems enticing.\nI can see it now, Aladdin x Hamelin.\nBut then again, Aladdin has a reputation...
(After a continuous monologue about BL as she pulls from the grimoire)\nOh! I got myself! Yippie!!!\nThank you for the crystals my wallet friends (Parrah and Noya)!!!

I am a man who lives by bushido.
My sovereign, by a bad stroke of luck, was defeated in battle and forced to flee to the main castle.
However, the enemy's pursuers were closing in. I had no choice but to stand guard and hold off the enemy here.
My allies, fall back quickly!
Come, enemy soldiers! Let us partake in typical battle...!

I had found myself in the middle of a dense forest.
I knew I fought valiantly, but didn't I perish in front of the swarming enemy?
"You, human. What's with your attire?" I heard a voice say. When I turned to look towards it—my eyes were agape in wonder.
There was a fish with legs growing out of it, some bizarre deformity.

This monster had no knowledge of the country or the war I had mentioned. According to the monster, the entire human race was under his control.
"I have no idea what you're talking about!" I was screamed, when several humans appeared.
They smiled at me. But all their eyes were out of focus.
The monster then spoke. "Calm down. You will be taken care of by your own kind."
Driven by fear, I turned around and ran.

I passed through the forest and was speechless at scene unfolding before me. A barren wilderness that stretched beyond the horizon. On top of that, fires everywhere.
"The scars from the hyperdimensional weapon remain deep, and have twisted the dimension. It's too dangerous. I will protect you."
The monster had caught up with me. I nodded my head in agreement.
...Several years later. I had a womb implanted in my body and gave birth to a monster child.
If I stay here, I'll be protected from the outside. But deep down I knew, I was defeated...

The deep bass booms of fireworks echoed all around. The battle that we, the holy knights wage against the aberration Barbery rages on day and night. Our fight shall not end until this, humanity's enemy, has been defeated. That's how it was supposed to be. However, one day I was struck behind on the battlefield, and when I awoke, subjected to the humiliation of captivity.

I opened my eyes to a prison cell. I was tense, unsure what would greet me, and surprised to find a normal group of people. To hear them tell it, the holy knights had suddenly declared them to be 'the Barbary' and began to persecute them. My mind was in a turmoil of confusion, as I slept in my cell that night.

I was woken in the deep of night by a battle cry, and knew that my fellow holy nights were raiding the prison. The scene as I breached its walls at last took my breath away. My fellow knights were chasing down and slaughtering innocent civilians.\n\nI shouted for them to stop, but they paid me no mind, continuing the massacre.

They brought me before the captain. He frowned, peering at me. "Looks like the hypnotism is wearing off," he murmured, and waved me away as my mind reeled, putting together the pieces. There were no 'holy' knights, no righteous battle against a foe of pure evil. I'd only been being used, a tool to grab more money and fame.

I sunk into a black despair as I realized my hands had slaughtered innocents, however unaware I had been at the time.

I glanced at the captain, at the swords of the men around him, and steeled myself as I lunged forward. There was a sharp crack of bone as he hit the ground under me. I smiled, even as I heard swords ring free of their scabbards all around me. Better to die as myself, and atone for my deeds in hell, than to lose my mind to these monsters a second time.

Beneath the deep blue sea dwelt a demon guarding a sword of legend, and a bounty has been offered to the one who can bring it to heel.\n\nThat's where we come in! All aboard! We're setting sail for a brighter, richer future!

...Goddamnit! They didn't tell us. We didn't know! It's a demon! How can it use spirit magic?! We started with a crew of ten, and it's already managed to brainwash four of them. I was able to do three of them the mercy of freeing them from that horror, but the fourth...?\nI know you're hiding somewhere, Merith! I'll make it quick, just...!"

A-hah! There you are! Just throw down your weapon! I know you don't want to live like...Hey! What...Wh...Why are the rest of you attacking me? Don't tell me you've all been...No!\n\n...Tch. In the end, they overpowered me, trussed me up, and tossed me away into the the blue depths, into the monster's lair.

The two men stared at the unbreathing corpse. "Another failure," sighed one, shaking his head. His patron, the noble funding these experiments replied, "You're sure the ritual does what you say? We can really use this to recreate humanity?"\n"Yes, I'm certain. We each have the potential inside of us, a single shining spear sunk in the deep waters of our psyche. With my magic, I can send people to that place, create the trials they'll need to overcome in order to truly awaken."
The door had not always existed. It was created, to cut of this place from the outside, and then it was shut and sealed with the strongest of bindings.
Months turned to years and then decades, and it came to pass that there were no longer any who remembered what was on the other side of the door.

It had never been a secret to the door's owner. Indeed, the world beyond the door had been an everyday thing, to her, and something she valued greatly. So much in fact, that upon her death she decided to protect it with a last testament that barred any from crossing the threshold.\nHowever in time, her family lost power to a revolution, and with it, the ability to safeguard the door. Its seal was broken.

In the days before the seal it had been a beautiful garden, with flowers and trees of all types. Sealed away from the care of human hands for decades, however, it had turned into a wild and chaotic wilderness, such that the people of the future, looking upon it after stepping through the door for the first time, could not comprehend what about this place would ever drive someone to so passionately protect it.

Good day, thank you all for coming! I'm so glad I could be here to greet our new friends. You're going to love it here, it's wonderful. I'm pretty sure it's the last little slice of paradise left on this planet. Let's all get along and help each other, why don't we?

We specialize in ecosystems here, you know? We make sure everything has its own place in the food chain. For our own nutritional needs, well, we're doing amazing things with algae, and with al the cultural relics stored in the Tower, we really lack for nothing.

There's only one rule: Do no harm.\nThat's it! Just don't endanger other people and you'll be fine. No need to think too hard about it, everyone's pretty nice here and no one ever starts fights. Oh, right, I forgot! See that glass wall over there? Sometimes you're gonna see flashes of things on the other side but don't worry about it, that's perfectly normal!

[Planet-Eaters]\nWe're happy to announce the opening of a new Planetary Zoo. A few years ago, we selected a few dozen samples and culled the rest of the life on the planet. The samples living within the Zoo are manged by the Sword of Illusion system, and many seem to have gotten the impression they are being invited to live in a place called 'Eden,' which records show was some sort of garden of the gods.\nAlthough they do look quite harmless and even funny, we must ask that you refrain from entering the enclosures or from giving them food.

It seems he found the bone at the bottom of the sea, and that he found its gently curving shape to be beautiful. Thinking it belonged to a fish or some other sea creature, he crafted it into a bow inspired by it's lovely natural curve.

He began to use the bow he had crafted, and with its use came dreams. Dreams of battle. Dreams of riding a mer-horse across the seafloor, lungs untroubled by the waters. Dreams of dispatching nautical demons one after the other, using his trusty bow. Such dreams he saw every night, but dismissed as mere fancies.

However, it seems these fancies became his reality. The mer-horse found him and begged his aid. Drunk on the glorious exploits of his dreams, he gladly leapt astride the horse and headed for the seafloor.

He disappeared into the dark depths of the waves, only to float to the surface sometime later, bereft of life, lungs burst. It seems, outside his dreams, his human body was unable to withstand the cold airless pressure of the deep sea.

On the tenth of August,
everyone was playing by the river,
Aladdin diving in
just like always.

And just like always
big brother
was watching over us.

I thought he might
want to play too, so I asked,
but he said no.

He just quietly watched us,
like he always did.
I wonder why?
Playing together would be more fun.

On the seventh of November,
there was a festival
at a nearby church.

There were a lot of young
priests in training
there to help.

I thought it was a really good chance
to learn a bunch of new knowledge
so I could help out Sis more.
So I asked the priests about many things.

After the festival,
we went to the baths to clean up from running around
Sis scrubbed me until I was sore, even though I didn't even need it.

On the third of May,
Mommy said we could buy whatever snacks we wanted,
as long as we shared with everyone.
She even gave us 1,000 gold to get the snacks with.

I lost at rock paper scissors,
so I only got 100 gold, though I was really sad.
I bought five of my favorite yogurt cups.

Aladdin won at rock paper scissors,
so he got a bunch of fancy snacks.
I was really jealous. I stared at him until he shared some with me.

To say thanks for him sharing,
I shared my yogurt with everyone, too.
Actually, I always wanted to share my favorite with everyone,
but I was too embarrassed to do it before.

On the seventh of February,
I understood.
We all wanted to help out Sis.

Even Aladdin understood.
If we could be smarter, then
Sis wouldn't have to work so late all the time.

But I wanted to help Sis more than anyone else.
I understood Sis more than anyone else. That's why I was reading different books than Aladdin. I wasn't gonna let him win.

...But today, Sis praised Aladdin
instead of me.
What did I do wrong?
Someday, I'm gonna figure out how
to get Sis's love all for myself.

On the twenty-ninth of September,
Children are so unpredictable.\nWhich is to say, I can't take my eyes off of them for a second.

I wonder if I put my own mother through this kind of stress?
When I think about that,
I admit I do feel a little guilty.

Even so, there's something amazing in watching them grow.
They're nothing like their idiotic adult versions.

Watching the children I've raised
running around during Field Day makes me feel so proud.
Prouder than I've ever felt from doing well at work or beating a game.
Prouder than I've ever felt for anything I did myself.
I don't know a single person here.\nDeprived of accurate information, they've begun jumping at shadows. Withholding the truth is truly the root of all evil.

The nation is hardly strapped for cash. In fact, they have several hidden hoards, both within their borders and without, filled to the brim with enough treasure to shock the most jaded cynic. Why then, I ask, would someone lie and claim we're on the verge of bankruptcy? Clearly, they hope to drum up a good excuse to raise taxes on people newly anxious about their livelihoods.

Does that make you angry? Good. Then I say, direct your hate at the privileged few. They who restrict information, they who refuse to speak the truth to the people below them. Make them understand that depriving people the information they need is the seed of all other deprivations.\n\nMy fellows, I ask you not to stand for this secrecy and censorship any longer!

Hm? Oh, right. Yeah, some guy was waving a staff around screaming about deprivation or something. Turns out he'd escaped from a hospital somewhere, or something. I think they carted him back wherever he came from.\nNow, enough of that. Are you ready to get back to work? This has already deprived me of a crazy amount of revenue, so for your sake you'd best not deprive me of my time on top of it.
Yonah, I learned a special recipe!\nWhen you eat it, all your injuries will be gone!\nOh! I want everyone to feed it to those they care about!
The ingredients are deer meat, sea turtle eggs, fresh veggies and herbs from the garden, and lastly tons of scorpion claws!
Next, fill a pot up with all your ingredients, place the top on, and let it simmer overnight!\nThe white steam rising from it is just so mesmerizing.
...Oh! I think it's ready!\nSmell for a soft scent when you take the lid off. That means it's done!\nI can't wait to give it to grandpa.

"Rule 0: You have the right to disband a rule by vote."\nI am the king's aide and second-in-command. Until now, all rules have be absolute, however, a "Voting Rite" was held where citizens could vote to change rules. Now, let's see what sort of ballots were made...

"Rule 451: Consuming alcohol is forbidden during the daytime."\nAnd stated as the reason is: because I like drinking... Because it's anonymous, all these votes are based off selfish desires. We need to improve the system somehow that reflects public opinion.

"Rule 356: Royal inquiries are limited once per day."\nAnd stated as the reason is: because I long to be with the King more...? Could this Fyra's vote...? No. Of course not. She's not the type to be interested in love. Moving on...

"Rule 68: The King's aides are to forever serve at his side"
Reason being: Thank you for all your hard work. You deserve a break once in awhile... Could this be from the King himself? I'm honored to have stood by your side all these years. And the citizens of this country are proud of your work. There's no doubt of it.

Note: After rigorous deliberation, "Rule 451: Consuming alcohol is forbidden during the daytime", the most voted for rule, was repealed.
My dearest beloved comes and visits at night.\nHe brings with him a song from a splendid lyre.\nIt is for him that I dress up and leave for the port.
Dear minstrel. Hear me please.\nDark is my skin from sailing the raging seas. Red my hair blazes for it has lost its color.\nBut don't you find that the least bit charming?
I've fought pirates and suffered many injuries.\nI may not look like the other beautiful women, but my feelings for you are real!\nSo please, let us be wed!

The minstrel continued to play his lyre. After receiving a round of applause, he took his leave.
"I guess not..." Sighing, I made eyes with an old man in the audience.
"Hey lady, you were killed by pirates. No one can see you."
"Shut yer trap!" I sneered, and left.
Once there was a certain someone.\nThey wondered to themselves why people bothered giving unwanted advice and warnings to others, when such things were known to cause only pointless bickering.

And, there was another certain someone.\nWhy, they, wondered, did some people buy up all the staples, as if they were the only people in the world who had need of them? As if it wasn't nearly certain that someone else needed them more?!
There was also a certain someone, who was given advice.\nImagine, if you will, their feelings upon being told that rising early to exercise would make a significant difference in their life.
And I, who was seated next to all three of these someones, really couldn't care less about any of it. I'd much rather have fun, so I asked them all to play with me.

Seared to the bone by the burning flames, immersed in an acid sea, and frozen through by a violent blizzard...it was if all of the torments that ever were or will be had been blended into one. Merciless, cruel, and endlessly violent, I was overcome with this unbroken litany of suffering, powerless to resist it to any degree.

Chills wrack me, a bitter, malicious cold spearing my flesh. Ah, 'Malice'...such thoughts are what has laid me low. Pure, malicious evil. Hate so deeply embedded as to be unconscious, motivating an equally thoughtless slaughter. As if I'm trapped in a black mist, overwhelmed by powerlessness.\n\nPlease, I can't stand this anymore. None of it, no more, please, just let me fuse with it, just free me from this pain....

Something tickles the back of my mind. My comrades' smiling faces on the battlefield. My smiling family, my love, smiling at me. That's right...they were the reason I stood against the Dark Dragon God, I wanted to protect them...but...I lost. I lost, and was devoured whole. Perhaps I should have given up, then. On life. On happiness, but...\n\n...No!

This specimen of bone belongs to the Dark Dragon God, who once nearly destroyed the world. Take a good look at it. See how the bone has been gouged out, all the way from the nostril to the right eye socket? That's right, this is where the god was pierced from within by a glaive. One of the many heroes it had devoured whole managed to turn the tides with a miraculous strike.

Ahhh, thank you. I feel like I can relax a little bit now that the poison's been bought. I mean, I thought I'd never stop grieving when my husband told me he'd die before he stopped his affairs. Well, I'll make sure of that!\n\nWhat? Rethink things? What's there to think about?! Ugh, just mind your own business.

Sorry, look, I didn't mean to say all that. Geez, how embarrassing. My husband and I had a talk and this time he promised he'd never cheat again! So I guess I'll return the poison.\n\nWhat? It's just sugar water? What the hell, I trusted you! You cant just...LIE to people like that!

Augh, I can't believe this happened. My husband made me tea. He never does, so I was overjoyed, but...it tasted so weirdly sweet. He must have tried to buy poison from that same person! This must be that sugar-water...UGH! He was just trying to get my guard down so he could murder me with poison! He must still want to be with his lover!

What's the matter, got a tummy ache? Hah! I slipped some REAL poison into your coffee. Serves you right. What? Don't look at me like that. This is your own fault for trying to poison my tea.\nWhat? "It was just regular sugar"? You mean it? Oh. Oh, no. Someone! Someone help! Poison!
Doll 1\n[Suiginto]
"Bonds are fatuous. The world only needs Father and I..."
[Obstinacy]
(noun) the quality or state of being obstinate\n1. "Obstinacy is what longs for a bond."
Doll 3\n[Suiseiseki]
"Only you yourself can overcome unspoken grief."
[Intense]
(adj) existing in an extreme degree\n1. "The intensity of it is why it's so fragile."
Doll 4\n[Souseiseki]
"My master wishes death upon a certain human. It is my duty to hunt lives. Nothing more."
[Pain]
(noun) mental or emotional distress or suffering\n1. "I could be vulnerable because I knew pain."
Doll 2\n[Kanaria]
"I'm fighting. That's the Rozen Maiden pride."
Affection
(noun) tender attachment\n1. "Her affection lights up the darkness."
Doll 6\n[Hinaichigo]
"I don't want us to fight and hurt anymore."
[Innocence]
(noun) freedom from guilt or sin\n1. "Isolation is the fear of innocence."

One of my subordinates quit the other day. And he left with these words,
"I can't follow you if all you do is take the credit of your subordinates."
You know, I'm the one who's held accountable for all your behavior, so I deserve as much.
...Huh? Who are you? And what are you doing sitting at my desk?

What? You can't fool me. That's my name.
I'm asking you again. Who the hell are you and why are you pretending to be me?
...Won't drop the act, huh?
Good, my secretary has arrive. Get this man out of my sight!
Wh-what did you say?! That man there is an impostor! The name you spoke belongs to me!\nMmh... I see how it is. You're both in on it.\nUnforgiveable! I'll crush your skulls with my mallet!

Huh? You're asking if I, a general with such outstanding military prowess, has become incompetent or has lost the ability to bear the weight of vanity?\nOh... Well, now that you mention it...\nHave it your way! I'll lock myself up and dwell on it...

I was a bit on the tipsy side that day.\nA fortune teller told me, "You'll be a divorcee. There's a problem with your wife." Angered, I reached out to the woman and grabbed her by the chest.\nUnfazed, she continued. "Try unlocking her mind with this," and gave me a book.

As soon as I arrived home, I proceeded to examine the book. However, it was written in a script I'd never seen before, let alone understood.\nYet somehow, I began to understand what my wife was thinking.\nMy wife, who I've always thought as a modest and family-oriented woman, was out with a man. And the two of them were plotting to kill me.

I considered separating from her, but then I would be forced to pay her alimony.
I tried to meet with her man.
When I did, I then was able to read his mind as well.
I found out he swung both ways and that he wanted me. So I seduced him and together we murdered my wife.

I saw my chance and killed the man, making it appear like a double suicide. A murder done out of passion.
Then I left. Escaping my crime, a free man in the town.
But I became afraid of the looks from others. You can never know what others are thinking deep inside.
I should move out into the countryside, away in the fields...

This is a story from my dad from his days as an explorer when I was little.
He spoke of a kingdom in the north of beautiful gems. You could find gems everywhere you went.
In the treetops, bottom of rivers... And sometimes even inside the fish!
Heheh. Just imagine the look on chefs' faces.

The kingdom mostly made its livelihood with crafts.
They made a whole bunch of stuff with the gems they mined.
Then they would load their goods onto carts and travel miles upon miles on steep roads...
Just to sell their crafts in the distant port towns.
But they never let it known that their kingdom was rich with these precious jewels.

What should have been a strictly kept secret was somehow leaked to other lands.
The rumor quickly spread...
And the kingdom was destroyed before I was born.
Outside kingdoms swept the land bare of it's gems. And now it's nothing but a barren mountain.

This flute is a relic from the Gem Kingdom, handed down to my father from a certain kingdom.
It's famous for showing beautiful visions to those who hear it.
Can you see it? The mountains and rivers are filled with glittering gems.
This illusion is what the kingdom once was.
It was noticed by an adventurer who even identified the location.

It's said that a fatal error occurred on this planet long, long ago. But no one knows the details.\nAnyway, as a result, this led the once 4-legged creatures to become 2-legged, and are now reigning over Earth.\nThese altered creatures are no longer a shadow of their past selves.

It was then a certain prey was presented to the horned lion, the king of the 4-legged creatures.\nAnd when he saw it, his expression was filled with rage.\nHairless arms and legs, hardly any muscle on its entire body... And it once oppressed the 4-legged beasts. A creature known as a "human".

"Tear it in half!" order the horned lion.
But a few hours later it was reported the "human" had escaped.
It were 4-legged beasts, formally known as "dogs" and "cats", that had escaped with it out of a sense of familiarity.
And so the enraged lion lead its team in pursuit.

When the lion caught up with the group, it shot an arrow. It pierced through the "human" who protected the "dog" and "cat".
"We couldn't handle the forbidden technology. It's because of us the things are like this. You must restore this planet to the beauty it once was..."
And with that, the "human" passed away.
Afterwards, the horned lion had a bestowed him a funeral and set up a proper government.

My Lord, I've come to report news on the Knights of the Order.\nI was just about to be captured by them, but after a fierce sword fight, I was able to fled to the commercial district, a cease-fire zone.\nBut the moment I stepped foot into the area, I was captured.

The knights had began to discuss something in front of me.\nWe don't have the right to capture him here. Perhaps we should overlook the matter.\nNo, no. We captured him the very moment he stepped in. That's what happened.

Their never-ending argument continued in vain, but leaned toward the conclusion of turning to their superiors for a decision.
They looked like a bunch of cowards, so I told them,
"I'm here undercover by your superiors! You don't want to aggravate them by getting in my way, do you?"
The chaos it stewed allowed for my escape.

My Lord! Why order for my execution?! I've brought wonderful news! The men are cowards and not to be feared!
...What? I am the coward? Just because I said "after a fierce sword fight" yet the sword at my hip shows no signs of blood?
You think I was ordered to spew lies and catch you off guard?
Heh... Nothing gets past you!

A man with a habit of comparing himself to others with a wish to die cried out to the sorcerer.\nI want to die, but I don't have the courage to do it. Isn't there anything you can do?\nThe sorcerer replied, "Then try dying, and you may gain the courage to do so."

The man used "Scorpion Paralysis", a secret medicine brewed by the sorcerer to paralyze himself.\nThe day of his funeral, the attendees mourned over his death, their eyes briming with tears.\nThe sorcerer, however, observed the scene apathetically.

When the time was right, the sorcerer spoke to the crowd.
Late at night, when the man's paralysis subsided, he shared with him all that he learned.
The man was grief-stricken. So much so that the shock killed him.
The sorcerer watched the the poor man succumb to his death, all the while thinking back on the information he learned.

"Whenever I saw him moping around, it made me feel a little better about myself. He was the real lowlife..."\n"No one else was as miserable as him... And that gave me hope to keep living..."\nThe sorcerer then thought to himself. Perhaps this had saved him.

Coming back from school, I found my grandpa moving things in the yard.
"Gramps, where's Granny? I want a snack."
"Good timing. Call the old hag over here."
When he turned to look at me, his eyes were bloodshot red and gripped a gun in his hand.

Grandpa handed us both a shovel and told us to dig.
"I'll be burying my wife in this hole after I shoot her."
I tried to stop him, but he wouldn't listen.
Following his orders, Granny silently dug.

"I fought with a friend on the same battlefield. But then he left me there and took this pistol from me while he was at it."
"Next thing he did was tell my wife I was dead and used that chance to console and get close to her."
"And ya know what happened? That there slut opened up her legs to him. That deserves punishment!"
Gramps pulled the trigger, blowing Granny's head off and then shot his own.

When my parents returned home, I explained what had happened. Then they buried the pistol and their bodies.\nAccording to my father, the ghost of the pistol would come back to haunt us. So it was best to keep it a secret.\nBut even after 10 years, I'm not sure that was for the best.

I had just returned home from my first day of being promoted to a managerial position.
Welcomed by the smiles of my wife and daughters, the day's fatigue seemed to melt away.
What happiness. What joy.
Surely these wonderful days are here to stay.

At the ball last night, I was asked by many gentleman for a dance.
But I was prepared this time. I had my attendant carry a notebook with them.
If you wish for a dance, please sign your name and wait your turn.
It's hard being so popular.

The script for my last play was a huge success. It received outstanding reviews. Far more than it deserved.
Which is why I'm having such difficulty with my next one.
But if I can get past this, I'll be up there in the ranks with the greatest screenwriters.
It's quite the hurtle, but not impossible. I can do this!

[Historian]
The more records I read of the Millennial Kingdom, the more I doubt the theory of it being destroyed by a meteorite.
It's just not possible for this many people to be happy. Could it be these records are just lies and exaggeration?
What if there was a fight with those living in happiness and those who weren't... Resulting in a dreadful outcome?
I fear the worst.

[A anecdote of how an unusual chair came into fashion]\nThere once was a king who took the people's tax money and spent it on luxury goods and beautiful princesses.\nAll who criticized his actions were to be executed.
When the citizens rushed into the castle, the workers and princesses all ran for their lives.\nBut the king remained seated on his throne, making no attempts to escape.
The king was captured and was to be executed in front of his own people.\nHowever, according to his wishes he would ot be beheaded or hanged. Instead he would be bound to his throne and burned alive.

As he sat comfortable on his throne, the king was engulfed in flames.\nThough arrogant, his pride as he sat burning there left an impression on the people.\nLater, a chair modeled after him would become popular among the kingdom.

I was once an honorable knight, but no one respects me since I've retired. I'm tired of being treated like an old man!\nI'm stronger than I even was during my prime years!\nJust you see... Come, Great Sword. Grant me all the food and drink for two!

Ahahaha! Behold! My wish granted in an instant!
This is only the beginning of my power. I can have anything. Gold, women, you name it.
What? You wanna know how I got this power?
Who knows. But this is nothing for a knight of honor!

I'm too loud, you say?
Nonsense! Let the neighbors holler all they want.
Though, it would be nice if they'd all be gone!
...Hm? That's quite the racket going on over there.

So the neighbor and their guard dog were are dead...
Supposedly blood from a third party was also at the scene, but it's yet to be identified.
What if there's a spirit in my sword that has been following my orders all this time?
And if the spirit killed itself along with them, then that explains why can't use my powers anymore...
Doll 5\n[Shinku]
"To live is to fight, isn't it?"
Noble
(adj.) possessing outstanding qualities\n1. "Wearing nobility to hide one's weakness."
I've dreamed many times of a chain of sorrows, endlessly begetting more sorrows.
Revenge following from hatred. A world of such deprivation it brings forth people who know of nothing but stealing that which belongs to their fellows.
Without adequate food or shelter, people left so listless they cannot even brush aside the flies that cling to them. Plagues that ravage devastated landscapes.
Truly, it's a mere trifle to arrange things so, to craft a world which overflows with sorrow.

[Antique Bookstore Owner]
Welcome! Oh? What do you have there?
There's some kind of mud all over your book.
Huh? It's slime?
Well whatever, same thing!

Are you here to sell this?
I'm not saying you came to the wrong place or nothin'. We do buy antique books.
Just keep in mind it might not be worth all that much.
So then, how much are we askin' for the sticky thing?
Mind tellin' me what the book's about?\n...You dunno? Come on, it's your book, ain't it?\nHaven't you read it?

Huh? Rimuru used this book?!
Well I'll be damned!
This is a national treasure!
I take it all back! I'll buy it at any price!!!

[Cleaning Staff]
I work in the cleaning business.
Most of the time I'm asked to tidy up houses or just pick up trash in the streets.
It's a good thing there's not many litterbugs in this country, but someone still has to rake up all the leaves and stuff.

So here I was, raking up leaves deep in the forest when I came across something.
That something? This sword.
The whole thing was on fire.
Like, that's not normal...right?

Anyway, so I brought the thing back into town.
Before I knew it, word had gotten out about this thing, and ya know what happened next?
Rimuru himself came to see me in person.
The very moment he saw the blade, he had this sad look of nostalgia in his eyes...
I can only imagine how important it was to him.

Rimuru took the sword with him when he left.
Sometime after that, I found the sword again, this time lodged in front of a stone monument.
Unlike before, there were no flames.
I wonder if its related to the person buried below?

[Street Booth Owner]
You'd be surprised to hear what that girl is really like.
When she's with us she's no stranger to cooking and sewing.
On top of that, her friendly personality attracts all sorts of people.

At times I wish she was my own daughter.
I've even joked about it a few times.
It's become a habit to invite her over. She never complains, in fact, she seems pleased to help...
Oh, I'm going off track.

But that's the truth.
The problem is she's the princess of the ogre clan.
She's much stronger than any of us could hope to be.
The first time I saw her with that wand of hers, I was awestruck.

There was a gang of hoodlums who invaded the country. With a flick of her wand and they dropped on the spot.
Later I asked her what she did to them, and you know what she said? She used a spell to put them to sleep.
It's no wonder she's a close friend of Rimuru's.
Is there any man out there worthy of such a woman?
Marriage is all we seem to talk about recently.

[Wandering Child]
Woah, what is this?
Is it a toy? It's really cool.
It's not stealing if I found it, right?

Ugh! Why is it so heavy?
At least I got something cool to play with now!
How do I use with it anyway?
Oh! Maybe if I look through this hole I'll find something in there.

Just as I was looking through the hole, someone grabbed the toy from me!
It was a pink-haired girl with pigtails.
I've seen her plenty of times before. Oh, what was her name... Oh yeah! Milim!
My parents warned me not to get upset around her.
Is she that scary?

"You're 100 years too young to handle my gun!"
Milim took the toy off me and handed me candy instead.
"A token of my thanks. I was looking for this!"
I popped the candy she gave me in my mouth. It was sweet.
I don't know about my parents, but Milim seems okay to me.

● asked God, "What is that there?"
God replied, "Those red fruits on the tree are apples."
It was then ● learned the word 'apple.'
● took a bite of the apple. It smelled fresh and sweet.
● then began their search for more apples.

It was later that ● met △ and shared an apple with them.
△ seemed to like it.
One day when △ found an apple, the Devil said to △, "Why share your apple with ● when you can have it all to yourself?"
And so, △ ate the entire apple themself.

The Devil then went to ● and told them what △ had done.
For the very first time ● learned how to kill people with the sword in their hand.
Red dripped down from the blade. Was this an apple?
The Devil replied to ●'s question with a 'no.'
Then what about △'s red stained xx? The Devil said that was an apple.

● took a bite of △'s apple.
When God found out about this, he disappeared in grief.
With God gone, the Devil bounded ● to the earth and named them "man".
And in return, ● called the Devil "God" for teaching them many things.
After treating an injured demon from the sea, he gave me a splendid bow.\nWhen I drew the bow back as if ready to shoot, the waters pulled back. And when I released it, a surge of waves raged in.

The first shot destroyed a mountain. The second engulfed my village. And the third shot aimed right for the sky.\nUpon that last shot, it down poured for many days; the rainwater sweeping away everything.

It was then that I met the demon again. He laughed at me, asking if I was trying to destroy the world.\nI smiled and wrapped my arms around him.\nAll I wanted was to become your bride and make all the souls of the world my bridesmaids.
What was I to do? I cared deeply for my friends and family in my village, but I had fell in love with a demon. I had made my decision.\nSo, please. In the name of love, die. Everyone, die for me.

Hey! How about you treat me with more respect?
That's right, I'm talking to you.
You gotta be more gentle with me unlike those other magical items.
Don't use crude magic or leave me lying around.
Heh? Agh, wait! Don't be waving me around like that either!

Are you listening?! What the heck are you doing?!
You don't use wands to hit monsters!
What do you mean you're bad at magic?!
...Don't look at me like that. Stop it! Cut it out!

...Let's talk about this, okay?
You're a wizard, and I'm a wand.
We gotta work together, you know?
But that doesn't mean you can just smack me against a monster. How about we have a little heart-to-heart and make some magic toget...AAAAGHHR!!!

What is that war hammer?!
That's called cheating, you know! What do you need that for when you have me?!
How dare you! You're outta your mind if you think I'll forgive you for this!
...Oh. You're just friends? Sorry, I misunderstood.
Well, off to crack the skull of another monster today!

Upon hearing the dreadful news, my heart raced even faster.
I couldn't believe that my father's ship had been wrecked.
On top of that, the location of its wreck is home to some of the most dangerous marine animals, including sharks.
I was almost taken by despair until hearing one survivor had been found. It gave me some hope.

I was met with disappointment when I arrived at the hospital. The man in the bed was of my father's age, but it wasn't him.
I asked him about my father, but the man didn't know him.
But there on the table next to him, I caught sight of a harp. And my blood began to boil.
"That was my father's harp! Why do you have it?!"

"Please, calm down. I'll talk," the man said.
He then went on to tell of him and my father clinging onto a plank together while adrift at sea.
As they drifted, they came upon a creature barely alive and devoured.
"And then we merged into one..."

I was astonished. The man had changed into my father.\n"I came from outer space, but then collided with a ship from this planet. It caused a great loss of body tissue as a result. So I let those two devour me, linking them to my internal universe to keep me alive. Now it's your turn."\nThe being resembling my father clutched my arm and chuckled.

Oh, dear Father. Please save your lost lamb.\nAs a fisherman, I spend most of my days out at sea. But for a few days now, out of nowhere I hear the voices of lost souls. It's rather troubling to say the least.
What was the soul saying, you ask?\nWell, that depends.\nSometimes it's somethin' trivial like philosophy n' other times it's vulgar. But I won't go there.
Have I heard from God himself?\nHm, that's a tough one. I guess I've heard some things kinda holy n' stuff.\nBut who's to say.

Oh, dear Father! Why must you lock me away?!\nKeh?! What'dya mean I'm the chosen one? Jus' 'cause I can hear things don't mean I hear the voice of God too, let alone have responsibility in makin' you my disciple!\nN-no! Please let me out of here!

[Hot-blooded Young Monk]
My Lord! The Son of Man is a sinful creature jealous of thy neighbor, longing for thy failure, and drags thyself down!
I too am at times devastated by these ugly souls.
Please protect our hearts from such jealously!

[Pure Young Monk]
My Lord! Tis been ten years since man has been freed from all jealousy!
We no longer have reason to envy others.
Oh, how different the world appears. Such beauty! Full of light and hope!

[Peaceful Adult Monk]
My Lord! How long has it been since we've rid ourselves of envy?
Here on Earth, the people don't fight. They greet each other with smiles and kindness.
Isn't this world just as wonderful as your heavenly paradise?

[Sorrowful Elder Monk]
We live in a world of peace.
But within our conservative lives dwells an air of impatience.
There aren't many people remaining nowadays. They've gradually dwindled away.
My Lord! I pray that you return our jealousy to us! I cannot leave this world until it's been fulfilled!

[Blacksmith's Apprentice]
Welcome to the Weapon Shop! How may I help you?
Oh, this spear here? Sorry, it's not for sale.
Again, I appreciate your interest in it, but we aren't selling it. Not even to the highest bidder.
But you're right. It is a very special weapon indeed.

There was a woman I fell for. It was love at first sight. And this spear was forged just for her.
She was the most beautiful woman I had ever seen. I could tell there was a dark side to her, but even that swept me away...
The two horns on her forehead meant she's a member of the ogre clan.
But this spear... I made it with her in mind. Oh, how wonderful it would be if she were to wield it.

My only regret is that I failed to ask her name.\nNot like I could have. The moment she appeared I was running away from a monster. I thought I was about to die.\nBut if I ever see her again, I'm going to offer her this spear and ask her out! I won't miss a second chance!

What? What do you mean she left?
Where did she leave to? Is she not a resident here?
No... I can't bear to let this go unrequited.
She was my muse! My Juliet!
If only I could have given her this spear and seen her smile once last time.

[Tailor's Daughter]
One of my hobbies is to make dolls out of the scraps from work.
I design them myself.
Have you heard of personification?
I like to imagine what a low-grade demon would be like as a person.

So, that's what I do. I take that image in my head and turn it into a real live doll!
I used to get strange looks from people when they saw my creations, but when Rimuru saw them, he cheered me up.
You see... He gave all my dolls a name.
...I'm grateful for it, but at the same time its a bit dispiriting.

Low-class demons don't come to this country, so there's really no point to my fantasies.
I felt really sad about it.
But then just the other day, one finally showed up!
Guess what kind it was?!
A slime! Not strong slime like Rimuru, but a real low-class slime!

After meeting that slime, I came up with a new creation! Which is this doll here!
I named it Snowy because it's white like the snow.
What do you think? Cute, right?
Me and Slimy Snowy are going to be best friends!
The night he got the book with the octopus on the cover, he began to see visions of the city sinking to the bottom of the sea.\nSoon it would be all that he could think about.

Once upon a time there was a giant alien invertebrate that came to the planet and fought with its native species for control.\nThe city the aliens and their families built as their base ultimately submerged.
Those who worshiped the giant invertebrates as a god plotted a way to resurrect them.\nPart of their plan was to create a spell book that possessed those who read it and gather more followers.
It wasn't long after that he was possessed by this octopus god, and was never seen from again...

What do you mean you want me to send a false report that our rations haven't arrived?!\nTough it up! We're the most powerful iron-blooded knights to walk this continent! So what if we're being held captive!\nTh-That's a big hammer you got there. If you're going to crush my left arm, so be it.
Heh... Heheheh. I-I'm fine. See? Just a little sting, is all.\nI don't need my left arm. I've still got my right!\nHuh? Now my right arm, you say?

Okay! Okay! I'll shout that 'the enemy has taken our provisions and we'll surrender unless given help.' How does that sound?\nOh, you have something special for me for opposing you? There's a lovely nurse waiting for me below?\nI'll be off then!

Damn bastard! How dare you tell the guard to wait for the rearguard's arrival!\nThanks to you, the enemy is on the move again! We lost our best chance at overtaking their fort!\nBut out of respect for your loyalty in giving up your arms, we'll be sure to give you a proper burial.
My name is Grimoire Weiss.\nI am an ancient tome of profound wisdom.\nAfter awakening from my long slumber, I traveled the world with my most beloved friends.

She was a woman lacking respect for her elders.\nShe'd continuously talk down to me, calling me nothing but paper and even set me aflame.\nHowever... Her rash words were also the driving force that moved us all.

He was a compassionate and gentle boy who loved his friends.\nHis manor of dress was odd, but his kind words warmed everyone's hearts. This I know to be true.\nI wonder if he, too had felt any relief from his sins.

He was a cheeky guy, but not one you could just leave behind.
We've been through a number of rough times together. I'd tell ya about it, but... I'm running out of time.
If... If only I had an arm...
Then I could have...hugged...him...

Upon hearing an old lady from the village caught a cold, I immediately collected my medicinal herbs with some boiled water, and rushed out from the library. I nursed her and remained by her side until her symptoms calmed down. She was extremely grateful for it.

I read a picture book to a group of children from the village. It was of an old tale about a brave, courageous man who triumphs over evil. I watched their expressions alternated between joy to sorrow to the story's pacing. I'm glad they enjoyed it.

Devola and I performed a song for the people at the village tavern. In addition to the regulars who drank there, elders and children were part of the audience. At the end of our song, the entire crowd smiled and cheered.

Every day Devola and I have been staying late at the library thinking of a plan to make life easier for the villagers. They're indispensable "vessels" for the project, so we need to do what we can for them.

I craved it. Blind violence and blood-thirsty carnage. And I found it. I finally found it. A vessel stained with anger and hatred, seeking vengeance for the murder of her parents. I possessed that woman and gave her "power."

That power turned the woman into a beast. One swing of her blade was enough to cut through stone and her grazes healed in an instant. She began downing every foe before her in the name of vengeance. I was delighted to witness the fruition of my desires.

The woman's destruction didn't end there. After having her revenge, she continued to exert her "power" for the sake of her friends. Along her journey, her anger and hatred showed signs of waning, however, I gave it no thought. All I desired was to continue bathing in her bloodshed.

Because her body has reached its limit, her power has lost control. Still, in the midst of the clashing of blades, I could feel her desire to protect her friends. Yes, this is the violence and carnage I crave. But why is it deplorable and empty?

I was in a dimly lit cabin when I met a kind man.
He taught me how to write a letter.
What should I write on a blank piece of paper...?
――――――――――――――――――――――――――――



――――――――――――――――――――――――――――

Apparently, a letter should start off with the name of the person you want to give it to.
Of course, I'd want it to be his.
I hope he'll be able to read my sloppy handwriting...
――――――――――――――――――――――――――――
　　Hans


――――――――――――――――――――――――――――

At the end of the letter should be the name of the person who wrote it.
Of course, that would be the name he gave me.
Is it odd my chest feels warm writing it...?
――――――――――――――――――――――――――――
　　Hans

　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　Luiz
――――――――――――――――――――――――――――

And in-between these two names, I'm supposed to write how I feel.
And tell him what I want the most.
I wonder if he'll be happy to receive this...?

――――――――――――――――――――――――――――
　　Hans, Thank you　Thank you　Thank you
Thank you　Thank you　Thank you　Thank you
　Thank you　Thank you. Luiz
――――――――――――――――――――――――――――

This here is a magical dagger. Strong and tough! You can carry it anywhere, and for a reasonable price!
How 'bout it, Mister? Would you like to buy one?
Huh? Me? A bad salesman?
C'mon...

This magical dagger was forged by old man Hee Hee!
He was the greatest blacksmith.
Isn't it just beautiful? It hardly looks half a century old!
What? It needs more prestige?
I guess old man Hee Hee alone doesn't cut it...

This is a magical dagger made by old man Hee Hee's wife's grandmother!
Well? A magnificent decoration, don't you think?
Huh? Still not enough prestige?
How much further do I need to go?

This is a magical dagger forged by old man Hee Hee's wife's grandmother's brother's son's daughter's boyfriend!\nHow 'bout it, Mister? Would you like to buy one?\nThe hell with you! You're just pulling my leg!

My father was once a great sage.
They say a great celestial explosion is what created this world.
Possessing a staff with a fragment of the explosion at its core, he was revered as a savior.
But now he is locked away in some prison, and no one knows where he is.

The sage failed to recite the stars and complained that the world was headed towards destruction.
And because of this, they say he became a sinner for causing a stir in the world.
I wondered if maybe I can save my father.
So I turned to all sorts of crimes in search of him.
I was jailed, and escaped from many prisons across the country, until the day I finally met him.

His eyes were hollow, muttering the same words over and over.
There was no sign of my father left.
Giving up, I decided to escape the prison.
That night my father turned to me and said, "A new savior will appear."
That was the last time I ever saw him.

I snuck into the royal palace for the mage's staff.
When I finally found it, the celestial glow that had long faded away lit up again.
A new savior had been born. I would never forgive this world for ruining my father.
The destruction of the world the wise sage spoke of was just beginning.
It caught us by surprise when he stabbed his own family.\nIt was an act of childhood grudge that rushed to the surface in a single emotional outburst...

Once on the battlefield, he loaded his gun and shot his way through the onrushing enemy. But then he wounded up alone. The enemy soldiers were closing in on him and he was out of ammunition. Just as he was about to be killed, he sunk the spear point of his gun into the enemy. He wouldn't have made it out alive if it weren't for that gun.

When he came back home, he had almost forgotten about those bloody days on the battlefield. But then he stabbed them: his family.\nUnbeknownst too him, one of his relatives had also once killed a man. It was an unavoidable act of poverty, but the Holy One brought justice to the deed, using the hand of whom had blessed them.
Holy blessings never come for free...

Kneel down and rest your ear upon it.
You can hear a sound echoing deep within the earth.
It's the earth singing.
The shuddering of stone.
The words of our ancestors from ancient times.

Be barefoot and mindless.
Allow your heels to tread the ground and your toes grasp the mud.
Stand tall and let your steps be heard.
The earth, where all living things have fallen and met.
Listen to the trebles of the past.

Our ancestors are speaking, the past is shouting.
Live, survive, keep on living.
Don't be like us, don't follow us.
Don't be a rock, stone, dirt, or mud.
Life shines only when it's alive.

Every past is a loss to living.
History cries its desire to live towards the future.
Dear ancestors of the past—clods of earth.
The present is fed by the echoes of vindictiveness.
The past's greatness is but the past.

[Wise Sorcerer]
Are you okay, boy? I'm glad my magic made it in time.
What? You want to get back at those robbers?
No, there's no point in it.
[Wise Sorcerer]\nIf I won't help, then I need to report them?\nNo, what I'm saying is, those who conduct evil deeds weren't created properly by God in the first place.

[Wise Sorcerer]\nEarth has prospered further than God's expectations. As such, it became impossible to manage and inferior products got mixed in the process.\nI have no problem killing robbers. Given time, they will be long forgotten.

[Report to Lord Michael]\n....The young man who gave his report was immediately expunged, each record of him carefully erased.\nIt seems that someone in the human realm is beginning to see through our negligence. Immediate action must be taken.

Welcome! Come on in! Are you selling this here instrument?
You don't play it anymore?
Oh, it's your dead wife's...
You might wanna reconsider selling it then.
Well, I do have this one story...

One day a man came in to sell his instrument.
He said it belonged to his dead brother.
The strings were broken and no one laid a hand on it.
But he said he could always hear a sound coming from it.
So I told him I'd fix 'er right up.

I'm not going out on a limb saying the dead wanna play, but I'm sure there's someone out there who'd like to hear it.
So after repairing it, the man told me, "the sound stopped."
But after a few days, he heard it again.
Do you have an idea why that is?

Because he got lonely. He missed hearing it.
So this time, he was the one who picked it up and played it.
Now, are you sure you wanna sell yours?
...I see. Come and see me again when you want to sell it.
I'll offer you a good price for it.
So much to eat ♪\nI know! How about some yummy, cough-curing fried shaman fish?!
So much to eat ♪\nOoh! I'd like a pot of shark fin stew!
So much to eat ♪\nBut wait! A mountain of pancakes made from eagle eggs sounds delish!
So much to eat ♪\nI want a whole roasted boar!\nI hope we're rewarded with something juicy! Collecting these materials is hard work!

Clink. Clink. Clink.
The scraping of metal, chain mail swaying.
The knight pushes forward into battle, all for the sake of the motherland.
Clink. Clink. Clink. Clink.

Thud. Thud. Thud.
The sound of iron piercing flesh, cracking of steel against bone.
The knight decimates its enemies, all for the sake of the motherland.
Thud. Thud. Thud. Thud.

Skret. Skret. Skret.
The rattle of hauled loot, children returning home.
The knight welcomes his new family, all for the sake of the motherland.
Skret. Skret. Skret. Skret.

Clank. Clank. Clank.
All for the sake for the sake of the motherland. The motherland.
Clank. Clank. Clank. Clank.
No. The motherland means nothing to that knight now.
Clank. Clank. Clank. Clank. Clank. Clank.
Clank. Clank. Clank. Clank. Clank. Clank.
All for the sake of the motherland. The motherland.
Clank. Clank. Clank. Clank.
It's the silk of fate.\nKnowing you, I shall begin living a life of truth.
It's the forbidden fruit.\nProtecting you, I shall sink into wisdom's abyss.
Those are the flames of anxiety.\nThinking of you, I shall endure eternity's darkness.
That is a reunion of bitter tears.\nWho are they? Why is it not me who's besides you?

A villainous king, misgoverning politics, and a country unsettled.\nThe younger patriot prince offers wine to his older brother at the banquet, as he gently admonishes him. But his words fall on deaf ears.\nSo with the sword hidden in his cloak, the prince sighs inwardly as he murders his brother.

Having lost her husband, the indignant queen flees to a neighboring country.\nThe neighboring country began an invasion, later called the "funeral battle."\nThe patriot prince takes a seat in the ceasefire negotiations along with the queen, who stabs him to death with a hidden dagger.

A prince but five years old becomes the new king, and his guardian queen becomes the de facto supreme authority.\nWhile the queen is at ease in her room, her maid appears and slices the queen's throat with a hidden dagger.\nShe, who had been the mistress to deceased patriot prince, has avenged his death. And now, she stabs herself in her throat, choosing to die.

The savage clans who'd been suppressed by the villainous king's skill in battle, chose their time to attack. The child king was frightened and offered to surrender.\nThey refused his surrender, burning the royal capital and all its citizens.\nExperts claim to this day... "Wouldn't the bloodshed have been avoided if the young patriot had just kept his sword in his pocket?"
A certain shepherd lived on the scenic hill.\nWithout a family, he hired a few quiet but hardworking servants to take care of the sheep.
