The shepherd was very kind and gentle.\nA merchant who often traveled by the pasture once said of him...\n"No matter what happens, that man never jumps to anger, never raises his voice, and never gets highhanded with anyone. That's a rare person nowadays."

One day, an aggressive war broke out between neighboring countries, and people burned out of house and home evacuated near the hill. The shepherd warmly accepted them.\n"You must've had it so hard. Now then, just take it easy and rest here."

The next morning, the shepherd and the servants grinned as they tied up the people with ropes to be sold to slave traders pretending to be merchants.\nIndeed, he was both a shepherd and an evil wolf in sheep's clothing.
At first I wasn't excited about it, but before I knew it,\nI realized I was enjoying myself.\nAnd it's all thanks to everyone being here with me... I'm sure.
I don't like how getting sweaty makes the yukata stick to me.\nBut I didn't notice because I was too focused on my aim.
The welcoming flame main event was a more beautiful sight than I could've imagined.\nBut for some reason...it made me feel just a little sad.
Time flies when you're having fun.\n"Now that I think about it, we didn't take any pictures together..."\nIt came to mind suddenly, and I felt a little pang in my chest.
I know, on that day I thought...\nCould this be a dream?\nThen surely the time will come when I'll have to wake up.
If it's fate to eventually disappear...\nIt's not wrong to give in to the pleasure you feel in this moment.
I thought that food stalls and such were trivial.\nI never thought my values could change like that at such a time...
This world is filled with beautiful things unknown to me... I forced to realize it by the tears of the girl who touched me in the end.
If I'm with my dear brother,\nI'm happy even in the pouring rain.
If I'm with my dear brother,\nI don't fear any pain.
If I'm in my dear brother's memory,\nthat's enough to satisfy me. At least, that's what I thought...
But it's not so bad really. To disappear while being watched over by someone else. Someone other than my dear brother.
I'd been waiting and waiting\nfor this day to come.
And finally my wish comes true.\nIt's the very first and very last festival,\nso I'm going to have fun till I drop!
But the festival won't last forever.\nThe end will come sometime.\nBut I won't lose to that! I'm aiming to hit all the stalls!
Thank you, Alice.\nI made some good memories at last.\nWe'll keep being friends to the end!
That snow illusion magic you use is incredible! It brought me such joy to see the scenery of my homeland!\nI spent my life without a single hope at the demon army's prison camp, but then hope arose!
You've shown the other prisoners all sorts of sights from their homelands too, you say?\nI see, I see! I'm sure they're so glad, as am I! I hope you'll show me my home again before long!

What's that you say? You even showed the demon army what our homelands look like?
Come on now! That's not right!
Are you on their side then?
Or is it...that they threatened to hurt you?

It's a shock that we prisoners, despite having lost our souls, united to break out of the prison and take over the camp.\nBut it's a pity that your life was taken by a flying arrow.\nSurely this day will be known throughout the ages as the day the Blossom Ice Hammer fell...

Hey, what's the big idea?
I heard you got a pickaxe of your own and joined the miners in their mining.
But what's gotten into you now? You spend all day spaced out.
Where did your passion go?

What now? The volcano shifted, and the metal settled in the ground for a better lode, huh? So we should take our time and wait, you say?\nListen, here! I only invested in this venture because you were willing to take a high risk for a high reward!

If you won't work, I'll withdraw my funding and seize your assets!
...Yeah? What'll you do then?
What do you mean I'll get that water pitcher over your dead body?
——Hey, you two! If you're gonna fight, go all out. Let's see some spirit!

This water pitcher is strange. When I look at it, I get so calm.\nAlmost as if, I could just sit back and wait for the metal to finish settling and make a nice lode.\nMaybe I'll even give up the investment gamble and switch to a steady, profitable business...
After smashing and slaughtering its prey, the club summoned an unprecedented cold wind to the land.
A sorrowful wind, as if to mourn its victims.
And the wind blew through the desolate land for many years.
Called long ago to blow through the final scenes of a massacre, it continues to chill the air to this day.

The symbol of beauty is the rose, and the symbol of hideousness is the frog.
And the good news is that no one has seen a frog for years now!
Oh, what a splendid thing that is!
The rain of bullets by the hitman was a rueful comfort indeed...
Hmph. The crack-shot gunman, suited to the scent of roses, shall die here, I suppose...

Crawling out of the soil with a swish, I thought desperately through a foggy mind.
How odd. I, suited to the scent of roses, should've been shot dead. And yet...
A figure slipped into view, and gave me a scare.
It was too awful to speak it aloud, but it could only be described as a frog man!

I lay collapsed on the ground when the frog man said...
"Oh, good! You were terribly injured, so I planted a...seed to put you to sleep."
"What? What are you saying? Who are you anyway?"
"As you can see, I am a species of frog. In our long hibernation, we were blessed with God's will and waited for the time to become rulers of the whole world."

"That's absurd! You'd never be rulers even in 100 years!"
"Says the man who slept for 100 years. Every living creature is a frog now. And yes, that means you too."
I was stunned to see myself in the hand mirror that the frog man had taken out.
Instead of a beautiful, rose-scented young man, I found an ugly frog man in my reflection.
With a dreadful croak, I quickly hopped away...

[Mysterious Youth]
Are you meeting someone at this beach?
I see! You were hoping to catch the maestro of that famous orchestra and become his apprentice.
Indeed, he often takes his walks here.

[Mysterious Youth]
But you should think twice!
It's hard to be a success in music. It's not enough to just love it.
And you may be confident in your skills, but that's not all it takes.

[Mysterious Youth]
Oh, I had no idea! To think you could win such accolades despite being so young!
Still, I dare to say that you should quit now.
Even if you have talent, it won't do here.

[Haggard Man]
I never thought that maestro would only use someone who would allow him a physical relationship.
 The one who warned me must've been used as a plaything too.
Oh, that I could wash away this filthy body and soul into the sea...
In ancient times, even before humans appeared on the surface, the spear has been thrust into a body.
The land where it was lain was submerged, and a deep sea city was established there at the bottom of the ocean.
But it was undying. And since that time, it continued to sleep within the underwater city.
Someday, when the spear is pulled out of the resting body, it shall awaken and bring ruin to the world...

Come one, come all!\nBe they King Arthur's knights of the round table, Nobunaga the shadowlord, or Jeanne the saint... Great heroes have gathered like glittering stars!\nAll aboard for the mainland to restore peace unto the world!

One may ask...
"Why are we here? Who are we fighting?"
And one may answer...
"Lest we forget that we were driven here! There will be no tomorrow unless we defeat those who deny our existence."

Another may say...
"If so, pray tell, from what were we born?"
The names of their fathers and mothers are put forth, but...
"Do they really exist in flesh and blood? If so, what of us who were born from such?"

Behold, boys and girls.
In despair of the people, God descended to command the world and burned all its tales at this water's cape.
When you stand here, you can see a ship in the waves.
A ghost ship carrying heroes whose legends have been passed down for thousands of years in history.

This one? Looks like a toy, right?
Actually, it seems that it was developed by a child who intended for it to be a toy.
Well, I should say, it's the "Ultimate Gun" that he thought up.
It shoots foam the liquid loaded in the cartridge.
You can keep shooting until it hits the target.

And listen to this. The father who was an inventor
started selling it as a weapon instead of a toy.
Everyone around made fun of him at first.
I mean, can you really use something like that?
But in fact, this was a fearsome weapon.

The liquid in the cartridge can be anything you like.
Aqua regalis, acid, venom—whatever! Thanks to that, it's highly lethal.
So it eventually came to be used for war.
It's been designated as an inhumane weapon because of the number of lives it's taken.

The father seems to have commercialized it to give his child a good life.
But having been accused of developing an inhumane weapon, the child died by the gun. His father's dream burst like a bubble.
What's more, the gun was simplified shortly after that,
and now it's just a toy.

Only thanks to the desire for knowledge that humans have seeded inside them, we writers can eat.
In the countryside where I came to the interview this time, it seems that the two authorities in the medical world are arguing against each other.
One is rich and the other is extremely poor, but how did the difference come about?
I'm going to expose everything!

I've heard stories about it in nearby rural areas, but the poor doctor wasn't very well received.\nAn old man stubborn and snobby about everything, and he didn't take opinions from others at all.\nWhen it came to the rich doctor, I heard so many praises it made me sick.

I stayed at a hotel that was reasonably priced and drafted a book.
Suddenly, I felt nauseated.
I emptied the entirety of my stomach  onto the floor. A servant ran in to find me squirming about.
But he makes no move to help. Just stands by and watches.
Hey! Why are you just standing there dawdling?

[Rich Doctor]
What's this? Not a spy from some institution, but a writer?
In that case, there's still the risk of leaking information.
I can't let anyone know that stubborn old doc is innocent, and I'm the one placating the people by doing everything including corpse disposal for the right price.
Remove the organs and dispose of the flesh. And don't forget that book too.

The ocean as far as the eye can see. The reverberation of the waves.\n...A stylish house on the beach. A place of peace just for me. And then one day, a man appeared and said matter-of-factly, "I will stay here."

Naturally, I refused the unscrupulous declaration.\nBut the man paid me no mind and settled in the vacant room.\nHowever, as we shared a roof, ate together, and talked with each other, he seemed less distant to me.

Eventually, I came to realize that he has a warm heart. Only that he can't express his intentions well in words.\nAt some point, when I had relented my heart to him, I made a confession.\nI confessed to being a spy, collecting confidential information about this country.

He sighed.
"Let us both tell the truth. You categorically denied all allegations of espionage brought to you, and even gave our torture experts some grief."
"I used magic to create this virtual world, extracted your spirit into it. You are no longer of any use.”
He squeezed the trigger of the gun...

There was once a King who loved sanguine beauty and treasured rubies above all, and came to be called the Ruby King. His people rebelled against his cruel tax regimen, defeating the knights and surrounding his palace. Trapped, he turned to forbidden magic to save himself.

Unable to find the King anywhere in his palace, the peasant army breathed a sigh of relief, thinking him fled. Just then, they noticed the single sword that lay fallen below the vacant throne. It drew the eye of one of the men, who exclaimed at its exquisite beauty!

In a moment the group of them all stood transfixed, eyes glittering with greedy desire as they surged forward to crowd around the sword.\n\n...They made quite a sordid spectacle, and the Ruby King, who'd transformed himself into the sword looked on it with haughty derision as he willed them to fight each other for the sword, to fight until all was washed clean in blood!

Then, a bellowing call cut through the group as the captain rallied her men.\n\n"Look at yourselves," she shouted, "Are we as foolish and weak as the hated King, to lose our heads over this ruby trinket?!" Hefting her warhammer, she brought it down on the jeweled blade, shattering it...

I'm a celebrated escape artist. Now, I'm sure the security in Hell is top notch stuff, but listen—there's no place on any plane of existence that I can't break myself out of. Hm? What the hell is this place? There's no warden! There's no guards...!

Hey hey hey, wait just a minute, how do they keep people from escaping, then? It's like they're just inviting people to run away! Huh? A winged lion...? I don't see anything like that...\n\nWell, whatever, I'm just gonna get out of here.

If I get through those gates, I'll be home free.

Except...now that I have gotten through them, there really is a winged lion. In an instant, I'm surrounded by flame, burning, burning, but never dying...

Hell's inmates cowered and trembled as the demons set up a great, echoing howl.

The warden looked on, smirking at the man's torment. He always enjoyed this moment the best. The instant of hopeless realization. Flexing his mind, he reached out to the tormented soul, stripping away the memories of his 'escape,' and settling in to watch the man's next, hopeless attempt.

Oh, King! Congratulations on the roaring success of the expedition to the Ice Kingdom! I am honored you've called on me to attend you after being wounded by arrows, as it seems your wounds were made by the Everfrost Crossbow.

Those shot by the Everfrost Crossbow will find their base body temperature gradually dropping, and their skin beginning to ice over. After a few months, they become naught but ice sculptures. It's a weapon that inflicts a terrifying curse, indeed!
But, oh, wise king! Please do be reassured! I'll boil you a tincture that has truly unprecedented healing properties. It's just...the ingredients are quite rare, so I am afraid it won't be cheap...

Well, I never! Our oh-so-wise king doesn't nearly live up to his reputation!\n\nGH...! Wh-What...?! Where did that bolt come from? Wh-...Why is it so cold... Why does the ice creep across my skin...?!
My wedding date is past, and now a new life is growing! Hehe... I wonder if it's going to be a boy or a girl!

People though, I never did have much use for other people. I've wed myself to dark magic itself! But...it really was worth it—all the passion I spent, it let me get my hands on the mysteries of transformation magic.
I can make myself into a lot of different animals but the peacock is my favorite! I've never exactly been the type to draw eyes when I go out, so being so striking is a refreshing change.

And when I spread my lovely tail, well, I was pretty popular with the peahens, let me just say. That's right. They all wanted a piece of my peacock spear, if ya know what I mean! I'm just fascinated to see what those eggs will be when they hatch!

The Good Husband:\nThe child we were blessed with was spirited away mere moments after being born, cradle and all. At the time it was a terrible shock, and my wife and I lived each day in tearful sorrow.

The Good Husband:\nHowever, now I think of things differently. No matter how much we sorrow and suffer, our child won't return. And, surely, being carried off by fae is not so terrible a fate. Surely our child will live their life in freedom.

The Good Husband:\nThen, one afternoon, I began to build a bower in secret, without telling my wife. I found a hidden spot and dug the foundations, and...huh? I...discovered a cradle buried there. What...what does...does this mean...?

The Evil Wife:\nWhew, that was close. I'm glad I managed to get rid of the brat before my husband suspected anything. He'd've definitely figured out the kid wasn't his, eventually. I probably shouldn't wait too much longer to start my new life as a widow, either. At least he's probably still got his guard down...
Duchess:\nThat countess, brimming with wit and beauty...oh, how I hate her so! With her father, the shrewd earl away for the moment, now's my chance to saddle her with the scandal of the century!
Duchess:\nTch! I tried to embarrass her in conversation on literature, but she easily deflected my statements...\nSurely she's inherited that sharp mind from the earl. Oh! I truly do hate her!

Duchess:\nI've finally found her weak point! She nearly died as a child after being attacked by a dog, so I'll simply make sure to bring a dog to our next tea party! She's sure to embarrass herself terribly in her panic!

The Earl's Unyielding Heart:\nI ensured that the dog the young duchess had secured for this plot would be keen to the scent of her own perfume. Should she go forward with her plan, she is likely to suffer a most unfortunate attack during the tea party. It was the earl's will, that in his absences his butler should watch over the household, and see that no harm came to his daughter.

On such a perfect moonlit night, it is lovely to see the moon reflected in still water.\n\nHurrying home would put the most awful damper on such a wonderful night. Why don't we take our time on the walk back, and take in all the beauty of nature?

I let out a cry like a broken bell when I see her...\n\nLit up by the moonlight, a singer beautiful enough to make my heart do somersaults, standing in the reeds near the shore and practicing her singing with a devilish smile.

My heart is racing, running ahead of me, and I stifle a gasp...\n\nThere's a man and a woman concealed in the tall reads, and nearby the conductor of a popular orchestra lies prone, her breathing ragged.

On such a perfect moonlit night, it is lovely to see the moon reflected in still water.\n\nBut the moon, she's not nearly as lovely up close as humans tend to believe. I think about that for a long time, as I make my way home.

Once a parent and child found a bottle while combing the beach. The father opened it, only to find it was empty. Bored and disappointed, he made to cast it aside, but his child bade him stop, exclaiming that waves were trapped within.

When the child listened to the opening of the bottle, they heard the shushing sound of the waves. They loved the bottle very much, and believed it remembered the sounds of the ocean waves. The father chuckled indulgently.

Every day the child carried the bottle down to the sea, to let it remember more of the ocean. Today however, they found terrible weather upon arriving at the shore. The waves were high, and the small child was overwhelmed by their ferocity. Eyes shut, they raised the bottle to an ear and called back the usual, calm sea. When they opened their eyes, so it was.

Or, so it was for the child. Everywhere else the rain came down in driving, diagonal sheets, and the waves rose to towering heights, and the wind roared fiercely. The nearby town was devastated by the hurricane, but all around the child the sea was calm and still, for the calm sea loved the child as much as the child loved it in return.

In a certain country, in a certain castle, there was a certain tome engulfed in roaring flame. No one knew who had written it, or even what precisely was written in it, if anything. How could they? No one could touch the damn thing.

The people of the country loved to tell tales about it. Some said it recorded a method of obtaining eternal life. One say that if you read it, you'll come into possession of a great treasure. The tales grow grander with each telling, spreading as if scattered by the wind, until they drift all the way to the king in his castle.

One day, the king issues a proclamation, offering to grant the book to whoever is able to touch it without harm. The citizens crowd into the castle, looking to try their luck, scrambling to be the first to lay hands on the book. They didn't stop, even as the flames threatened to scorch away their hands. The king's expression twisted in disdain as he saw his people made so ugly by their own overriding greed.

An awful odor began to pervade the castle and the king had the book dumped into the baths, eager to be rid of the whole thing.

Sadly, one mustn't try to put out an oil fire with water.

The fire spread, until the castle, nay, the country itself was nothing but an endless plain of fire. It seems that there had no longer been anyone left who recalled the tome's true purpose: a vessel to contain the country's calamitous wildfires.

He had great courage, a true master of his craft, even when forced to use his magic, and was feared as a Demon Knight by others. Why exactly did they fear him? Because, of course, of the gun he wore at his hip.\n\nIt was said that anyone struck with one of the magic-infused bullets fired by this gun would have their soul destroyed, and live on as a crippled, empty husk.

Now, the Demon Knight had a lifelong nemesis, a Holy Knight, with whom he clashed often. She had for herself blessed weapons and armor to make herself strong against him, and rode forth to settle things with the Demon Knight once and for all. Their swords clashed together, whirling in a fierce and unending dance of blades. It was a grueling battle, but as it progressed the Holy Knight's superior training began to win out.

The Demon Knight sensed his disadvantage and leapt back, withdrawing from the melee even as his hand sought the gun at his belt.\n"What do you think that will get you?" the Holy Knight shouted after him, laughter in her voice. She knew the Demon knight's magic was hardly that strong, and trusted in the blessed metal of her armor to protect her.

The smile on the Demon Knight's face grew savage as he pulled the trigger, and the Holy Knight's own smile faltered, as she began to doubt if perhaps the man had been concealing his power, such confidence he showed. He practically shouted with laughter, and the Holy Knight broke an fled.\n\nHis laughter quieted, until it was a smug, private thing as he patted his gun. It was a spectacular weapon, which beset its victims with illusions conjured from their own fears, and it had never failed him yet.
Once a tiny circus troupe suffered a tragedy. The prop sword used by one of the acrobats was switched out with a real one, and the acrobat was mortally wounded during juggling practice.

"How could an accident like this could happen..." \nthe young man who is the Circus' beast tamer shakes his head mournfully at the officer questioning him.\nIn the end, the officers conclude it was simply mismanaged props, a tragic accident, as they solemnly look out over the crowd for the evening service.

"Behold, the amazing white tiger!" The tiger in question leaps from the stage, rampaging, and although the young beast tamer is able to stop it, his trusty performance partner of so many years maims and mangles one of his hands.

"I see... someone coated it with a drug to agitate him..." \nThe  young man stands in the middle of the pandemonium, examining the whip used in his act, before succumbing to blood loss.\nIt seems that the beast tamer and acrobat, grown estranged from one another, had each tampered with the other's prop, and in ensuring the death of their target, ensured the death of the circus troupe itself.

The Phantomhive butler rose early, busying himself with preparations for the day. It's nearly time to wake the master of the house...Ciel. Having prepared Ciel's morning tea, Sebastian walks down the hallway. His heart swells with memories of the young Earl.

Presented with a strawberry tart just a bit different than the one served the night before, Sebastian had said to Ciel: "Do you really hate losing that much?" He'd huffed an exasperated laugh, to which Ciel returned: "Between the two of us, I believe that criticism is more apt in your case."

Sebastian set up the garden to host the afternoon tea. Ribbons, lace, and flower arrangements... he wanted to create a special atmosphere for today. A certain young Lady had been invited to grace the manor with her smile, after all.

Elizabeth sat delightedly stuffing herself with sweets, while a long-suffering Ciel looked on. "Satisfied now?" he asked. Sebastian stood quietly by his side, carefully refilling both of their teacups. His lips revealed the barest hint of a smile.

It seems there are strange puppets with wills of their own in England, these days. Undertaker was quite interested in these rumors, for his research on the soul. The issue called for some hands-on investigation.\n\nHis inquiries turned up an interesting tidbit: the puppets' owner had invited Ciel Phantomhive over for tea.

He was curious, how would the Earl react, once he'd met the Baron and his two butlers? And to Undertaker, with his connection to the Phantomhive household, the only thing he could do for now was watch.

That night. Sebastian had managed to call Ciel back after the baron had turned his master into another puppet. Undertaker watched from the shadows, relieved that Ciel was unharmed, but the strange puppets he'd heard so much of saw how easily the plot had crumbled and merely laughed in their unseemly voices.

Dawn came, as if to wrap up the entire incident. With the Baron's defeat, the puppets had also made themselves scarce. Perhaps that only meant they'd gotten what they wanted.\n\n For his part, Undertaker turned home with a satisfied smile happy to have seen such intriguing things that night.

Her rapiers glint in the morning light as she stands in the gardens of the Midford Estate. She'd been seen, the day before in the baron's manor. By far too many eyes. True, she'd been so glad to see Ciel again after too long apart, but...

The smooth chiffon of her skirts billows out over her panniers. She has any number of cute ensembles tucked away in her closets, and has just settled on one for the day after long deliberation, when... She receives a missive from the Phantomhive manor.

"Ciel's invited me to afternoon tea!" Elizabeth set out for the Phantomhive estate at once, delighted to see the garden had been adorned with cute decorations. She found herself automatically stepping a bit lightly, in this specially prepared space.

The moment he bit into Sebastian's homemade tart, his lips curved in a smile that made her own lips follow suit. When their eyes met, it was if nothing at all had happened the day before. Ciel's expression was just as it usually was, but somehow... \n\nThat day, the two of them enjoyed a peaceful happy afternoon together.

As a member of the Grim Reaper Staffing Association, Grell was always put upon, expected to do many tiresome tasks day in and day out. Today, however, she stepped lightly, buoyed by the sense that a demon awaited at the site of her latest dispatch. Quite a demon, at that.

When she arrived at the manor, all of the butlers, including Sebastian, were engaged in a confection contest of some sort. More surprisingly, the other two butlers (she'd never even seen them before) seemed like they might actually be a match for Sebastian's skill. Were they even human?

Ciel and his party ate their fill of the completed sweets. In the general bustle of the moment, Grell caught Sebastian slipping a key from the Baron's breast pocket. She felt a thrill course through her body at Sebastian's nimble fingers and the sharpness of his personality.

That night, Sebastian set out alone to investigate the mansion.

"Now's our chance for a little alone time!" 

Just as Grell was about to leap towards him, Undertaker and Hamelin called out to her, entirely ruining the mood and throwing a damper on her plans. Reluctantly, she joined them, watching to see where Sebastian would go next.

The diminutive master of the Phantomhive estate casually reaches for his gun as memories of the previous night surface. After that night, not a single bullet remains in the gun.

"...Young master, a moment?"

He looks up at the sound of a light rap on the door.

As the door opens, a delicate aroma wafts into the room. It seems his butler has prepared a freshly baked cake, even at this early hour. 

"Would you like to take afternoon tea with Lady Elizabeth?"

As he said it, Ciel noticed it wasn't cake at all.

Elegantly displayed in the center of the plate, was a slice of strawberry tart. He recalled the butlers in the Baron's manor, and their nearly superhuman skill. He set the gun down on the top of the desk, the sound sharp. In place of the weapon, he reached to pick up the fork.

His fiance arrived, her invitation to tea clutched in one hand, eyes lighting up like sunlight the moment she saw him. Between pleasant conversation with Lizzie, and the delicious cake prepared by Sebastian, the afternoon flew by in a pleasant blur. The peaceful interlude couldn't help coax a smile from his lips.

Snow White infiltrated the estate with Aladdin, looking for the strange puppets from the rumors. The Baron didn't mind paying for skilled help, and they'd been able to get into the mansion with no problems. And really, what is a butler, anyway? She frets, feeling as if she ought to have prepared better.

She walks the vast interior of the mansion's halls, keeping up the pretense of her work as a butler, even as she gathers information on the puppets. For some reason, her wanderings seem to have lead her to the drawing room. It's coated with dust, so she decides to start with cleaning.

A few hours later... The room is sparkling and clean, surprising even the Baron. As he thanks her for her hard work, she tells him it's merely her duty as a butler... and feels a small burst of sympathy, her own belief resonating with the act of a butler offering their services freely to their master.

A few days later. The Baron sits in his study, composing a letter. Having heard a certain talented young Earl is back in the country, he's eager to extend and invitation. (Snow is less than pleased. This will get in the way of the investigation)\n\nShe tenses, minutely, mind turning over this unexpected development.

Man:\nOh, is that a little bat, lurking there? Wait...! I'm not going to hurt you. I've just gotten caught in an evening shower while I was out hunting, that's all. I'll leave your cave before too long, but why don't we chat while I wait out the rain?

Man:\nI was a terror to that household, you know? I extorted the husband and coerced the wife, and drove their child to suicide. I destroyed them, and I lived in rich comfort off of the profit from it.

Man:\nWell, rich and comfortable it might have been, but that unhealthy lifestyle came back to bite me. My liver's basically toast. I'll keel over dead if I have so much as one drink. Buuut I guess I can't complain, since I get to eat whatever delicacies I like and spend everyday in the company of beautiful women.\nWell, looks like the rain's letting up. I should get going.
Great Mage:\nWell, my son, did your transformation practice go well? Hm? You want me to teach you a spell for turning water into wine? Er, sure. I don't get it, but I can teach you that if you want!

Once, a young mage inherited a stave from his late grandfather. It was a fussy little thing.

...It's not good to overdo it, to lose yourself in the study of magic.
...You should eat something more nutritious.

The stave's constant murmuring weighed on the boy's mind.

...Go to sleep. It's way past your bedtime.
...You've gotten the formula wrong, you need to read up on potions.

One day, the boy could no longer stand the stave's constant murmuring, and threw it against the wall as hard as he could. Although it was made of metal, it shattered into dust.

It was quiet, at long last. The boy returned to his studies, but became too absorbed in his work, collapsing from exhaustion. In his delirium, he dreamed he saw his late grandfather. The old man had always scolded him...\n\nThe stave had been his last gift, the final loving act of a grandfather worried for his sickly, anemic grandson.

The fortunate boy was saved by a lucky visit from his friends, and threw himself into his studies anew afterwards, hoping to find a way to repair the stave. This time, however, he made sure to do so in a way that wouldn't get him scolded, when he reunited with the stave, the one promise he'd made his grandfather.

To throw yourself into battle, washing away blood with blood, fighting until only one person remains. It's a true battle 'Royal,' as twelve people fight for the right to the monarchy. Take your sword in hand and fight bravely!

I swung my sword in a wide arc, aiming it down at my opponent's skull and scattering their blood across the ground. One more down. There are still plenty of foes standing between me and the throne, however, so my fight continues.

I get behind them and drive my blade through their torso. Blood pours out of the wound as the final enemy falls and the cheering of the crowd surrounds the victor. Surrounds me. A voice rings out, telling me to take my crown.

The boy shot upright, drooling as he moaned, "Moooom, I'm hungry!"\n\nHe has twelve discreet personalities, and each day when he wakes, a different one is predominant. No one knows of the battle that rages within his mind.
I'm just a plain, simple tailor, but I have a secret.\nMy shop is home to pixies called brownies, and they help me with my work.
Brownies are excellent with a needle, and hard workers. While I sleep, they do work for me. They've allowed me to get ahead in my finances, and I'm very grateful indeed.
Then one day, the brownies told me that hats were going to be huge next year, and that we should make two, no...three times as many hats, to get ready.

The year afterwards, and evil wizard's experiments filled the air with noxious magical fumes inimical to hair. Hats were indeed the next big thing. We made a killing, and I was grateful to the brownies. I was, really. But...seriously guys? Couldn't you have warned me so I could save my hair?

Destruction, Inc. Craftsperson:\nI infiltrated a society of mages. Let us rob them of the magical artifacts they hoard, and use them to fuel the destruction of the world!\nWh-Who are you?! Damn, we've been rumbled!

Destruction, Inc. Craftsperson:\nAugh, how is this happening? Blowing up the lookouts was a good idea but the explosion wasn't supposed to wreck the magical artifact warehouse!\n...The flames are pretty, though. It's like a rainbow!

Destruction, Inc. Craftsperson:\nSeveral executives of the mages' organization appeared, lit from behind by the iridescent flames, shouting us down. I shouted right back but, in the middle of it all...it's the damndest thing, but all of us were laughing. Laughing for joy.

Reporter:\nThe Mage's Association was destroyed in a fire, and many casualties suffered from burns. In an odd turn of events, many of the burn victims were smiling. This may be connected to rumors that the Mage's Association was working on artifacts to bring happiness, and secreting them away in their warehouse.

"The hero drew too close to the gods and the heat scorched his wings, sending him plummeting to earth."\n\nThe youth shook his head at the quaint story of Icarus' legend. He made his own set of wings, out of the same beeswax that Icarus had used...but he couldn't use them to fly.

His mother scolded him. "You mustn't wish for freedom! Such greed won't go unpunished!"

Still, the boy yearned for the sky. His father grew frustrated, cuffing him harshly and locking him in his room.

Even so, the sky still captured his heart.

As civilization progressed, mankind invented their own ways to fly.\nHot air balloons, airplanes, parachutes and gliders...\nInnovation made people rich, and it was no longer regarded as hubris. Even so, that long ago myth inhibited people's dreams. The boy himself never gave up, even in the face of that lie.

That boy, who refused to cast aside his passion for the sky was persecuted and died in ignominy. After losing his son, her grieving parents crafted a bow from their bones. They wanted to make his dream come true. They took up the bow and aimed an arrow directly for the sun, firing. Though he lost all his power, the boy, at the last, did not fall from the sky.

Oh, Holy Seraph, please bestow your blessings on my son! Grant him a pure and uncorrupted heart, let him grow up quick and strong! I am but a poor illiterate farmer. Please let my son grow into a fine man!
Oh, Holy Seraph, my son would like to meet Santa! It's been so difficult convincing him to go to bed. Thank you for helping keep his heart so innocent as he grows!
Oh, Holy Seraph, my son got me the most wonderful cigarette case for a present. He saved up his allowances to get it for me! I truly don't deserve such a wonderful son!

Oh, Holy Seraph, now my son has grown and married, but they haven't been able to have children of their own. His wife believes they need only give it time, but it seems they have only been sleeping together platonically. Perhaps you've given him a heart that's a little bit TOO pure and uncorrupted, Oh Holy Seraph. It seems almost, artificially so.

Can you BELIEVE this?! Why, the absolute GALL of it!\nThere's this "Tome of the Gourmet" thing going around and it's supposed to be some kind of who's who of gourmets but MY name isn't in it. Unbelievable! Me! Who has pride of place as the best damn gourmet on the continent?!

I used every means at my disposal to find the man who edited the Tome of the Gourmet, and gave him a piece of my mind. And that guy, if you can believe it, he just stared at me! Acted like he'd never even heard of me before!

I told him that I knew everything there was to know about the delicacies of the continent! I told him to just try my cooking for himself. Then he'll have to add me to the Tome! He sighed and agreed, acting like he was doing me some kind of favor. Hmph! And that cheeky grin he gave me!

The editor whistled sharply, and several men appeared, restraining and blindfolding me.

"Now," I heard the Editor's voice, "Let's get to the meat of things. Try to guess the age and gender of the first person to get a taste of you..."

Finally grasping the true nature of the Tome of the Gourmet, I shivered in horror.
〇 Penalty Day\nMom told me, she said I have a real mother somewhere. But...she's somewhere else, out there all alone.
△ Penalty Day\nDad told me, he said that Mom was lying. He said Mom's my only mom, but I know the truth. I know that Mom isn't Dad's only wife.
◇ Penalty Day\nA butterfly told me, that's how I know that Dad is lying. My mother is waiting for me. So, I'm going to go find my mother.
× Penalty Day\nSuch a pretty, sparkly red butterfly. Flying around my house. It all burned down. Dad burned, and Mom burned, everything burned. I'm going with the butterfly, to find my mother.

Once, there was a serpent god.\nIt swallowed all the land, and its venom brought death to all. As the symbol of power and fear, it became revered above all other deities in a certain kingdom, a kingdom that went on to take over all the land.

As time passed, the kingdom flourished and its people grew arrogant, wavering in their faith. Invaders came from beyond its borders, and though their numbers were small they slaughtered many of the kingdom's people and forced its submission.

As more and more people moved to live within the kingdom's borders, it changed and flourished even more brightly than before. During this renaissance, the foreign born scholars came to know of the serpent god of old. Haughty, and believing in the superiority of their own pantheon, they researched the serpent god, the better to prove it the lesser divine.

In the beginning, the serpent god had been regarded as a god of healing, who had taken all the world's poison and sickness into itself. After they announced this discovery, the invaders began to fall, struck down one by one. As faith returned to the kingdom, so did the serpent god's power.\n\nIt was only natural the god should seek to eliminate the plague which had laid low its favored kingdom.
Last year was the first time I realized that the Fire-Venom Scorpion Gun's magazine was empty. I reported it to the supervisor, immediately, but was told to leave it be.

It's been little over a year since then, and honestly, it's been a pretty peaceful year.\nThe bullets which typically fill the magazine of the Fire-Venom Scorpion Gun represent the flames of the human world. For it to be empty means that there's been no conflict occurring.
According to the supervisor, we've had about a few centuries of conflict in the last few decades. They've created this period of nothing in order to maintain the balance.

To stop a war on the verge of breaking out, well, the way I figure, it means that all that hostility's still there, just simmering and spreading, right? And that's all happening because someone went and dropped the Fire-Venom Scorpion Gun into a cold, dark crevice somewhere. Someone, being me.
Defendant A:\nConcertmaster, I understand that concealing protoplasm is a serious offense. According to the laws of Harmonium, I ought to be sentenced to dissonance.
Defendant A:\nIn the beginning, there was a single harp, and the sound that spun from it, the notes it created, were the first Score. But who made the Harp? It must have been people, of course!

Defendant A:\nHumans have brought all to ruin with their conflict. Only we, who live on concepts alone were spared. Why should not we, the guardians of the arts, raise up this new humanity we have secretly bred?

Humanity's Final King:\nI sigh heavily, watching as the castle was consumed by flame. I wish the daydream I've just seen will come true in the near future. For a lover of the arts such as myself to have fed the kingdom's musical instruments to the flames...If the new world promised by the Protoplasmic Pyre doesn't come about, I...
We valient dragoons sit aside our beloved dragons and take to the skies. I hope that some day, we'll win great honors, come home hailed as heroes, and maybe even have our own merch.

The people on the ground look up at us and send out a great cheer. We wave back, all of us excited to go into battle. Every one of us thinks we'll defeat a notable foe, and woo one of our adoring fans.

In the midst of it all, one of our fellows collides with a mail bird, and plummets to the ground. It didn't strike him that hard, so he should have been able to avoid such certain death, but his every bone is shattered. He dies in agony.\n\nLet us meet again someday, friend.

As dawn breaks, I leap astride my dragon and take to the sky. Some of my fellows have fallen to their deaths. Who among us actually believes we'll become heroes? Have merch? Ridiculous. I don't know how many times I've taken flight, don't know how many times we've endlessly circled this sliver of space time turned back on itself, don't know how long we've been trapped in this torus.

Ever since I was little I've loved the sky. I've wanted to fly high just like the birds, and to look down on the earth. I'm not a bird, though. I'm a person, and I can't make my arms into wings. But...that's why I'm going to study hard, until I know how to make a balloon.

The balloon I've crafted floats upwards, lightly lofting itself into the sky. I look towards the horizon and the crimson dawn burning itself across the sky. I watch the placid river lazily winding its way to the sea. You could only see these things from the sky, this beautiful landscape unfolding beneath me.

But...although I've got this lovely view in front of me, there's no one next to me that I could share it with. I watch a flock of birds pass me by and glance down at the houses scattered over the land below, tiny as dots. In this moment I feel for the first time that I am human, and that I am alone.

As time passes, my fuel grows low, and the balloon begins to slowly deflate. I can finally go home, I think, as I sink towards the ground. There are people waiting for me there, on the ground. I'll be able to tell them of what I saw and what I thought, up here in the sky. How it made me finally come to love the earth, as well.
There are times when people are tempted by evil spirits, are there not? Well, this is what that was for me. I couldn't think of a new song, you know? It was driving me crazy! So I just...you know.
He was a musician, and never all that popular, but he had great musical sense. Honestly, he made the best songs. That's why I...I mean, I don't know what to say, I just kind of...stole them.

I was planning on spending some money on it, tricking him, you know? But he only assured me he didn't have any issues with money. Soooo...I tossed him into a bonfire and let him burn to death. A tragic accident, really.

What? Burn scars on my back? Weirdly shaped like a person? Quit messing with me! That can't be right. I've seen my own back in a mirror, you know, and there's nothing. But, well...that area does get chills all the time, and I've...I've been getting fevers a lot lately. Every few days actually.\n\nHey. You...you think I'll be fine right? There's nothing wrong...right?
A Flash of the Divine\n――　――　――\nThe Priestess' Glaive was quite sturdy, and of a fine and handsome make. And the Priestess herself was desired by all.

One day, she vanished. It was a strange happening, indeed. All the moreso, for she had told no one where she was going. The next day, another of the temple maids vanished. They were all the servants of god, of course, so people began to say the divine had simply called them back.

And again, the next day, yet another vanished. I began to feel uneasy for the first time. What was happening to the priestesses we all adored so? At length I understood. I realized that there was no god, truly.

Then, in a flash! ...I saw the Priestess swing her glaive, saw her brandish it, point it straight towards me.

No! I can feel my memories twist, my thoughts altered...

No longer remembering the Priestess, it seems to me that all is well. It is simply another normal day. The day after, another one goes missing.
Father:\nMy son's become a recluse, and driven his wife away. He's going to become like me, worthless, just posting up flyers every day. There's no joy in a life like that...

Father:\nWhile I was out posting flyers, I saw a house with a solid black envelope stuffed into its mailbox. I heard someone there died of a heart attack, a few days later. This happened more than once.

Father:\nThe next morning, I opened our own mailbox just like usual, to find a solid black envelope waiting for me. I readied myself for my trip to heaven, and set out to hand out my fliers with a spring in my step...

Son:\nMwahaha. Dad had a heart attack and now I've got my hands on all this life insurance money! Can you believe my luck? With money like this, I won't ever have to leave the house again! It'll be paradise...!
Once upon a time there lived the consul of a the world's oldest nation and a general from a nation grown rich from the trade across the middle sea.\n\nWe crossed swords in battle.

Once, there lived a valiant king who stood on the frontlines as he led his people to recapture the holy land, and a sage renowned for her wisdom and courage, who took to the battlefield as well.\n\nThey, too crossed swords in battle.

Once, there was a philosopher who saw the beauty in death, and a great novelist who believed life and death to be two sides of the same coin.\n\nThey crossed swords on the battlefield of their talents.

In time, planets were lost to ice, returning to nothingness, all of their souls cut free, and the two swords, having cut off that life, having fused themselves inseparably, spread endlessly to fill the cosmos...
Hey. Nice to meet you. I just stopped by to talk to you about your kid. They left this afternoon without saying where they were going, and I'm pretty sure you're both very worried, right?

Well, all's well that ends well, right? So, basically, you don't need to worry. They're in a Fairy Ring, getting the kind of education people normally just can't get. I mean, you remember a little while ago when their grades got so much better all of a sudden, right? That was a shock, wasn't it?

Well, your kid's got something special, that's all, and well, us special people, the loftier people, you know, well...we've got to stick together. So, if you'll just hand over your kid, we'll give you a replacement, just like 'em.

I see. Listen, it really seems like you didn't understand me... Oh, oh, now, don't worry, that's just my glamor working on you. You won't remember a thing about Fairy Rings or anything else of the sort! Just enjoy your peaceful life, with 'your' kid.
Each evening, the Castellan makes me serve him. I'm exhausted come morning, but if I even try to sleep, his club comes flying. Being a servant ain't easy.
The Castellan eats unbelievably huge meals. Well, he was an unbelievably large person, but still. I can't see how he fits it all.
There are a lot of Castellans in this town because there are a lot of castles. Each one of them has a Castellan, and a bunch of servants like me living in it.

Let's say the Castellans are women, and the servants are men.\nA spaceship came and changed them, making the Castellan's large and powerful, and shrinking down the servants. The servants can do nothing but live in fear of their Castellan's cudgel.
It makes me so sad, to have to wear something this revealing. At least, it did at first. I've gotten a little used to it since then.
To think I could ever come to get used to something like this...Isn't that even sadder, somehow?

I'm sure even the people who made outfits like this...those people must have made such cheerful clothes, music and dancing, must have loved those things, just so they could keep from being swallowed by their own sadness.
Light and darkness are two sides of the same coin.\nThe stronger the sorrow, the stronger the joy created in its wake.
Brother....help me.\nIt's so hard to walk in this...\nIf I fell down, I don't think I could stand up again...
Brother...I'm glad this outfit is warm, but...\nIt's really too hot, when I'm indoors, and I can't get out of it on my own.
Brother...I think I found one good thing about this outfit, at least.\nYou're right here, tucked under my arms, so even if I fall, you won't roll away.
Brother...this outfit really is inconvenient, but...\nIt's a lot fluffier and cuter than my other outfits, don't you think?

To kill a dragon is the most grave sin a human can commit. That is what the dragons taught humanity, after all. And so humanity lived obeying dragons, honoring them, worshipping them. To humanity dragons were as their mother, their father, or their gods. Even among such a populace however, there comes a turning point.

A single human killed a dragon, and consumed its flesh. The blood and flesh of a dragon was enough to release a thrall from the dragon's brainwashing, and once this had begun, the effect spread and rippled through humanity in no time at all. Humans had rediscovered their wrath. They slew their mother, their father, their gods. They ate their flesh. The first human to have slain a dragon was revered as a hero.

A man once found himself in trouble on a mountainside, dearly injured. An old dragon noticed his plight, but his wings were in tatters, and he had no way to go for help. The dragon gave of his own flesh, that the man may eat it, and before long his injuries were healed and the man restored to full health.

Many humans flocked to the dragonslaying hero to study swordsmanship. The hero, finding himself so sought out, felt he had no choice but to take up his sword. It was a sword with a very odd shape, but despite their confusion, the people copied him. However, with such a sword, and such techniques, one could never hope to slay a dragon.\n\nIn this way he began his solitary fight to return to a world without such hostility and wrath.

Auntie, it's me, your favorite niece!\nI'm a member of Sage Wand of Secrets, now, for Ladies seeking more intellectual pursuits. Auntie, you've withdrawn so much since Uncle died, so I came to keep you company!
Oh, Auntie, were you awake? Ah, sorry, I just thought I'd have some tea and snacks.\n...What? You mean the Cabinet Minister gave you these? I see! That must be why they're so delicious!
Auntie, you hadn't finished this puzzle, yet?\nWell, I'll let the dogs in to play with them while you finish up, then! Huh? Don't let the dogs in the house? Aww, don't be like that!

I can't believe my Auntie just died like that... they said her blood pressure kept steadily climbing....\nStill, at least she didn't die alone and sad! She was just like she always used to be!\nAlongside the Sage Wand of Secrets, I'd like to die in such a way.

I, musician and husband of a priestess, set out to appease the Underworld.\nOnly the dead may enter its dark depths, but by playing the tune of "Elegy of the Underworld", I am able to set foot unharmed.\nLearning this tune was not an easy feat. Remembering my days of study under my many masters, I continued onward.

Having completed my mission, I returned to the world of the living. But what awaited me was a world stricken by a terrible plague.
Along with the suffering was my wife, with no hope of survival.
I did what I could to nurse her back to health.
Perhaps it was the guilt I felt for leaving her behind. For the loneliness I caused her while out on my journey.

Since my body had died once upon descending into the Underworld, I was immune to the effects of the plague.\nOne after the other, I watched all those around me die. It was then the time of my wife's own death.\nShe whispered something to me...and with that she passed on.

"I knew of your determination to write a magical melody. Otherwise you wouldn't have studied amongst many masters and practiced long into the night."\n"That is why I performed a miracle, and spread this disease across the land. To make it a place suited for melodies of gloom. So enjoy!"\nThe last remaining, I wander alone. Staring at the void above me, unintelligible words escaping my lips.

I'm a nerd, plain and simple.
I'm considered a nuisance, pretty much invisible in any group I join.
But there was this book. A rare edition that I needed to have.
So I hurried to the secondhand shop and stole it.

"What a read!" I turn each page excitedly, fatigue failing to succumb me.
The best part of the story was what happened after the main character, The Phoenix, awoke from his dream.
He beat those bullies to a pulp and even burned down the school!
This book gives me the courage to live!

Wait...no! Anything but that!
Why...Why did you rip my book?!
"All you do is read. No woman wants to date a creep living in a fantasy world."
You... All of you! You'll pay for this one day! I swear!

I'm reminded of an old banned-book that depicted a school burning to the ground. The students and faculty all dead.\nIt received attention as the main character, The Phoenix, burned down his school out of revenge for bullying he endured.\nI was lucky to read it before it was banned, though I earnestly debated whether to set my own school aflame.

Listen, my son. Today our excavations uncovered the tomb of a certain king.\nWe believe he was a man of virtue as there were tear jars, an amount greater than that was ever seen before. However, no record could be found of this.\nWhat a perfect opportunity! If I uncover the truth behind this king and present it to the academy, I can reclaim my position!

Listen, my son. Digging deeper into records, I've discovered this king's country was governed with injustice.\nI've become fully invested in unraveling the truth. It's quite possible that history had been falsified and his name stigmatized for future historians.\nWe'll see who gets the last laugh now! I'll show those fools how wrong they were about me!

Listen, my son. Since my discovery, I've been researching extensively and referring to experts. However, the accepting that history had been fabricated seemed unthinkable to them.\nI find this hard to believe, considering the sheer amount of tear jars at his grave. There must be more to this mystery. Some missing piece to the puzzle.\nWatch me, my son! Your father is going to make the greatest discovery the world has ever seen!

Hm? What is a tear jar, you ask?
It was once customary for attendees to place their tears in a jar at the funeral as a burial gift. Hence its name.
Oh? You think perhaps those jars are tears of joy, celebrating the end of his awful reign?
My, that's a ridiculous thought! Watch, my son! For I won't forgive this world for their unkindness towards me!

The girl is a blessing from God.
She feasts on fruit and drinks the blood of saints.
O' she who devours the flesh of her followers.
She who has descended from the heavens.
Please bestow us with your oracle!

Child without sin, child without wisdom.
Untainted by the world, innocent virgin.
I ask thy forgiveness as I serve you and only you.
I have defiled myself to protect your innocence.

The day you came into this world, I removed both your parents and doctor.
All that needs to be done, I have done for you.
You needn't learn a thing.
Child of God, even speech is beyond you.
Neither good nor evil resides inside you.\nThat is why I give my all to you.\nShall you, who lives pure and ignorant, utter a single word...that would be the oracle.

"I'd give my life to protect my country."\nThose words are all it takes to gain the trust of your superiors and earn the praise of those around you. Is it not?\nJust look at this huge sword I got. And I accomplished nothing of importance to get it.

To be honest, I wish I never got it.
I'm not as strong as the others, so I suck at swinging it.
Plus, if the enemy catches sight of me, I'll be mistaken as the top fighter and get targeted by the group.
I'm not a fighter. Just someone who likes to talk big.
Damn, did I mess up.

So then I got to thinking.
What can I use this huge sword for?
"When I perish on behalf of my country, I wish to have this sword, bestowed to me from the king, displayed next to my grave."
Yeah, I like the sound of that.

People will walk past my grave and think how honorable a swordsman I was.\nIt's decided then. I shall die the moment we engage in battle.\nI've gotten fed up with this whole fighting for my country act anyway.

Dear family, I'm home at last!
Haha! It's been ages since I've last seen my comrades from the knighthood, I've lost track of time.
Just a bunch of old men now with nothing to do but nag. But their hearts remain full of youth!
Eh? Must I go to sleep now?

Those boys sent me armor from our days in the knighthood.\nAh, the good o' days. Days of wielding my club and the fervor of adolescence.\nOh! My wife and son have returned. Eh? Stop playing around and help with the housework?
There's no end to the surprises! Those good fellas even sent me my favorite drink!\nWhat a fantastic way to end the day!\nEh? What do you mean you drank all of it?!

The man could no longer swallow his bitterness and mutilated the cause of it. He then called upon his old friends.\nEach of them pack a portion of the remains into a box and disposed of them individually without causing suspicion.\nTo hell with family! My buddies are all I need.

"And you call yourselves apprentices?! I need ingredients to make this potion! Get out and there and search, you frogs!"
Our master ordered us to scavenge the wilderness for ingredients.
As we, a group of us were caught by a ferocious wind, whipping them into the air.
Now what? I'm the only one left.

There standing where the winds clashed, was the Wind King.
He showed me no harm and instead wrapped me in a warm breeze, protecting me from the cold. What's more, he offered me food and water.
Though I could barely sense his presence, I was touched by his kindness.
I think...I might be in love.

"I can't go back. I'll only be put to work. Please, let me be your bride!"\nThe Wind King stayed by my side. I couldn't be happier.\nBut then my master, red in the face with anger, appeared flying on a broomstick. "Foolish apprentice! Come! It's time you returned!" I was then pulled aboard and off we flew.

Angered by this, gusts of fearsome winds roared in our direction. As a last resort, my master used magic to transport us.
It's been 10 years since then. I am now locked away as punishment for my behavior.
Whenever I feel a draft of wind coming from my prison's cracks, I wonder if it's the Wind King coming to rescue me. I get my hopes up only to feel despair minutes later.
But it's the only hope I have. The sound of the wind is what keeps me alive.

[Yusuf, the Innocent]\nDear Lord, please hear my wish! I'm in need of everlasting goods!\nI've done all I can, and still the orphans from the war continue to die! Please grant me wealth and abundance to save the lives of these children!

[Oliver, the Orphan]
Yusuf brought us so much food!
And he's gonna build a big, strong house too, he said!
I do miss my mama and papa... But I'm never sad when Yusuf's around!

[Randal, the Servant]
Yesterday was another night of debauchery.
He speaks of helping unprivileged children of the world, but the man's a hypocrite.
All he cares about is power and beautiful women. Everything is about him.

[Hartman, the Writer]\nMr. Yusuf had taken his own life with a sickle.\nBefore his death he told me, "I live in luxury and splendor. A life many can only dream to have. But I've lost my ability to walk on my own due to my weight and my own children are merely after my inheritance. I mistook life's greatest and everlasting treasure. That of unconditional love.
It's not as bad as I thought.\nAt first it felt tight, but the slits make it easier to move.
I don't care about fashion. But after wearing this, I might have grown a new appreciation for it.
How many more outfits will I wear?\nHow many times will I stain them in red?
Will it be my body or spirit that perishes first? The future is unknown.\nNo matter what happens, I won't forget the happiness I felt in this outfit.\nOr so I thought.
Like a little birdy, I'll continue to dance. Even if the one watching wishes for my death.
Another may see my dance as a prayer of blessings.\nBut my wish will not change.
I will pray, fight, and dance for my own sake. Even if my wish remains but a wish for all eternity.
Perhaps it is because I'm alone that it's never-changing. How about it? Would you like to dance with me?

[Disciple]
Thank you for taking me on as your disciple!
My older brother aspired to become a great flutist just like yourself!
He was a absolutely amazed by your skills, even your biggest fan!
Please, accept my gift.

[Disciple]
About my brother... He never had any talent.
That's why he respected you so much.
Oh, hang on. I'll go drop my things in my room.
Don't open the gift until I come back!

[Assistant]
Excuse me, sir? Who was that just now?
Oh! Your disciple? No, it should be someone else.
By the way, what's with that box there?
If it's a gift you should open—AH?!
N-no... You mustn't look, sir!

[Fake Disciple]
I told you not to open it.
You know, my brother was fascinated by you. You rejecting his request to learn from you sent him into despair. And then he killed himself.
I want to add your head to the collection of disciples and offer it to my brother's grave.
Isn't it fun? Oh, I can't wait to dance to the flute from the other world!

There once was a very popular circus elephant.
It could walk on a ball, draw, and shake hands with the audience. A very clever elephant indeed.
The circus leader looked into the elephant's eyes.
"You, my friend, are a star."

The circus is in full swing today.
In front of the audience's eyes is the clever elephant.
It walks on the ball, draws pictures, and shakes the audience's hands.
The circus leader looked into the elephant's eyes.
"Thank you for making this day spectacular."

The circus was out of customers.
No one cared about the elephant. It had become old news.
The elephant continued to work in the empty tent.
The circus leader looked into the elephant's eyes.
"It's okay. Don't be so hard on yourself."

With tears in his eyes, the leader said to the elephant, "I'm sorry. I'm unable to feed you anymore."
The elephant then got up on his ball and let out large roar. The leader's tears were that of joy.
"You really love the circus, don't you?"
Then the elephant trampled on his leader.

A crossbow, a national treasure of a certain kingdom, was capable of shooting two arrows.\nIt was rare and gorgeous, and could fire in two separate directions. This bow was handed down from generation to generation by the kings of the kingdom.\nHowever, one of the arrows went missing when the previous king gave birth to a heir.

The king had passed away and the crowned prince was to take the royal throne.
Before becoming the rightful heir, the prince searched for the lost arrow, but to no avail. And thus the coronation ceremony had arrived.
It was that day a man came to the palace with the lost arrow.
Without hearing him out, the prince seized the arrow and banished him.

The man who had brought the arrow was the son of the previous king.
He was the prince's twin, hidden away in a far off country by his father.
The king had to follow the lore of the crossbow, and thus had to send one of his sons away.
This secret was kept to preserve the king's lineage.

Years later the country was attacked and destroyed.
It was by the same man who had returned the missing arrow as revenge for the kindness he had offered.
The lore goes on to say that when these arrows are shot, they will one day return.
However, where they travel is unknown.

The rain poured down from the skies, it seemed the heavens would fall upon the earth. Unable to withstand the surge, Negra had finally collapsed.\nSensing an opportunity, I stole an expensive mallet and took off.
The mallet was incredibly heavy. It proved difficult to carry myself.\nBut I pushed on regardless.

Ducking into the darkness, I gazed upon the mallet's glow.
Oh, how beautiful it was.
And delicious... Chomp!
Oh, so sweet indeed.

Hm?
Why are these ants carrying candy canes?
How dare they indulge themselves when humans are here in poverty!
Ungrateful insects! I'm gunna crush you!

The man squeezed the trigger gently...what came after was swift and silent.
The man at the gun's muzzle collapsed before he had a chance to realize what had happened.
The shooter lost interest in the usual scene and turned on his heels.
The only sound heard was that of a bird's flapping wings.

"Another one gone down quietly... Bravo, my friend."
"It's only the silencer..."
The broker's mouth curled into a vile smile. But just as the man tried to leave with his reward—
"I've got another job. How 'bout it?"

It was a cleverly laid trap.
It all began at the location of the man's next target.
"——!!!!"
A cry that was cursed——gangrene—had struck the man.
However, the man felt not an itch, and pulled the trigger of his beloved gun.

The broker screamed at the man, but his words were not heard as he pointed the gun to his head.
The bullet, quiet but surely, reached its target.
And as a reward, he'd lose all hearing.
But this brought the man joy. He could read lips just fine.
And now he could ignore all the sounds of the world he hated to hear.
I see. So you're a burglar.\nTake what you want. And while you're at it, take my hammer and bash my head with it.\nPlease end my dreams of the ancient city.
Why am I saying this?\nBecause the moment I came to this ancient city, my heart was broken. I can't stand anything anymore.\nI wanted to make a name for myself here, but now look at me. I'm pathetic.

Hey, can you take over my life for me?
We look so alike, it shouldn't be hard to impersonate me.
I bet you could do more with yourself than just mugging.
Oh, the Knights have arrived. Just pretend you're me.

You Knights thought he was me and brought him in, eh?\nWell, I have a bad habit of smashing the heads of women I see on the street at night.\nBut thanks to that dumbass, the dream of the ancient city continues...

[Young Man]
A senior student in the dorms shoved an obscene magazine in my face.
I smiled as I took it, but threw it in the trash once I got back to my room.
Everyone has been tempted by the devil, but I won't let it corrupt me!

[Young Man]
I was astonished at the notice I received from the School of Knights.
It said they would be accepting girls from this year!
There were already girls in the classroom, their sweet scent lingering in the air...
This communion of flesh is an abomination! We're being corrupted!

[Young Man]
One of the girls called me away from the crowd and handed me a letter with chocolates.
Then, she squeezed my hand gently.
Nooo... This exchange of flesh is an abomination!

[Doctor]
"This one's also ineligible." The doctor sighed and turned off the power to the culture pod, where electrodes floated in the brain.
In order to complete our project of artificial birth of the next generation of gods, an elemental body with a soul to withstand temptation is required.
So far none have passed the test of "The Fallen Soul".
Now then, how will our plans go?
Oh! Nice to meet you.\nDid you know? This place used to be a scenic town, until one day a hot crystal burst from the ground.\nIt exploited every last resident.

What do I mean by exploit?\nThe crystal connects us through a collective consciousness, forcing us to share our memories and senses.\nOn the bright side, it means we won't starve or grow old. We don't feel lonely either.

We share a common dream. A dream where every one of our secrets are openly and randomly revealed.\nOur hobbies, habits, sexual activity, all the things you can't tell others.\nThat's what "exploitation" is.

Huh? You want me to hand over a man who escaped to this town right before the crystal burst?
No way. We're all connected to each other.
That includes "you".
See? The crystal is embedded in your leg as well.
Now it's your turn to be exploited...

I heard the old man who moved in next door has a physical disability.\nI want to be friends with him, but he ignores me whenever I say hello and he's not entirely easy to get along with.\nWhat I don't get though is why he would move out to this snowy countryside? It's not like he has any relatives here.

Haha, of course! I'd be happy to help you find your lost dog.
And if you'd like, I'll join you around the neighborhood next time, too.
I'm always getting into arguments with my brother over splitting our inheritance.
I wish we could stop bickering and get along. But I want to get along with you too, sir!

H-hey... What are you doing robbing my house?!
Does it look like I have any money?! Oh, I get it. My brother paid you crooks, huh?
Well, if you're here to murder me, get on with it then.
Kill me and claim your lousy money selling our ancestors' mountain!

—I shouldn't be alive right now.
The bullets that flew through the window that day were a direct hit to each of the crooks' heads.
It wasn't long after that the old man moved away.
Maybe it was him who saved me. And in reality, he was a sniper faking his disability.
I don't wanna expose him or anything, I just wish to know if he's okay.

I may not be all up there, but I try think before I act.
I was looking up at the night sky when I realized something.
All those stars up there are gonna fall down one of these days.
And if that happens, it'll be the end to our village!

I tried to tell the villagers, but they just yelled at me sayin' "If you got time to think about nonsense, get back 'teh workin' the fields!"
They left me no choice but to seek a sage in the forest.
He spoke of some sorta "gravity" thing, but it was all gibberish to me.
Now what?

So I went to the capital to deepen my insight with books and to hear from scholars.\nRight now, I've got this hypothesis that this planet is part of something much bigger. And whatever that is, it keeps on expanding.\nI think this may just be the answer to my question that day.

Request upon request I got of people wishing to become my disciple. So I decided to open an academy to teach the younger generation.
Some people refer to me as a "sage," but they have it all wrong.
I'm just a man living out my misery.
My youth, give your days to learning.

You can open that book if you'd like, but you can't take a peek inside.
If you do, you'll meet a demon from the abyss and be turned into one just like it.
"Peek? And how do you peek at a book?"
Come here, I'll show you.
There's a small window on the cover you can look through.

"Ohh, so that's what you mean."
He took a peek and saw the demon.
"I think the eyes looking back at me are the demon's."
"But what's that?"
I think you underestimated that there demon. I never said it couldn't come out of the book.

See what you've down now? The demon comes closer because it saw you take a peek.\nIt could be today, tomorrow, or perhaps the day after. But it will come to get you.\n"Even if it does, there's no way it can escape from this tinny window."

"I knew it. The demon is just the picture on the book's cover."
I think you should look closer.
Was there really a demon behind that small window?
No... It was a small mirror reflecting your own image.
You've become one of them now.
That bird continues to live a lonely life.\nWith it's burning body, it could not be touched.\nIt has seen many deaths through its immortal years.

It was a quiet and gentle bird.\nIt slept next to those freezing in the cold, and offered to cook meat to those starving.\nThose saved by the bird were grateful, but none had the ability to heal its loneliness.

There was a child lost in the forest late at night, on the verge of being eaten by a beast.
The bird saved the child and led the way through the dark back to their home.
The child's parents were wealthy aristocrats, and as a token of their thanks, they made the bird a magnificent staff.
It had a stone statue of a bird and a crystal resembling a flame.
The moment the bird saw it, it chirped happily.

It was a chirp of courtship, only to be given to the one you share an eternal life with.
A beautiful voice that only the chosen mate would be allowed to hear.
However, the voice confused the aristocrats and they died in agony.
The bird then flew away with its staff, never to be seen again.

There was one soldier who would never smile. Adoring him for his honestly, the king made him the palace guard.\nThe king was a man of many tastes, especially his love for comedy, offering rewards to any comedians who could make him laugh.\nBut even the best out there failed to do so.

One evening, the soldier was approached by the king's mistress, she asked, "Would you like to spend the night?"\nThe soldier swung his club exclaiming, "How dare you disrespect our king!" and bruised her beautiful face.\nFurious, the king had him imprisoned.

The young castle jailer, aspiring to be a comedian, found it odd that he could not crack a chuckle from this soldier.\nUsing the soldier as a challenge, he practiced day after day on a performance to get the man laughing. Then at long last, he came up with a joke that made the man smile.

Having cooled his temper, the king appeared at the cell and was astonished.
"The man who does not smile smiles indeed. He is an imposter!" the king declared, and ordered his execution.
The jailer, who assisted in the soldier's escape was also ordered to be executed.
Since then, the king became a tyrant, bludgeoning to death those who made a poor joke without laughing.

As a priest, I've grown tired of consulting with the congregation daily.
You can't just talk to them, you've got to show respect and be considerate.
Fishing is how I refresh myself from the stress.
Humming a little tune, I threw my line out into the mountain's stream. Afterwards, I prepared the silver fish that I caught.
"Thank you Lord for this meal." But just as I was about to bite into the skewer, my teeth clamped onto thin air.

There before me was a thin middle-aged woman chomping on the skewer she had snatch from me. Her emotionless eyes stared at me.\n"What's wrong? Are you one of our parishioners?"\nShe took another bite into the skewer and said, "I am. Don't you recognize the faces of those believing in your jurisdiction?"

"Oh! Yes, I remember you. You often come in for confession!"
Shouting my excuse, I took a step back feeling something eerie about the situation.
As I did, I bumped into something. Turning around, it was a boy with dark eyes.
"I was bullied into handing over money. I came to you about it..."
Footsteps echoed in the distance. One after another, I was surrounded with people, eyes filled with rage.

"My mother could have been saved if she were to have seen a doctor."
"I needed your help from the bully."
Funds, arbitration...
That's when I realized.
I had dismissed all their concerns and now they were in a realm they could not return from.
I was then thrown into the mountain stream and devoured by silver fins.

When I got drafted, I faked an illness so I'd get reassigned to the rear support unit.\nThere I was introduced to an old man by my captain.\nHe said, "Listen up. If I catch you being rude to this man here, you'll regret it."
It was obvious why my captain and the rest of the squad cared so much about this man.\nThe self-proclaimed "wizard" could make a heavenly tasting drink gridding beans with his machine.

The old man told me how much I looked like his grandson, and then offered to show me how to use his machine.\nAfter that, I took a pillow to his mouth and suffocated him, making it look like he died of illness.\nNow I'm the only one able to make the drink...

But the drink I grounded didn't taste as good.
Was it the beans? Did it have to be a specific kind...?
But the dead can't speak, so I could never ask.
And then I was sent to the front lines and feel under fire...

Those who profit from war are arms dealers.
They're the real winners, gaining profits without needing to throw themselves into battle.
Behind the scenes, however, are the ones who work day in and day out producing these weapons.
Those makers are orphans. Feeling sorry for these orphans the merchant offered them jobs.

Morning until night they slaved away.
They'd gather iron from the junk pile and haul it away.
There was no end to the children's exhaustion.
If things continued this way, what could they hope for their future? Feeling this impending danger creeping up on them, the children decided to take action.

It happened some time ago. The war had begun to grow and the merchant feared that his country too would be caught up in the bloodshed.
But in order to take his family somewhere safe, he needed more money.
In a panic, he ordered double the production of weapons.
He didn't wish this, but it was the only choice he had.

The children pierced the merchant with the weapons they made.
His final words being, "If only I'd saved my family."
Hearing that, the children then set out to kill the rest of his bloodline.
As a result, a children-only arms dealer was born, but were crushed in the Great War.
Although they were great at producing weapons, they lacked the skills to protect themselves.
It is said that these dresses were first made of linen, but over time the usage of silk also became of fashion.
Silk is a common material nowadays, but I'm intrigued who would try to collect the threads of insects to make clothes.
Not only that, but the first person to eat a wild mushroom without fear of death is another marvel. Curiosity can be a scary thing.
