But I should be thanking my predecessors, for if it weren't for their challenging attempts I wouldn't be able to wear such smooth clothing.
This outfit's so cool! Look!\nIt's even got a red hood! It's like it was made for me!\nThe design on the skirt is super cute, too!
I like this place.\nIt's a huge mountain covered with trees!\nThere's so many things to do here!
Hm, what should we try first...?\nHide n' seek's gotten boring.
Huh? I can't stay here?\nI don't wanna go back to the Library! You can't make me!\nNot until you play with me!

The boy was born and raised in the slumps.\nHe grew up witnessing the dirty side of people and society, and despaired in this cruel world.\nWhen he caught a glimpse of a sword being sold by a street vendor, he was mesmerized by it.

Returning home his face twisted at a foul smell.\nIt was the stench of rotten bodies, his entire family had hung themselves.\nAimlessly wandering about, the boy found himself in front of that stall again, staring at the large sword.

The street vendor saw the boy and asked if he wanted the sword.
Surprised, the boy blinked before finding the words to answers.
"I was just looking. I don't have any money," he said.
The street vendor narrowed his eyes and replied, "Nonsense. I believe the sword has already chosen you."

With the great sword in hand, the boy disappeared somewhere crossing time and space.
Some were called Caesar, Arthur, or Robin Hood and hailed as heroes.
But in the end they all lost their honor and fell to ruin.
"Do you still want to take this sword with you?"
The boy's chest pounded, letting out a heave. And with a hard swallow, he reached out towards it...

[Settler]\nTwo ferocious deer brothers inhabiting the forest were giving us some real trouble.\nWe carefully drew up a plan to capture them, and we did snag the younger one... But it came at a great cost.

[Settler]
"It's a shame we missed the other, but we'll 'em tomorrow."
So we tucked in for the night with renewed determination. Until we were suddenly awoken by a commotion in the middle of the night.
It was the elder brother deer attacking us.

[Settler]
In the midst of the chaos, the elder brother rushed towards its sibling locked in a cage.
When kicked, the cage plummeted down and was crushed to death.
The elder deer left nowhere to be seen.
We had nothing but respect for him, giving his brother a honorable death and leaving resolutely.

[Old man who speaks to animals]
You wanted your brother dead?
Because he was sleeping with your wife while you were fighting the settlers? But when she confessed after his capture, you didn't have it in you to kill him directly?
Hahaha! My, all beautiful stories have the most revealing truths.

My family, you see...
Seems that we used to be a well-known clan.
Should've been around the time when the sun stopped rising in this country, yes?
Now it all has fallen...
The only thing left for me is this old-fashioned spear.

In any case, what could this spear have been used for?
It's heavy with a odd embellishments.
Even so, whether hit it or scrape it,
it won't make a sound.
If it could shine, at least it would be useful in the dark.

What's that? A princess from the moon country is will make a visit?
Speaking of moon beings, they can't stand sunlight.
At any rate, this is my chance to fulfill my destiny!
Hey, Princess! Look here!
I might be a good-for-nothing, but I possess a strange spear!

Ah. That spear is a terrifying weapon that destroyed the country.
In order to welcome a girl from the moon country, the king shook ignored the opposition of the people
and forced all sunlight into this spear.
It'd been missing for hundreds of years since then...
How ironic that it will bring the country to ruin once more.

Now is the time for rebellion while all the main shoguns are on an expedition.
But if we do this, I want a guarantee.
I heard that if you cut this torrent in two with a sword, you can see the future.
Right! So I will try it!

The moment I slashed through thee torrent, an picture came to mind.
My wife and daughters were enjoying the castle garden together...
That means the rebellion will be a sure success!
Good! Time to raise the troops!

Unthinkable!
The rebellion was foreseen and I was stabbed in the back!
All the lords who promised to raise troops in support have turned away.
What do I do now?

I was imprisoned.
I climbed up to the lattice window near the ceiling and saw a familiar scene.
It was my wife and daughters, who are the mistresses of the king, living at ease.
Ah, was this sight that the sword showed me...!

The definitive last word in the prolonged war between mankind and demons.\nBowing to the wishes of the people, the hero to the throne, becoming a unifier the likes of which had never yet been seen.\nBrandishing the axe responsible for striking the final blow against the dark king, the hero swore an oath to protect the newfound peace.

In response to the hero’s decrees, recovery efforts began all across the land.\nAt first, the people tried to cooperate, but they were long accustomed to their insular clans and friction soon developed.

Small frustrations grew over time until a small matter lit the spark that sent the clans hurtling towards another conflagration.\nThe hero leapt astride, galloping from clan to clan and imploring the people not to squander the newfound peace.\nBut as they stubbornly clung to their old squabbles, the hero knew that mere words would not suffice, if peace were to be salvaged.

Then, one day, all was suddenly put right.\nThe Great Unifier then took one person from each clan in marriage, promising to treat each spouse equally.\nSeveral heirs were born, leading some to worry the question of succession would spark the conflict anew, but the hero's Oath to maintain peace seems likely to hold for a while yet.

Town Beauty:
I do suppose I may be moving a teensy little bit too fast, inviting someone in when we’ve only just met.
I hope you don’t hold it against me, though,
you just look so much like my late husband! Teehee.

Boy Next Door:
Can you believe it? That lady next door kept inviting guys over, tying them up, drugging them, and letting them waste away.
Then she ended up setting her house on fire and herself, with it...
Huh. Looks like there’s a gun in the burned wreckage. I guess I’ll go turn it in tomorrow.

Wife Next Door:
 Welcome home, Honey. Dinner’s just about ready!
Honey? Um, why are you tying me up? I wouldn’t mind spicing things up a bit, but...
Honey, please! At least let me put out the fire in the stove, before—!

Little Brother:
Geez, you think you know someone...
I can’t believe my straightlaced brother and sister-in-law both died in a tragic bondage-related housefire.
There wasn’t much left in the ashes, but I suppose this odd looking gun can be a memento...

Why am I so drawn by the darkness? Why does it call to me so?\nWell, I suppose it might be because the darkness is kind enough to conceal even an outcast heretic like myself.\nSomeone without even a home village to return to. It was destroyed, burned to ashes in the fires of war, leaving me as the only survivor.

Of course, that means I've lost not only my home, but my family. Father, mother, all of them...burned to ash as surely as the village itself.\nAnd because I've wandered ever since, I'm just as alone as the day it happened. Not a single person I've ever met is still in my life.

Honestly, some days I'm not sure this... My life, all of it, the whole thing... Some days I'm not sure it isn't all some kind of illusion.\nMaybe I'm really back there in the war, among the dead and the dying, living out this delusion in the final delirious moments before death.

There's no such thing as me, no other people, not even the world. And even if all that stuff does exist, I know for damn sure there's no point to any of it.
That's why I've taken up this spear, why I've shattered the pillar that holds up the heavens.
All so I could stand here as it all crashes down around me with a violent roar, pulling me into the darkness.
I've never heard anything that sounded quite so good.

The Star: Sole Survivors
Actually, there were two beings who dwelt upon that star.
All others had been destroyed.
We decided to observe the remaining two.

They were male and female, one each, and seemed to be somehow immortal.
They lived through thousands of lives in a single cycle, as far as we could tell.
They met, they fell in love, the courted, they cohabited, the married, they let their love grow cold, they slipped into an indifferent relationship,
and then they did it all over again, from the beginning.

Within the closed loop of their love, they passed an infinite number of days together.
However, it is beginning to seem as if there could be a limit on this time, after all.
They noticed us, and spoke.
They've begged us to set them free of the cycle.

We decided to leave off our observations, and attempt to save them. It took only one solid stroke of the runesword to end both their lives.
They both looked so peaceful in death.
Still held in each other's arms, their bodies crumbled into the earth.
Though they'd been freed from the endless cycle of their love, in the end each never let go of the other.
Perhaps that was the answer they discovered somewhere within those infinite lives.
In the end though, it turns out you really can't buy happiness. You can buy relationships, but only superficially. Money won't change how people feel about you, in their hearts.
So, it's true, you can't buy love. You can't even really buy class. Seems there's an awful lot of things you can't get by hoarding money, and happiness? Well, happiness is chief among them.

You need strength to find happiness is the dull places of the world. You need luck to happen upon it by chance. It takes patience and work to keep it once you've got it, and it takes humility and self control to tough it when happiness is hard to come by. At least, it does if you want to do it without hurting everyone around you.

Happiness is always right where you are, if you're able to see it, and it comes in all kinds of shapes and sizes. Happiness is in your heart, and you find its outlines through the connections you have with the people you love. Money can't get you any of that.

When you selfishly try to force your will and desires on others, that's violence. A blunt instrument, indelicate in the extreme. But when you hurt someone out of love? It matters how they feel. It matters how the both of you feel.
For the one doing the hurting, they're careful to watch their counterpart's reactions, eager to understand the depth of feeling there.
For the one in pain, they're offering a gift, showing a level of trust and vulnerability that they'd never give to a person they didn't truly love.
It's an experience that neither could ever have on their own. Poignantly mutual. A relationship like that... well, I think it's worth quite a lot.

"You have to save her!"
Carrying my dying pet in my arms, I burst into the vet's office.
She asks me to explain and my words tumble out in a rush.
"I...I...She...A mace fell from the table! It hit her!'

The vet quickly examines my dog, and orders an emergency operation.
I'm wracked with worry but after all the long hours of waiting, everything goes well.
"I feel fine," my dog tells us, "sorry to worry you."
The vet and I just stare in shock. My dog is talking!

"We dogs love living in partnership with you humans," my dog muses a few moments later, "but it might be nice to have a country of our own, too."\nShe stops nibbling on her chew toy and looks at me. "Do you think they'd let us have a little land?"\nNeedless to say the vet was beside herself with excitement over my pet's sudden ability to speak. She started rhapsodising about the possible causes and future possibilities, exhorting me to write with her to the capital university about these findings.

I frowned, and then knocked my dog on her head a second time. 
She trembled a bit, before barking at me in annoyance.
"What have you done?!" wailed the vet, twisting her hands in her hair. "You've erased a scientific miracle!"
"Yeah, but I don't care about any of that," I said, picking up my dog. "I don't want to be a scientific emissary, I just wanna be her owner."

There was once a man hailed as the greatest blacksmith in the world. This man journeyed to see the witch of the woods, professing to her his desire to devote his life to the pursuit of his craft. The witch flashed an unsettling grin, before assuring him she would indeed grant his wish, and in the next moment the man found himself transformed into a blacksmith's hammer.

Taking her new hammer, the witch forged rare metal into one magic artifact after another. The hunters who plied their trade in the forest carried news of her far and wide, until travellers began arriving from near and far to petition her to craft a weapon for them.

One day, a young boy was abandoned in the woods, his parents unable to feed him. He wandered until he found the witch's cottage, but stumbled back in fright as soon as he caught sight of her absorbed in her forging, a devilish smile twisting her lips. The witch looked up at the sound, pinning him with her eyes, and the boy panicked. In his terror, he shoved her, hoping to escape, and she dropped the hammer in her surprise. Scrambling, the boy lunged to pick it up before she could.

As soon as his fingers found the hammer's haft, the soul of the blacksmith imprisoned in the hammer flooded into him, as it had overtaken the witch.\nThe last thing the witch saw was the boy as he raised the hammer high, blank-eyed as a doll.\nIn the end, the boy enjoyed a long career as a blacksmith, and the poor soul trapped within the hammer created masterpiece after masterpiece, unseen and unacknowledged by anyone.
[Heart's Child]\nHey, Mister, did you kill someone again? Hmph, then you'll have to taste my arrow, I guess!
[Heart's Child]\nDoes your heart not hurt, even after so many arrows? I won't stop shooting you until you stop killing, Mister!
[Heart's Child]\nI'm not gonna give up. I'm gonna keep shooting my bow until you have a change of heart, until you learn to mourn the passing of your fellows!

[Vigilante]\nI finally put an end to that vicious murderer! But it seems so strange... Just as I was levelling my bow at him, his expression seemed so at peace, as if he'd always wanted to be punished for his crimes...As if he wanted release...
You and I are not the same.\nNot in looks, nor form, nor philosophy.\nThe differences may be big or small, but they are absolute.
You and I are not the same.\nWe could not so much as imagine the same apple, if we tried...\nany more than we could be said to have the same life experiences.
If I am the one who is in the right...\nIf that is so, then should not everyone else BE the same as me?\nIf they persist in choosing to be different, what then ought I believe in?
Answer me. You ought to know the answer.
Why do people insist on saying I have to accept reality? In my mind, in my fantasies, everything is exactly the way I want it to be.
What is there to reality? Reality doesn't give me any way to protect Brother from atrocity, disaster, and all the myriad calamities and injustices of the world.

And in reality, you're forced to grow old. You can't escape it. In reality, something would eventually force me apart from Brother. It would be inevitable. I don't want anything to do with a world like that.
People tell me I need to face the truth. They try to push their ideas of justice on me. I'd really like to know where they get the nerve...

He would have been the most worthy hero by far, out of all of us in the company, if only the guy'd had a bit more grace. Or sense. I mean, can you believe he got himself spotted on a recon mission, and then instead of hightailing it, he faced them down like a hero in some sort of epic song. Lost his head for his troubles. Literally.

Dunno if I can blame him though. Gotta say, after all the defeat we've been getting for the last forever, an honorable death doesn't sound too bad right about now, and I'm not the only one thinking it. Well, once my mind got to wandering in that direction, what do you know but I see that brave dead fool in dream, tellin' me to get my act together, and remember my 'pride as a soldier,' or some such.

So I got all the men together, and we got ourselves out of dodge. Turned up across the first neutral border we found and asked for asylum. When you think about it, death really is the coward's way out, isn't it? When I think about my pride as a soldier, the one thing it's sure not gonna survive is sacrificing any more of my men to that doomed cause.

'Couple decades later, when the whole mess was over I went back to pay my respects. What do you know, I find that guy's gravestone, and let's just say it's a lot less spartan than I was expecting. They really went all out. I ask the guy who managed the cemetery who got him that tricked out grave and he said the guy visited him in a dream and told him to build it. Said I'd be good for it.\n\nThe nerve of that guy!

The guide held the wand, and dipped the oar again. The pointed prow of our boat sliced across the water, swift and quiet. These canals, flowing with healing waters, crisscrossed the landscape heading in every possible direction.

I felt eyes on my back and turned, gaze meeting that of a woman who must have gotten on the boat some time ago. We smile at each other, and I offer my hand. Before long the two of us are dancing on the boat's deck.

When I look up again, I see an elderly couple climbing on board. A mother with a cute little child boards after them. Every one of us is wearing a serene expression, smiling as if our worries no longer have any hold on us.

Spontaneously, we start singing in rounds, each in parts. One sings of jumping overboard, one sings of being doused by the waters, and some sing of holding family dear. It seems to all of us suddenly, that the lives we abandoned are terribly funny, and it's impossible not to laugh.\n\nNow, if you're all ready, let us sink peacefully into the healing waters!
I can solve all violence.\nSee? Even that stubborn old man\nis playing nicely with me.
Violence has been with everyone, ever since they were born. That must mean we need it, right? If it was there from the start?
People are violent with even the smallest of children, hitting them if they won't listen.
Some people say that's bad. They say violence is bad. But I know the truth. There's no one alive who hasn't used violence, at least once.
Sadness and sorrow are the same sort of thing, but...\nSadness feels sharper and is gone in a flash,\nwhile sorrow lingers for ages, a thin, pale shroud over your life.
Combining the two of them leads to a sort of misery. A state that melds every subtle flavor of both those melancholy feelings.
And unlike sadness and sorrow, though misery and melancholy are also words to describe feelings, they aren't the sort of words that get used very often in daily conversations. That's alright, though.
It's better to use them sparingly. I'd rather not cheapen them.

One day I received a letter from my vagabond father, long gone wandering, informing me that he'd found Khione's Festival Blade. I immediately set out to track him down, following what few clues I could uncover.

After a long time, I finally found my way to the legendary snow-capped mountain where Khione's Festival Blade was said to lie buried. Although the villagers who lived at the foot of the mountain insisted quite vehemently that the legend was no more than a tale, they had in fact seen someone matching my father's description start climbing the mountain.

The locals opened a path for me, through the blizzard they called Khione's Festival, and I climbed the mountain. The air grew thin and for a moment I feared I would faint, before mercifully I cam back to myself. When I did, I saw my father standing in front of me, holding his hand out towards me...

My father had been sealed inside that sword, that hung in the midst of the blizzard. 

"I suppose we're finally together, now." 

Even as the thought came to me, I realized that I was sealed within the sword, too. The whole mountain was contained within the sword, a great an unified entity...
What's a kid like you doing out this far?\nI see. Trying to see if you can find out how the world got like this, eh?\nMakes sense you'd be looking for the Tome of Scarlet Solace, then, I guess.

At the time, the book had been the place where I'd written down the results of my research into the Scarlet Solace. I, who had set myself to the task of revolutionizing space time itself. And...to get down to the main issue, while I was running all over space time looking into things, I found a certain little, well, let's say it's a gadget.
To try and explain it simply, the gadget is a thing that decided the parameters for the timeline. I was ecstatic. I thought I could alter time at will, as long as I had that.

You want to know why this little moment in time has stayed frozen like this for the last millennium? Well, it's because some idiot set all the parameters to zero! The past and the future are no more, we've been cut off from the rest of the timeline, and to top it off, we can't even die. Good job, me.

Dear, it's me! We see each other so often in the forest, don't we? The spirits gave me a human body, so i came to visit! I just couldn't stop thinking about that first time I saw you, bathing in the spring. You were so beautiful...

I'm done weeding the garden, Dear! Please, don't hesitate to tell me if there are any other chores you want me to help with. I came here for you, after all! I'll do anything, as long as I get to see you smile!
You're ready to abandon your husband and run away with me, Dear? Are you sure? I...I've never been so happy in my life! I swear, I'll make you happy! Wait for me tomorrow! I'll come get you!

I've just remembered something terrible. When I was in the forest, I was caught by someone terrifying and forced into this awful sexless body. They even cut off my horn, though that was really overdoing the metaphor at that point, if you ask me. Just leave me here. Forget I exist...

I've finally found the city I've been searching for! The legendary old capital, where the streets are paved with jade! The discovery made me delirious with joy! I ran to the square in the city center and sure enough, there it was, struck into the ground, the Red Jade Sword!

I just need to start moving some of the jade out and selling it. Once I've got a decent sum together I can hire some people and expand the operation! This is going to make me rich beyond my wildest dreams!

If you've got enough money, you can buy anything! All the necessities of life and most of the stuff that isn't necessary! You just gotta be bold, like I was! Hah! These are the best days of my life! I'll never stop smiling!

The streets are seriously paved with the same red jade, though! The town all around is red jade, all the people have turned into red jade...\nIs...is the whole world nothing but red jade, now? Please! Someone! If anyone else is out there, please answer me!

This is a story of a man who once was a god...\n\nFar above the land where mortals dwell sat the realm of the gods. There dwelt a certain deity who was fond of war, of the battle to reign supreme. To this war god, mortals were but playing pieces in his favorite war game.

This is a story of a man who once was a god...\n\nOne day, the war god fell in love with a human woman whose fate had become entwined with the outcome of a war. He decided thenceforth to descend to the mortal realm and influence the outcome of the fighting. He would become one of the game pieces.

This is a story of a man who once was a god...\n\nThe war god donned the fleshly shell of a mortal and fought as a soldier. Fought, and achieved victory. The losing side of the war was looted mercilessly, robbed of vast quantities of its people and its riches alike. The riches were carried off and the people sold away as slaves.

This is a story of a man who once was a god...\n\nAs the god took in the glow of his victory, his mortal love came to him. She had been grievously wounded in the fighting. If he'd been in is divine form, he might have healed her in the blink of an eye. The god, now a man, stayed and took care of her for all the rest of his mortal days.
The bullets fired from the Gust Gun are so swift, they cannot be observed by the naked eye. This gun, devised by a talented sorcerer, spread across the world practically overnight.

After it did, just as quickly there were some who began to rise in opposition to the gun's hideously unnatural swiftness. The movement spread, and the populace began to regard speed itself with suspicion.
Couriers no longer galloped their horses as fast as they could go. People saw swift birds on the wing and shot them down, fearing them to be a sorcerer's familiar.

Even as the world began to slow, however, there were some who continued to use the Gust Gun, some who adapted themselves to its swiftness. In time, the slower members of the general populace became unable to process the speed of these holdouts. became unable to sense their existence at all.\n\nIf someone standing right next to you ever happens to suffer a sudden and unexplained death, it might be the work of one of these.
Look, will you please just sell me the sickle? I've got some grass needs cutting! YES I'm sure I want to buy it! I've just moved and I've got a lot of weeds to clear out of my new yard!
What exactly do you think I "don't understand," huh? What does that even mean?! This is no way to talk to a customer! Find someone who knows how to do their job and THEY can sell me the sickle!

Gods, why couldn't you just have sold it to me the FIRST time I asked? These people! Some nonsense about scythe's being sacred to the god of death. "It's like petitioning the god to grant you license to kill." Seriously?! I just. want. to. cut. my. lawn!

Hah! Take that! See how easy it is to mouth off to customers now that you're dead! Heh, I showed that guy. Ngh...but I'm feeling awfully strange...the blood is pounding in my head...Wh...what happened? Where'd this body come from? He was just...I was just...f-fine, it's fine. I've already paid after all. And hey, I've got the sickle, maybe the god'll overlook it?
Frostgiant:\nGraaaahh! Curse you! How dare you! Disonorable! You would torment and mock me, now that I can no loner move?! Just kill me! Let me die, let me die, let me dieeeee!!
Frostgiant:\nDamn you, doing whatever you like now that I can't move to stop you! Why do my cursed limbs no longer obey me?!
Frostgiant:\nNow we come to this...hollowed out by hunger, I approach my end at last. My spirit will curse you from the depths of hell for this, you curr!
Father:\nHeh, did you here that honey? He's acting out the final moments of that popsicle he dropped! We've got a natural actor on our hands here. Don't cry, son, I'll buy you another
